JobTitle: Senior Product Marketing Manager (Data, AI, Platforms and Sy...
Content_text:
Senior Product Marketing Manager (Data, AI, Platforms and Systems)
As a member of the Product Marketing team, you'll design go-to-market strategies and value-based messaging, including positioning statements, value propositions, prioritized messages, and CTAs, that are intentional, relevant, and consider the overall end-to-end experience for our key customer segments.
To succeed, you will need to get to know Expedia’s customers and market as well as understand the needs of our internal teams, who are the key partners intended to adopt and maximize the solutions built by DAPS. To do this, we believe insights and data are fundamental, so you will also manage the coordination of research, identify trends, and socialize these observations in a meaningful way to drive a large product organization deliver solutions people love to use.
This role requires exceptional communication and collaboration skills. Due to the entrepreneurial nature of the position, we are looking for members who can help build and scale the team, operating at both a strategic and detailed execution level. Our ideal candidate is creative and collaborative, loves data, pays close attention to detail, is passionate about travel, and has a proven record of delivering results and driving ideas from planning through execution.
Lastly, you'll promote launch activities by coordinating communications and facilitating internal readiness. You will develop content and documentation that supports the entire company, including FAQs, blog posts, landing pages, knowledge articles, and other training materials.
What you’ll do:
Become a customer specialist. Study the global market, examine competitors, gather customer feedback, and analyze market trend data to identify customer needs and scope market opportunities
Develop GTM strategies, timelines, and goals. Identify target audiences and define key segments for planned product launches. Drive goal alignment and measure success of GTM initiatives by delivering on key factors to get results
Encourage exceptional end-to-end customer experiences. Help influence the product roadmap based on what our consumers want, need, and value to build long-term customer advocates, drive business value, and boost customer lifetime value for overall brand Expedia
Build value-based messaging frameworks that resonate with our key customers and ladders to our overall brand and organization promise
Orchestrate internal readiness across the organization and support teams as they prepare content for launches. Ensure everyone is educated on how the product works, its timeline, and how we talk about it. Review and provide feedback on training and marketing materials provided to support launch
Promote the product. Determine its product market fit and craft an appropriate, well-timed communications plan that will socialize the product and help users understand its features and key benefits
Coordinate feedback loops to drive the identification and assessment of future product opportunities
Who you are:
3+ years of product marketing or outbound marketing experience within a global internet, ecommerce, or SaaS company
Experience leading large, sophisticated projects that require consensus across a wide number of teams
Prioritizes outside-in thinking, putting the customer at the heart of decisions, processes, and outcomes
Thinks creatively and analytically. Has the ability to distill data, produce compelling business insights, and make impactful recommendations
Strong communication skills. Can also communicate technical solutions simply and convincingly to help drive initiatives
Works optimally in a fast-paced environment. Shows initiative and drive, while exhibiting exceptional prioritization and time-management skills
MBA and experience in the travel industry preferred
About Expedia Group
Expedia Group (NASDAQ: EXPE) powers travel for everyone, everywhere through our global platform. Driven by the core belief that travel is a force for good, we help people experience the world in new ways and build lasting connections. We provide industry-leading technology solutions to fuel partner growth and success, while facilitating memorable experiences for travelers. Expedia Group's family of brands includes: Brand Expedia®, Hotels.com®, Expedia® Partner Solutions, Vrbo®, Egencia®, trivago®, Orbitz®, Travelocity®, Hotwire®, Wotif®, ebookers®, CheapTickets®, Expedia Group™ Media Solutions, Expedia Local Expert®, CarRentals.com™, and Expedia Cruises™.
© 2021 Expedia, Inc. All rights reserved. Trademarks and logos are the property of their respective owners. CST: 2029030-50
Expedia is committed to creating an inclusive work environment with a diverse workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. This employer participates in E-Verify. The employer will provide the Social Security Administration (SSA) and, if necessary, the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) with information from each new employee's I-9 to confirm work authorization.

BA/BS degree
5+ years of contracts management, paralegal, or other comparable experience within a law firm or legal department
Experience negotiating contracts
Experience organizing, prioritizing, and managing multiple tasks of varying duration and complexity

Amazon's Legal Department is looking for a talented Contracts Manager to support Amazon Web Services, a dynamic and rapidly growing business within Amazon.com. Amazon Web Services is at the forefront of the "cloud" computing and service industry providing IT infrastructure services such as on-demand compute capacity, storage, content delivery, artificial intelligence and machine learning services, quantum computing, and more.

This Contract Manager will support Amazon Web Services' sales and marketing initiatives. The successful candidate will be responsible for reviewing, drafting, and negotiating IT agreements (including services agreements, subcontracting agreements, and other commercial contracts); providing day-to-day contracting advice to business team members; driving process improvements to simplify IT transactions from beginning to end; and other customer-facing activities.

This position involves direct contact with principal business owners. The successful candidate will have excellent written and oral communication skills and be inquisitive, enthusiastic about technology, enjoy working hard and being continually challenged, and demonstrate sound judgment even in ambiguous situations.

Amazon offers its Contracts Managers the opportunity to develop their experience and career with one of the world’s most recognized and dynamic brands. This position will be based in Seattle, WA.


Able to communicate effectively with cross-functional teams
Experience drafting contractual clauses
Able to exercise strong judgment even in ambiguous situations
IT contract experience
Project management experience

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. Microsoft Customer and Partner Solutions (MCAPS) is a business unit focusing on commercial segments, spanning across all Microsoft products and services and influencing sales teams world-wide.
The MCAPS controller is a strong finance partner who will be working in a results-driven, dynamic environment in a business area with a huge growth opportunity.
Cross-group collaboration with various finance groups at multiple levels of management.
Responsibilities
Responsibilities
Prioritization
Determines operating expenses compared to expected budget and projections. Identifies variances to provide insights to management and inform future projections. Verifies headcount accuracy.
Assists in the execution of annual business planning and forecasting process. Gathers insight and contributes to analysis and research to support preliminary and adjusted forecast cycles.
Serves as contact for questions related to transactions, reporting, planning, analysis, and compliance (e.g., close coordination, expenses, compliance with tax, statutory, and accounting regulations, filing requirements, etc.). Provides input for managing.
Partnership
Serves as contact for questions related to transactions, reporting, planning, analysis, and compliance (e.g., close coordination, expenses, compliance with tax, statutory, and accounting regulations, filing requirements, etc.). Provides input for managing Profit and Loss (P&L), including discussions to optimize operating expenses and headcount.
Applies foundational aspects of Microsoft Finance and Controllership (e.g., financial policies, accounting systems, key metrics, relevant statutory, tax, and accounting procedures, reporting, filing, and forecast requirements, etc.) to collect information, maintain compliance requirements, perform technical analysis, and complete standardized reporting. Assimilates impact of external factors and trends to offer insights.
Assembles and summarizes data through data mining and business intelligence to structure reports and financial models for decision support. Leverages statistical analysis, predictive analytics, and financial modeling techniques to conduct sophisticated analyses. Acts as subject-matter-expert for data management and operations. Understands history of data procurement, methods, and actions taken.
Leverages best-in-class technology (e.g., Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, Predictive Analytics etc.) to accomplish goals. Improves current methods used in collecting data, developing automated financial reporting and forecasting tools, and creating standard and ad-hoc reports. Learns how advanced technology is implemented in Finance and across Microsoft to provide greater depth of analysis.
Communicates results in a logical, compelling, and understandable message.
Protect
Reviews financial and budgetary reports to ensure accuracy and support of internal controls. Monitors accuracy of financial documents and execution of control processes. Performs corrective measures.
Ensures documentation and reporting is accessible for internal and external auditors (e.g., local governments). Facilitates dialogue between business stakeholders and internal audit team (shift partner organizations).
Ensures compliance with company policies, legal standards, and both regulatory and statutory reporting requirements by reviewing and monitoring accuracy of financial documents and control processes. Drives corrective measures. Prepares reports and filings for all country, federal, state, and local regulatory agencies. Prepares timely and accurate completion of all statutory and tax filings. Supports questions regarding documentation, policy adherence, and sharing of financial data and information.
Qualifications
Minimum Requirements
Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration, Accounting, Finance, Economics, Data Science or related field AND 2+ years post-graduate financial analysis, accounting, controllership, or finance work experience
OR Master's Degree in Business Administration, Accounting, Finance, Economics, Data Science or related field
OR equivalent experience.
Preferred Qualifications
Certified Public Accountant (CPA) or Association of Certified Chartered Accountant (ACCA) or equivalent certification.
Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.
Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

JobTitle: Instructional Designer, SAIF - Secure AI Foundations
Content_text:
5+ years direct experience in designing training content to include eLearning courses, instructor-led materials, job aids, system simulations, multimedia products (video, graphic, audio), and other training materials.
5+ years direct experience using eLearning authoring tools to build learning experiences that include assessments, interactive activities, animated videos, graphics and images, and text-based content. (Articulate Studio/Storyline, Camtasia, Adobe Creative Suite, and Vyond)
Solid project management skills including planning work, managing details, keeping multiple tasks/projects on track, using time well, and delivering results.
Excellent verbal, written, interpersonal communication abilities including skills in explaining technical topics to novices and collaborating with subject matter experts, global stakeholders, and managers.
Experience with coordination for global initiatives, including localization of training content.
Bachelor’s degree, industry certifications, or equivalent experience in learning design, learning science, instructional design, educational psychology, or similar field.
A work sample demonstrating your experience and skill using course authoring tools and instructional design theory will be will be required as part of the hiring process.

Job summary
Are you ready to join us in making AI accessible for all by creating engaging learning experiences for applied scientists and software development engineers?

Key job responsibilities
Who are you?


You are obsessed about the learner experience and high standards with a focus on ensuring the learner receives the right content at the right time.
You excel at taking complex topics and transforming them into easy-to-understand learning experiences using design thinking.
You can analyze incoming requests and recommend solutions focused on the needs of the learner and linked to key business outcomes.
You use eLearning authoring tools to build learning experiences that include assessments, interactive activities, animated videos, graphics and images, and text-based content.
You are curious and interested in learning new technologies, figuring out how thinks work, and exploring new developments in learning science, learning design, and learning technologies.

A day in the life
You will create engaging learning experiences aimed at helping Alexa applied scientists and software engineers use cutting edge machine learning tools. You will work closely with your customers as well as product development and design teams every day in order to build and improve upon these experiences.

Your efforts will help improve the machine learning models that power Alexa.

About the team
The Secure AI Foundations (SAIF) organization’s vision is to democratize AI, starting with Alexa, by making it intuitive and efficient to build, integrate, and operate AI that enforces security and privacy as foundational primitives. The SAIF organization is organized around six foundational services through the model experiment, build, train, and launch lifecycle: (1) ML Experience, (2) Data, (3) Compute, (4) GroundTruth, (5) Privacy, and (6) Security.


10+ years in developing intuitive learning solutions
Graduate degree in learning design, learning science, instructional design, educational psychology, or similar field.
Experience with machine learning, AI (artificial intelligence), big data, or similar discipline.
Experience using learning data to inform continuous improvement.
Experience working in a scrum-based development cycle.
Fluency (verbal and written) in French, Italian, German, Spanish, Portuguese, and/or Japanese.

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

Title: Supply Chain & Operations Direct Materials Senior Manager
Location: Negotiable
Travel: 80%
About Accenture:
Accenture is a global professional services company with leading capabilities in digital, cloud and security. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries, we offer Strategy and Consulting, Interactive, Technology and Operations services—all powered by the world’s largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centers. Our 624,000 people deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity every day, serving clients in more than 120 countries. We embrace the power of change to create value and shared success for our clients, people, shareholders, partners and communities. Visit us at www.accenture.com.
Supply Chain and Operations professionals house individuals who help clients develop strategies and operating models that integrate fulfillment functions within an organization, as well as connect suppliers and customers across the extended supply chain.
You are:
An expert in Direct Materials Procurement. You know how to make procurement work for clients, society, and our planet – ensuring input products and services are received responsibly without interruption. And, what’s more - you’ve got the real-life experience and analytical know-how in one or several manufacturing industries and associated Direct Material Categories to reduce product complexity, optimize supply chain risk exposure, increase supplier resiliency long-term profitability. Experienced in the Supply Chain SCOR model structure and associated impacts on Direct Material quality, cost, and delivery metrics.
The work:
You will support our clients across a broad range of manufacturing industries to address their issues related to:
Competitive agility – maximizing the value of the procurement function
COGs Cost takeout – utilizing various technical and commercial levers including complex sourcing, fact-based negotiation, should-cost modelling, tear-down, design to cost principles, specification rationalization
Digital disruption – RPA, AI, Blockchain, amongst others
Mergers & Acquisition – clean room-based synergy identification and PMI execution
Responsible Procurement – redefining, executing, and monitoring performance against environmental, social, and corporate governance target
You will spot, isolate, and solve procurement problems using your skills in:
Advanced analytics – spend, contracts, consumption, parts rationalization, and complexity reduction. Predictive and prescriptive insights driven from market-based conditions
Should-cost modelling Direct / COGS (incl. chemicals, resins/plastics, metals, ingredients, contract manufacturing, assemblies, etc. across various manufacturing process areas)
Operating model architecture – people, process technology
You will also, throughout your work, have opportunities to:
Lead small to medium sized teams (3 – 10), with diverse backgrounds skills and knowledge
Effectively manage and coach others, collaborating with internal and external parties
Support client sales origination and thought leadership development
Challenge legacy ways of working using constructive techniques that fuel client growth
Drive a positive impact in the communities where we work and live
Travel:
For now, all Accenture business travel, international and domestic, is currently restricted to client-essential sales/delivery activity only.


Please note: The safety and well-being of our people continues to be the top priority, and our decisions around travel are informed by government COVID-19 response directives, recommendations from leading health authorities and guidance from a number of infectious disease experts.

Basic Qualifications:
At least 5 years of experience working in Direct Materials Procurement or COGs related cost takeout initiatives
At minimum of 4 years working in an external consulting firm and operating at the Senior Manager equivalent
A Bachelor’s Degree is required
Preferred Qualifications:
Prior experience in any of the following industries/categories is a plus: CPG, Agribusiness, Food Ingredients, Resins, Chemicals
You have the proven ability to work creatively and analytically in a problem-solving environment
You excel in building and developing relationships, overseeing complex programs, and demonstrating leadership
You’ve earned an MBA or equivalent graduate degree
You have a functional-level understanding of technology solutions
You have experience leading COGs Cost takeout initiatives - utilizing various technical and commercial levers including complex sourcing, fact-based negotiation, should-cost modelling, tear-down, design to cost principles, specification rationalization
You have experience in driving Digital disruption for the procurement function utilizing technologies like RPA, AI, Blockchain, amongst others
You have exposure to Mergers & Acquisition – clean room-based synergy identification and PMI execution
You have exposure to Responsible Procurement – redefining, executing, and monitoring performance against environmental, social, and corporate governance targets
Professional Skill Requirements:
Proven ability to build, manage and foster a team-oriented environment
Proven ability to work creatively and analytically in a problem-solving environment
Desire to work in an information systems environment
Excellent communication (written and oral) and interpersonal skills
Excellent leadership and management skills
As required by the Colorado Equal Pay Transparency Act, Accenture provides a reasonable range of minimum compensation for roles that may be hired in Colorado. Actual compensation is influenced by a wide array of factors including but not limited to skill set, level of experience, and specific office location. JobTitle: Accenture Junior Military Officer Program - Consulting Senio...
Content_text:
Accenture Analyst Development Program
Whether you’re a recent grad or looking to kickstart your consulting career, you can help us do work that makes a real impact. You’ll help solve clients’ most challenging problems using the latest technology to do extraordinary things.
Not only will you have amazing opportunities to learn, grow and develop your skills, you’ll join a collaborative environment that celebrates and supports our differences. At Accenture, your voice will always be heard, and our community of leaders and peers are ready to mentor, coach and encourage you to be your best so you can build a long and rewarding career.
Consulting Development Program (CDP)Deliver new technologies and unique business solutions to world class clientsProvide management support and analyze/improve business processesDevelop change management and organizational strategiesBuild front-end solutions or design and implement softwareUse quantitative methods and statistical models to create insights, patterns, and outcomes from dataCombine Artificial Intelligence (AI) with data, analytics and automation under a strategic vision to scale AI and transform business—across every function and process.
Technology Development Program (TDP)Create and deliver platform and custom-designed solutions for world class clients.Build new business models via application management and implementation services.Co-create proof of concept for new or emerging technologies with our clients.Utilize programming skills to design and build client applications to drive and accelerate business impact.Discover vulnerabilities or security flaws to help our clients protect their information, applications and business processes against cyber threats.

Anjular.js, Node.js, etc.) and/or lifecycle data management, supply chain, finance, etc.Exposure to programming-related projects in Web Design, Game design and/or Mobile Application DesignInterest in new emerging technologies, cloud, security, silicon and leading business application packagesAbility to demonstrate strong work ethic, solid technical aptitude, excellent communication skills, leadership, attention to detail and experience working on a team

The University of Washington (UW) is proud to be one of the nation’s premier educational and research institutions. Our people are the most important asset in our pursuit of achieving excellence in education, research, and community service. Our staff not only enjoys outstanding benefits and professional growth opportunities, but also an environment noted for diversity, community involvement, intellectual excitement, artistic pursuits, and natural beauty.


At the University of Washington, diversity is integral to excellence. We value and honor diverse experiences and perspectives, strive to create welcoming and respectful learning environments, and promote access, opportunity and justice for all.


The Dog Aging Project (DAP, https://dogagingproject.org/) and the eScience Institute at the University of Washington are seeking an outstanding candidate for the position of a Temporary Data Scientist. This position is planned to last for one year. The ideal candidate will have expertise in one or more areas related to data science (machine learning, statistics, computer science, etc.), demonstrated experience in open-source software, and demonstrated ability to use these skills to solve problems in an applied domain discipline.


The DAP is an innovative initiative that brings together a community of dogs, owners, veterinarians, researchers and volunteers to carry out the most ambitious canine health study in the world. The DAP will follow tens of thousands of companion dogs for ten years in order to identify the biological and environmental factors that maximize healthy longevity. The eScience Institute’s mission is to engage researchers across disciplines in developing and applying advanced computational methods and tools to real world problems in data-driven science and research. The DAP and eScience Institute are partnering to work on the research objectives of a recently funded award.


In this role, the Data Scientist will plan and execute research in machine learning and artificial intelligence, translate research results into solutions and produce practical applications that will deliver lasting impact across domains. Working as part of an existing team, successful candidates will have ample opportunity to publish their research, contribute to collaborative software development, offer innovative technical consulting, develop and deliver training, and other activities designed to advance the research and practice of data-driven and data-intensive discovery in DAP and beyond.


Duties and Responsibilities:

25% - Gather design specifications and use cases from artificial intelligence (AI) / machine learning (ML) users of similar existing large multifaceted datasets.

25% - Work with the DAP’s partners responsible for data pipeline development to automate data ingestion, cleaning, and structuring of various data streams (e.g. data files for genome, epigenome, metabolome, microbiome, flow cytometry, etc.).

15% - Leverage the DAP’s existing robust sample tracking and condition monitoring workflow to develop detailed sample metadata for AI/ML workflows to use for removing or characterizing bias. Coordinate with DAP laboratories to understand and correct for any longitudinal trends introduced by sample processing over the lifetime of the study.

15% - Interact with communities of practice to gather feedback and tailor software and data structures to emerging needs. Prepare and deliver presentations on significant results, both internally and externally. Develop tutorials and guide project work associated with DAP webinars and collaborative workshops. Work to release open-source software and open data, help ensure scientific reproducibility of all results, and contribute to a “culture of reproducibility”.

10% - Participate in DAP sponsored reporting and annual retreat activities.

10% - Produce research products such as well-documented algorithms and code, software, and research publications.


Minimum Qualifications:

Master’s degree in any discipline, with a strong computational background.

A minimum of 4 years of experience in programming and software engineering and/or advanced statistical methods including experience:

Applying (at least) one programming language to construct full scientific pipelines, from data ingestion / clean-up to modeling, to visualization and analysis.

Collaborating and coordinating work via an online platform, such as GitHub, GitLab, or BitBucket, and distributed revision control.

Skills to communicate complex information in a clear and concise manner both verbally and in writing

Strong capacity for teamwork, collaborative, critical thinking, and attention to detail.


Desired Qualifications:

PhD in any discipline, with a strong computational background

A successful research track record, especially through collaborations outside one’s own field, as evidenced by joint publications, joint grants, and collaborative software outputs

Leadership in collaborative projects in open source software development

Experience engaging with highly technical researchers across a variety of methodological fields, research domains, and computational platforms.

Experience with seeking extramural funding to support research, education and training programs.


Application Process:

The application process for UW positions may include completion of a variety of online assessments to obtain additional information that will be used in the evaluation process. These assessments may include Work Authorization, Cover Letter, and/or others. Any assessments that you need to complete will appear on your screen as soon as you select “Apply to this position”. Once you begin an assessment, it must be completed at that time; if you do not complete the assessment you will be prompted to do so the next time you access your “My Jobs” page. If you select to take it later, it will appear on your "My Jobs" page to take when you are ready. Please note that your application will not be reviewed, and you will not be considered for this position until all required assessments have been completed.


Applicants considered for this position will be required to disclose if they are the subject of any substantiated findings or current investigations related to sexual misconduct at their current employment and past employment. Disclosure is required under Washington state law.

Committed to attracting and retaining a diverse staff, the University of Washington will honor your experiences, perspectives and unique identity. Together, our community strives to create and maintain working and learning environments that are inclusive, equitable and welcoming.
The University of Washington is a leader in environmental stewardship & sustainability, and committed to becoming climate neutral.
The University of Washington is an affirmative action and equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, age, protected veteran or disabled status, or genetic information.
To request disability accommodation in the application process, contact the Disability Services Office at 206-543-6450 or dso@uw.edu.
COVID-19 VACCINATION REQUIREMENT
Governor Inslee's Proclamation 21-14.2 requires employees of higher education and healthcare institutions to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 unless a medical or religious exemption is approved. Being fully vaccinated means that an individual is at least two weeks past their final dose of an authorized COVID-19 vaccine regimen. As a condition of employment, newly hired employees will be required to provide proof of their COVID-19 vaccination. View the Final candidate guide to COVID-19 vaccination requirement webpage for information about the medical or religious exemption process for final candidates.

Summary
Posted: Nov 8, 2021
Weekly Hours: 40
Role Number:200305409
Create ground-breaking technology for next generation of voice assistant technology maximising natural language processing, machine learning and large-scale distributed systems. Deliver useful insights to improve the core architecture and platform for Siri, including performance, reliability and accuracy of Siri. Work with other engineers in Siri’s Natural Language Processing, Speech Recognition, Search & Ranking teams to improve accuracy, understandability, and performance of the product. Deliver key improvements to the architecture that enhances privacy and security of Siri!
Key Qualifications
Min 10 years of professional/industry software engineering experience
Have shipped products to production, and supported/extended them post launch
Has driven technical decision-making and software development from product definition to ship for multiple shipped products
Experience mentoring engineers up to Sr, backed by compelling examples
Have shipped production mobile client code at scale (both users and number of developers)
Description
This role requires someone with deep experience developing, launching, maintaining, and extending products. A hire for this role will accelerate the team through helping to develop standard methodologies, mentoring other engineers, coaching strong architecture design, and substantial individual technical contributions. While this role does not initially come with reports, it will have both technical and leadership accountabilities. The right candidate has enough leadership experience to build, mentor, and lead a small team. SPECIFIC RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE: - Substantial individual technical contributions to code, inclusive of design, deployment, and ongoing support - Provide technical leadership/take accountability for engineering quality - Drive definition and adoption of engineering standard methodologies - Coach solid design practices - Coach team accountability for quality through code reviews, design reviews, etc. - Mentor individual engineers - Fully own and drive substantial features end-to-end as a technical lead, where features are of a scope requiring multiple engineers and/or partners in other teams to deliver - Be actively involved in collaborating on product direction, giving feedback in the right way to the team, and bringing new issues up in a safe and constructive way for team discussion. This person should be a role model for how to be a proactive team member - Build, mentor, and strengthen theteam around themselves as we scale up. This person should be able to define staffing needs, implement our hiring process, and build the right team needed to execute on product
Education & Experience
Additional Requirements

DataRobot is the leader in enterprise AI, delivering trusted AI technology and enablement services to global enterprises competing in today’s Intelligence Revolution. DataRobot’s enterprise AI platform democratizes data science with end-to-end automation for building, deploying, and managing machine learning models. This platform maximizes business value by delivering AI at scale and continuously optimizing performance over time. The company’s proven combination of cutting-edge software and world-class AI implementation, training, and support services, empowers any organization – regardless of size, industry, or resources – to drive better business outcomes with AI.
DataRobot is in hyper growth mode and was recently included on the Deloitte Technology Fast 500 rankings as one of the fastest growing technology companies in North America. We are seeking an experienced Accounting Manager who will be a key player in and is genuinely excited about driving and effectively scaling DataRobot’s hyper-growth. This is a fantastic opportunity for a candidate that wants to have a critical voice in an organization that is operating at an accelerated pace and scaling for the future.
We are looking for an Accounting Manager to join our Corporate Accounting Team to support our growth. The ideal candidate enjoys collaborating with people with a diverse set of talents, can drive projects from concept to completion, and communicates well across teams in a dynamic and fast paced environment. They will have experience managing and leading groups within accounting and have strong relationships working with various finance teams (FP&A, Procurement, Tax, etc.) and other stakeholders in the business. They will be a CPA and have a strong working knowledge of US GAAP with experience in a wide range of GL functions. The manager will also be responsible for setting global policies and operational procedures to improve close and reporting accuracy and efficiency. The manager will take pride in developing and coaching team members, setting goals, and maintaining strong employee relationships. This is a great opportunity that will allow for career growth as the Company continues to expand!
Responsibility
Key player in the Corporate Accounting team in the month end and quarter end process for our worldwide close process by performing accounting tasks in compliance with U.S. GAAP, internal policies and SOX.
Coordinate cross-functionally and across geo/international locations for close process, accuracy and timing.
Identify and implement process improvements and automation to reduce time to close and improve accuracy of underlying accounting records.
Partner with cross-functional teams on a regular basis to identify areas for improvement and solve problems.
Lead critical accounting projects including the design, implementation, and maintenance of key finance and reporting systems.
Build and maintain business relationships with internal and external partners. Collaborate with internal and external customers to proactively identify, research and resolve processing issues.
Implement best practices for financial reporting processes.
Active role in the monthly close process, including maintenance of the general ledger by reviewing journal entries, reconciliations, and variance analyses. Prepare, review, and analyze financial statements to ensure accuracy and completeness, prepare work papers, analytics, and reporting packages.
All U.S. DataRobot employees must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. If there is a medical, religious, or other legally protected reason that prevents you from receiving an available COVID-19 vaccination, and you are selected as a candidate for consideration, we have a process in place to evaluate requests for accommodation.

We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. JobTitle: data scientist lead - Production AI, AI/ML Evolution
Content_text:
Job Posting
: Nov 10, 2021
Job Posting End Date
: Dec 11, 2021
Location
: US-WA-Seattle-Starbucks Support Center
Starbucks - Data Analytics
Job Summary and Mission:
As a lead technologist for the AI/ML ModelOps Program, you will lead and develop Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning solutions (real-time customer facing, supply chain optimization, forecasts, IoT and others) while creating standardization and scalability across environments so that development, training, and deployment processes can run consistently, and in a platform-agnostic manner.
Leveraging your previous experience, we will enable you to:
Develop novel retail AI/ML prototypes to prove tech feasibility & showcase potential solutions.
Work independently & cross-functionally to build & scale relevant analytics solutions.
Build repeatable patterns, through code libraries, processes, etc., to increase the team efficiency of the AI/ML solution scaling process.
Evaluate & translate unstructured questions from business teams to data problems and help define roadmaps for potential data solutions.
Drive adoption of analytics data products & insights across business teams.
Establish yourself & the team as subject matter experts and trainers in AI/ML across departments.
Influence decisions by providing technical consultation and direction to stakeholders.
Recommend new technology trends and innovative products/features to the enterprise.
Train and re-train ML systems and models as and when necessary.
Extend, enrich, and standardize existing AI/ML frameworks and libraries.
We’d love to hear from people with:
3-5 years’ experience as a Machine Learning Engineer for production systems, Data Scientist, or similar role
Real world expertise in Reinforcement Learning and/or Deep Learning methods
Ability to develop robust code in Python, Java, and R, with familiarity in common Data Science / ML packages
Experience developing real-time AI/ML solutions
Experience working in Spark, SQL, NoSQL, or Map-Reduce environments; explicit Data Engineering experience is a bonus
Experience with modern cloud architecture ML patterns; Azure experience is a bonus
Understanding of AI/ML application management processes, such as ModelOps/MLOps/DevOps
Retail, customer loyalty, and/or eCommerce industry experience preferred
Understanding of data structures, data modeling, and software architecture
Deep knowledge of math, probability, statistics, and algorithms
Strong analytical & problem-solving skills, with ability to communicate & influence business teams
BS in Computer Science, Mathematics, or similar technical field; Master’s or advanced degree preferred
Let us give you the opportunity to be part of something bigger than yourself. It’s time for you to #beapartner. Apply today!
Starbucks and its brands are an equal opportunity employer of all qualified individuals.
We are committed to creating a diverse and welcoming workplace that includes partners with diverse backgrounds and experiences. We believe that enables us to better meet our mission and values while serving customers throughout our global communities. People of color, women, LGBTQIA+, veterans and persons with disabilities are encouraged to apply.
Qualified applicants with criminal histories will be considered for employment in a manner consistent with all federal state and local ordinances. Starbucks Corporation is committed to offering reasonable accommodations to job applicants with disabilities. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please contact us at 206-318-0660 or via email at applicantaccommodation@starbucks.com

To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.
Job Category
Customer Success Group
Job Details
What you’ll be doing…
This is a new and exciting role within the Tableau Global Services Delivery Organization. This individual will lead a growing team of Engagement Managers as well as Sales Delivery resources that support specific strategic sales pursuits.
The Senior Director, Engagement Services Leader will be required to forge close and positive relationships across the global selling teams, while accurately aligning Engagement Managers to support specific sales engagements. This leader will ensure our Engagement Managers are helping to support the sales cycle by engaging with the customers and sales teams, translating customer comments and requirements into specific business outcomes, crafting and educating the customer on the art of the possible, prioritisation the services needed to successfully deliver the engagements, and ensuring our delivery teams complete the vision defined throughout the sales process.
In addition to leading the Engagement Managers, this resource will also be responsible for leading a team passionate about sales support. These resources will focus on engagements identified by the sales team, where they see significant upside potential for the customer/prospect to expand their value and footprint of Tableau. These customers need to see Tableau working for them, with their data, before making their buying decision. Engagements can range from days to weeks in duration. The Senior Director, Engagement Services Leader, will need to act as the gatekeeper of requests, lead the resources, prioritize and identify risks to the sales team, and act at the single point of contact for this group.
As part of the Service Delivery Leadership team, this individual will also work with other Service Directors and Service Products teams to help identify and build a series of repeatable outcome-based offerings that can be used to help our Sales teams better position and drive outcomes-based offerings.
This position requires a senior individual with a strong blend of relationship building skills, sales skills, team management skills, a forward looking vision, experience driving business outcomes based analytics solutions, digital transformation experience, business, enterprise architecture and consultative skills. It is an expectation of the role that this individual will be able to build and maintain senior executive relationships both internally and with customers.
Some of the things you’ll be doing include …
In collaboration with the sales account teams, you will be required to support account and opportunity planning, and resource management activities.
Drive strong Prioritization and Communication skills to ensure teams are assigned where they are most needed, and expectations and constraints are properly communicated to requesting teams.
Build an outcome based business culture within the team, and conceptualise to look for common outcome based use cases that can be repeatable in other areas.
Push the status quo boundaries of team size and skills needed for full successful delivery, opening up the art of the possible.
Knowledge and ability to articulate key concepts in digital transformation, customer experience and cloud adoption.
Understand the customer’s business strategy and technology needs; identifying the key capabilities and technology enablers required to support these.
Be accountable for the development of business case documents, visioning proposals, enterprise architecture artefacts, delivery roadmaps and executive presentations.
Work within a matrix-style organization, working across multiple teams and partners.
Mentor and guide sales and presales resources on strategic opportunities.
Participation in the delivery of solution standard methodologies, reference architectures, educational sessions and industry summits to existing customers, partners and to internal audiences. Serve as a Trusted Advisor to our customer’s technology and business leaders, demonstrating the collective intelligence of our Architect Community and Data Culture dreamers to accelerate business value and reduce risk.
Assist the team to drive, through governance and attention to critical architecture decisions, adherence to standards and best practices in domains such as: Security, Performance, Integration, Analytics, Mobile, Release Management and Development Lifecycle.
Advocate and be the voice of an outstanding data and analytics culture.
Grow the Engagement Manager practice globally by chipping in to internal central initiatives.
Who you are…
Enterprise Experienced. Experience in enterprise architecture principles and tools. Multi-year experience in either a software vendor or enterprise architecture fields.
Team Mentor . Be a mentor and growth engine for helping a newer team grow optimally across the globe to help drive new business.
Strategic & Value Based Salesperson. Proven experience in crafting, selling or implementing technology-based solutions. Ability to communicate the business value of technology decisions along with the business value they deliver.
Tech Obsessed . Good understanding of the architectural principles of cloud based platforms including SaaS, PaaS, multi-tenant, multi-tiered infrastructure.
Industry Alignment. Experience with Analytics Tools, AI solutions, and Tableau.
Digital Transformation Leader. Key experience in Digital Transformation and Business Architecture.
You are a Recruiter! Tableau hires company builders and, in this role, you will be asked to be on the constant lookout for the best talent to bring onboard to help us continue to build one of the best companies in the world.
For Colorado-based roles: Minimum annual salary of $164,100 . You may also be offered incentive compensation, bonus, restricted stock units, and benefits. More details about our company benefits can be found at the following link: https://www.getsalesforcebenefits.com/
#LI-RW1

Head of Product Partnerships
Zoom is an award-winning workplace. We have been recognized as such by Comparably, Glassdoor, Wealthfront and Business Insider. Our culture focuses on delivering happiness to our customers and employees.
Zoom is looking for an experienced strategic partnerships and business development leader to join the Corporate Strategy team, reporting directly to the Head of Corporate Strategy. In this senior and high visibility role, you will be expected to create and drive key elements of Zoom’s go forward partnership strategy and plans. You will identify impactful product and technology partnership opportunities and create plans that create differentiation for the Zoom Platform and enable new use cases for customers. This role requires strengths in strategic thinking, business development, analytical & problem-solving skills, cross group collaboration and executive communication skills. It is a tremendous opportunity to drive meaningful impact on the company’s growth and delight customers.
Responsibilities include:
Develop product partnership strategy that supports the strategic objectives and interests of Zoom’s business teams on a global basis.
Identify market and customer insights that can be translated into product and technology partnership opportunities that drive success for the Zoom platform.
Drive the identification, evaluation, negotiation, and management of key strategic partnerships involving product, technology and/or GTM components.
Evaluate the economic and strategic cost-benefit of partnerships.
Collaborate across functions including engineering, finance, marketing & sales to both co-develop and drive cross org alignment on the plans to ensure buy-in, shared vision and execution priority.
Delivery of opportunity maps, plans, projections and plays for cross company investment decisions.
Qualifications
10+ years of work experience within or across product management, corporate strategy, strategy consulting and business development.
7+ years of experience developing, leading, or executing commercial partnerships.
Undergraduate degree in engineering, math, business, economics. MBA strongly preferred.
Demonstrated track record of creating or managing complex strategic partnership agreements.
Technology depth and breadth in the unified communications and/or data and AI domains. Highly credible with senior technologists, product leaders, and CxO audiences.
Strong numerical fluency, analytical problem-solving skills, and the ability to synthesize data from multiple sources to identify insights and drive high impact decisions.
Excellent communication, leadership skills with the ability to influence at senior levels without authority to drive executive buy-in and alignment.
Exceptional business judgement using strong strategic thinking, customer centricity and appreciation for execution / operational excellence.
Ensuring a diverse and inclusive workplace where we learn from each other is core to Zoom’s values. We welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives including qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records as well as any qualified applicants requiring reasonable accommodations in accordance with the law.
We believe that the unique contributions of all Zoomies is the driver of our success. To make sure that our products and culture continue to incorporate everyone's perspectives and experience we never discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, or marital, veteran, or disability status.
All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.
Given Zoom’s status as a federal contractor, we are subject to President Biden’s Executive Order requiring COVID-19 vaccinations for all US employees. As such, Zoom requires all US employees, including remote employees, to be fully vaccinated. Zoom will consider requests for reasonable accommodations for religious or medical reasons as required under applicable law.

Summary
Posted: Aug 20, 2021
Role Number: 200245330
Are you passionate about building highly reliable services and on-device frameworks? Do you love working on the cutting edge of technology? As part of the Machine Learning Platform and Technologies (MLPT) team, you will work on the infrastructure and tools that Apple engineers use to create intelligent features — while preserving customer privacy. We're seeking a technical Engineering Program Manager (EPM) with strong program management multi-functional coordination skills to deliver new features and technology. The MLPT EPM team accelerates the adoption of machine learning in Apple products and ecosystem by leading all aspects of Apple’s internal ML platform. We support internal data scientists and ML engineers through technologies that combine the latest in ML innovation and deep integration with Apple infrastructure, unlocking the creation of customer experiences that surprise and delight!

Strong interpersonal and leadership skills, including team-building, conflict resolution, and management
Ability to communicate clearly and effectively partner, influence, and instill confidence with key partners (e.g. PM’s, designers, OS engineers, data scientists)
Excellent project management skills to structure, track, and handle on-time work streams across multiple teams
Knowledge of standard software engineering methodologies (familiarity with agile development, cloud infrastructure and machine learning a plus!)
Passion for continuous process improvement and smooth user experiences
Data-driven analytical skills and good judgement to extract insights and prioritize opportunities
Excellent project management skills to drive schedules, dependencies, critical path and risks
Description
As a MLPT EPM, we partner with engineering teams to deliver the technology that powers Apple’s ML feature development, all while contributing to a positive work culture. Your role will include the following responsibilities: - Build relationships with internal and external partners - Establish and drive cross-team roadmaps - Set business and operational metrics to ensure continuous improvement - Proactively identify new use cases and define product requirements and specifications to strengthen the platform

JobTitle: newExternal Communications / Public Relations Lead - Ecosystems...
Content_text:
External Communications / Public Relations Lead - Ecosystems and Alliances (Senior Consultant)

Are you a public relations professional who is unafraid to think differently, always thinks strategically, and knows how to build strong reporter relationships? A team player who can creatively build public relations efforts tied to business objectives? We are seeking a passionate and experienced external communications professional to shape Deloitte's Ecosystems and Alliances (E&A) storytelling in the news media and other audiences. If this is you, hit the "apply now" button!

The Deloitte Ecosystem and Alliances team plays an important role in supporting the organization's innovation and growth. Deloitte combines leading technology, business acumen and our alliances with many of the world's leading companies to solve our client's most complex challenges, shape new markets and drive measurable value. This leads to cutting edge solutions that Deloitte can bring to clients in areas such as cloud-technology, machine learning, artificial intelligence, digital experience and more.

The Public Relations Lead will oversee E&A media relations strategy and planning initiatives that are integrated with its priority narratives and marketing campaigns. The ideal candidate is a public relations professional, ideally with agency experience, who has a demonstrated ability to work collaboratively with individuals at all levels of a matrixed organization, effectively manage executives and external agencies, and drive innovation and capability building to support the future of external communications and PR, with a focus on data and measurement.

What you'll do:

As the E&A public relations lead, you will contribute to the growth and development of our organization in a variety of ways. Key responsibilities include:
Serving as a strategic trusted external communications advisor to leadership, business, marketing and other key stakeholders across the practice
Developing integrated external communications strategies focused on key business priorities, and executing strategies and plans across priority campaigns to build Deloitte's brand in the marketplace
Using metrics and analytics to build business cases and provide insights and counsel to clients, including leveraging performance against metrics to adjust approaches in an agile fashion
Managing external public relations agencies, including partnering with agencies to surface new ideas that push the bounds of our efforts to date; agency responsibilities to also include managing budgets, reviewing monthly reporting and ensuring delivery aligned with defined KPIs
Building and/or strengthening key reporter relationships, staying current on relevant news outlets, reporters and their areas of focus; and proactively pitching Deloitte leaders, thought leadership, and client impact stories
Driving and supportingexecution and innovation across all areas and channels of communication and storytelling from messaging to new platforms and analytical tools
Contributing to and adopting insights-driven standards for communications that champion measurement, collaboration and continuous growth.

The Team:


Deloitte's Consulting Marketing team combines the power of Deloitte's brand with the most inspired marketing techniques to produce business results for our clients. Through marketing strategy and execution, we elevate the Deloitte brand and strategic positioning, delivering a cohesive, consistent experience through campaigns grounded in business insights, industry best practices, creative power, and digital execution.

Qualifications/ Skills Required:
Communications professional with a minimum of 5-7 years relevant experience
Bachelor's degree, preferably in Communications, English, Public Relations, or Journalism
Proven success in developing and executing external communications strategies and communications plans for a large B2B business, preferably in professional services
Experience in developing and executing executive positioning programs, working with senior leaders, and collaborating across a multi-disciplinary marketing team
Executive presence, strong communication skills, and the ability to confidently provide strategic counsel, ask good questions, challenge the status quo, suggest alternatives, and articulate pros and cons
Ability to handle ambiguity and fluid priorities, gain consensus through influence, change course when warranted, and manage multiple and complex priorities efficiently and effectively
Ability to successfully collaborate with team members and navigate a matrixed organization
Ability to successfully engage and manage an external PR agency
Experience in measuring the effectiveness of communication strategies
Expert-level proficiency with Microsoft PowerPoint, Outlook and Word; knowledgeable in all aspects of Microsoft Office and ancillary programs

Must be authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future.


#NO22 #CMO22

How You'll Grow

At Deloitte, our professional development plan focuses on helping people at every level of their career to identify and use their strengths to do their best work every day. From entry-level employees to senior leaders, we believe there is always room to learn. We offer opportunities to help sharpen skills in addition to hands-on experience in the global, fast-changing business world. From on-the-job learning experiences to formal development programs at Deloitte University, our professionals have a variety of opportunities to continue to grow throughout their career. Explore Deloitte University, The Leadership Center.

Join our team and make the world better for Developers!
We are the Developer Relations team in Cloud + AI Engineering. Our global team is passionate about making the world amazing for Developers, Makers, Data Scientists, Technologists, Students, Entrepreneurs, and IT Professionals of all backgrounds. We help developers do what they love; create, code, and learn. We are active in the developer community and contribute to open source projects and tools. We build advocacy and help others skill-up across Microsoft products: Azure, GitHub, Visual Studio, Microsoft 365, Power Platform, and Teams.
The mission of Developer Relations is to empower developers to achieve more. We are looking for Cloud Advocates who will be based around Microsoft Reactors in the following locations: Bengaluru (Bangalore), London, New York City, Redmond, San Francisco, Sao Paulo, Shanghai, Stockholm, Sydney, and Toronto. As a Cloud Advocate, you’ll be instrumental in building a large and vibrant regional developer community with the Reactor as your local hub. You’ll prioritize your time engaging with professional developers as well as mentor students through the Microsoft Learn Ambassadors and Imagine Cup programs. You’ll also be empowered to create amazing, authentic demos on a broad range of technologies and build interactive workshops with Microsoft Learn. Join us as we inspire and earn the hearts and minds of developers broadly.
NOTE: You must live in Redmond, Washington or the surrounding area to be eligible for this position.
Responsibilities
Deliver interactive workshops and community sessions at Microsoft Reactors regularly in your local geographic area. This role may also present an opportunity to occasionally deliver sessions across other Reactor locations and Microsoft offices worldwide.
Deliver streaming and rich-media experiences on Microsoft platforms like Learn TV and Channel 9 as well as Twitch, YouTube, and others. Interact regularly with developers socially on Twitter, GitHub, Reddit, StackOverflow, and Quora as well as online forums, blogs, or other popular social media. Build your following/subscribers and represent both yourself and Microsoft.
Recruit and mentor Student Developers in your geographic region and mentor them through the Microsoft Learn Ambassadors, Imagine Cup, and regional hackathon events. Help us build communities that are inclusive and vibrant.
Contribute to Cloud Advocacy technical v-teams which might include your area of expertise or an area you aspire to build career experience in. These might include: Analytics, Artificial Intelligence, Cloud Native App Dev, Data Science, DevOps, Low-/ no code solutions, IoT, Mixed Reality, and Cybersecurity among others.
Contribute to Microsoft Reactor cross-discipline v-teams that includes goal-setting, defining our customer journey, inclusive community-building initiatives, creative planning, demand generation, and social media.
Champion open source and product advocacy for Microsoft products like Azure, GitHub, Visual Studio, Microsoft 365, Power Platform, and Teams.
Develop and maintain a deep understanding of relevant industry trends, our competition, and the role open source plays in the developer ecosystem – both locally in your geographic region and across the global developer ecosystem. Be known as an expert across a range of technologies; collaborate and contribute your insights and ideas to strengthen your peers’ contributions and that of our team.
Scale your efforts by partnering regionally with the Microsoft subsidiaries and via community programs like Microsoft MVPs, Docker Captains, Oracle Java Champions, etc.
Use data, experiments, and customer feedback to drive growth in the developer community. Work with other Cloud Advocates, senior leadership and product engineering to deliver insight and actionable product feedback to Microsoft and open source solutions.
Qualifications
Required Qualifications:
2+ years of experience in software development, popular programming languages, and cloud computing / IT infrastructure.
A business and/or technical degree or 2+ years equivalent work experience. (Software engineering degree preferred)
Preferred Qualifications:
Excellent communication skills – be a contributor to the developer community as well as a dynamic technical public speaker whom enjoys presenting in-person and in rich media
Previous experience as a Developer Advocate, Developer Evangelist, Program Manager, or Software Engineer role that included community involvement or public speaking. Relevant consulting / project-based / volunteer work may also be considered.
Passion for helping connect people and communities to Microsoft technologies inclusive of open source with a particular emphasis on engaging next gen developers that are actively learning; this might include beginner or intermediate Software Engineers, Data Scientists, Analysts / Domain Experts, Makers, Technologies, Entrepreneurs, IT Professionals, or other roles.
Proven experience contributing to 3rd party developer online communities (StackOverflow, GitHub, Reddit, Quora, open source projects and docs, etc.) and social media platforms (Twitter or other local geographic equivalents).
A self-starter that can manage and prioritize initiatives that will make our developers and platform the most successful. Understanding of professional developers that are seeking to upskill, and why/how they make choices about the technologies they use. You have a “pulse” on the tech industry. You separate the signal from the noise.
Excellent written, verbal presentation, and communications skills and especially across teams distributed worldwide - including the keen ability to translate complex ideas into various mediums (code repos, demos, slides, speaker’s notes, email, and other docs) for effective, audience-appropriate consumption.
A keen ability to communicate complex ideas to audiences with various technical and less technical / business / entrepreneurial backgrounds.
A willingness to learn, share, and improve. Ability to self-study; ramp to new technologies. Technical skills sufficient to experiment and forge new paths, even with limited documentation and with less stable or products in Beta/Preview stage.
Travel: Primarily to Microsoft Reactors and events in your regional geographic area. Opportunity to contribute and present at events and other Microsoft office locations worldwide.

Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related field
7+ years professional experience in building successful production software systems
3+ years of experience managing multiple software development teams (managing managers)

At Amazon, we're working to be the most Customer-centric company on earth. If you'd like to help us build a world-class delivery experience, this is your chance to make history. We are looking for an Engineering leader for the Delivery Experience AI team to help ensure we have the most compelling and relevant delivery options available to our customers, and help drive continuous innovation and improvement of the delivery experience through Artificial Intelligence.

As a Group Manager of Software Development in the Amazon Delivery Experience AI team, you will recruit and lead a high quality, creative, visionary software development team to build and innovate the technology platform that powers all delivery programs for Amazon customers around the world. You will own DEX machine learning platform and work closely with science team to deliver machine learning solutions. You will make a huge, measurable impact to Amazon’s customers and retail business, and build and innovate solutions that are simple and easy to maintain and scale. You are great at hiring, growing, and mentoring engineers, and cultivating leadership capabilities. Previous experience in collaborating with remote teams is a big plus.

The Software Development Manager will:

Own development of their systems end-to-end
Provide technical direction
Establish and execute short and long-term architectural roadmaps for the business
Continue to innovate on the framework to support delivery programs worldwide
Manage multiple development teams focused on creating the complex back-end architecture
Drive continual improvements to the efficiency and flexibility of the business platform while
Keeping an extremely high bar for customer trust, performance, and availability
MS in Computer Science, Computer/Electrical Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field
Great written and oral communication skills
Able to operate and scale across three or more teams
Strong Computer Science fundamentals in OOD, data structures, problem solving, and complexity analysis
Experience of launching large scale machine learning solutions
Knowledge of professional software engineering practices & best practices for the full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations
Experience mentoring junior software engineers to improve their skills, and make them more effective, product software engineers
Experience taking a leading role in building complex software systems that have been successfully delivered to customers
Experience delivering low-latency, consumer-internet-scale web services operating in a 24x7 environment
Experience mentoring and training the engineering community on complex technical issues
Experience in communicating with users, other technical teams, and senior management to collect requirements, describe software product features, technical designs, and product strategy
Experience influencing software engineers best practices within your team
Hands-on expertise in many disparate technologies, typically ranging from front-end user interfaces through to back-end systems and all points in between
The ideal candidate has a track record of launching projects with Java, Python, and distributed computing technologies on a Linux platform as well as deep expertise in mobile application platforms.
Experience working backwards from the customer and delivering innovative, simple solutions

BS/MS in optics, physics, EE, or related field, plus 3+ years’ industry experience.
Hands-on experience with lab setup for optical bench tests and hardware product integration.
Expertise in optical test equipment and measurements, such as power meters, microscopes, spectrometers, and LED light sources.
Ability to work independently with a minimal supervision.

Job summary
Innovation is part of our DNA! We are looking for people to join a team that is pushing the state of the art in computer vision (CV), machine learning, and hardware design.

As an Optical Test Engineer, you will help invent the future by developing innovative products, where optics play a central role. You will work closely with an inter-disciplinary team to drive key aspects of camera imaging architecture, definition, execution, test and delivery. We are looking for candidates who are self motivated, responsive, collaborative, and detail oriented while delivering to the highest standards.

Key job responsibilities

Test and validate camera modules, optical and illumination subsystems.
Perform hands-on testing of image quality and relevant hardware and software.
Perform troubleshooting and root cause analysis on optical test hardware.
Serve as the technical lead for designing and developing optical test systems for high volume production.
Learn and apply new engineering concepts and test methods. Design imaging and illumination test solutions for advanced AI/CV systems.
Work effectively with a cross-functional team including optical, mechanical, electrical, software, reliability, and manufacture engineers, and vendors.
Proven track record of taking ownership and driving results on technical projects.
Hands-on experience with camera development and imaging system.
Experience with imaging colorimetry, illuminance, CIE chromaticity, color uniformity, and contrast.
Experience with MATLAB and/or Python programming, particularly for image capture and processing would be a big plus.
Ability to work effectively in fast-paced and diverse technical environment.
Ability to perform sequential/non-sequential optical simulations using Zemax.

JobTitle: Natural Language Processing: Full Time Opportunities for PhD...
Content_text:
Every year, we welcome thousands of university graduates from every corner of the world to join Microsoft. You bring your aspirations, talent, potential—and excitement for the journey ahead.
At Microsoft, our mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more and when you begin your career with us, we empower you through the Microsoft Aspire Experience. Those hired into this role are invited to participate in this two-year learning and development experience where you'll build your network, cultivate intentional capabilities and gain perspective into the career opportunities across Microsoft’s many exciting businesses.
We’re a company of learn-it-all’s rather than know-it-alls and our culture is centered around embracing a growth mindset, a theme of inspiring excellence, and encouraging teams and leaders to bring their best each day. Does this sound like you? Learn more about our cultural attributes.
Are you ready to join us and create the future? Come as you are, do what you love—start your journey with us today!
Artificial intelligence (AI) is dramatically transforming people’s work and life now. Natural Language processing is in the center of the transform. Our teams have advanced the state of the art in natural language processing, speech processing, deep learning, video game AI, and even computational historical linguistics. We're looking for folks who are smart, passionate, productive, and kind to join in our ambitious project. You will be part of an ambitious plan to reshape human-computer interaction with conversational AI. We believe that the current prevailing approaches to dialogue.
Do you want to work on a meaningful and impactful project and make a difference? Are you willing to learn from others and open to new ideas? Do you want to support others to succeed and operate in a highly collaborative and global environment? If this sounds like you, Microsoft would like to invite you to come join us as you are, where you can find more than just a job. Read on to learn more about opportunities and apply online!
Responsibilities
We are looking for a motivated, self-driven software development engineer/scientist to join our mission to change the world with Natural language processing technology.
Address challenges in products through Deep Learning and Reinforcement Learning approaches and publish papers;
Track state-of-the-arts techniques, and keep lead positions in public competitions of various NLP tasks, including IR, QA, MRC, and Dialogues, etc.
Explore fundamental challenges for NLP and make breakthrough
Improve the speech output quality in terms of naturalness, expressiveness.
Provides good guidance on core speech output algorithm investigation.
Work on collaborations with Microsoft Research
Drive the Natural Language processing output technology roadmap for Microsoft
Qualifications
Currently pursuing or completed a PhD degree in Computer Science/Electrical Engineering (with focus in one or more of Natural Language processing).
Effective communication skills and ability to work in a collaborative environment.
Strong software development skills, aptitude for process design Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer and supports workforce diversity.

JobTitle: Machine Learning Engineer in Multi-Modal AI
Content_text:
Founded in 2012, ByteDance is a technology company operating a range of content platforms that inform, educate, entertain and inspire people across languages, cultures and geographies.

With a suite of more than a dozen products, including TikTok, Douyin, Toutiao, Helo and Resso, ByteDance now has a portfolio of applications available in over 150 markets and 75 languages.

The mission of the Applied Machine Learning (AML) team is to drive substantial impact for core businesses of the company by designing next-generation recommendation-based algorithms and platform. We are looking for Machine Learning Engineers and Research Scientists to join our team to advance our mission together.


Research large-scale multi-modal (vision, speech, natural language, etc) algorithms and deploy them in applications including search, recommendation and trust & safety
Improve the large-scale distributed machine learning system that powers the research and deployment of multi-modal algorithms
MS or above degree in Computer Science or related field with 1+ years industry experience
Have solid programming skills and proficient in C/C++
Familiar with at least one mainstream deep learning programming framework (TensorFlow/Caffe/MXNet) and familiar with its architecture and implementation mechanism
Have 2+ years of engineering or algorithm experience in at least one field (vision, speech, natural language, etc.)
Able to solve problems independently while good at team collaboration

Preferred Qualification

Experience in multi-modal joint training or modeling
Approved performances in international competitions in related fields (such as VQA, Image Captioning/Retrieval, etc.)
Published high quality papers in related international conferences (CV and NLP, etc.)

ByteDance is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At ByteDance, our mission is to inspire creativity and enrich life. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We believe individuals shouldn't be disadvantaged because of their background or identity, but instead should be considered based on their strengths and experience. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

ByteDance is committed to providing reasonable accommodations during our recruitment process. If you need assistance or an accommodation, please reach out to us at USRC@bytedance.com

BS degree in Computer Science or related field
