At Compass, we envision a world where the experience of selling or buying a home is simple and pleasant for everyone. Founded in 2012, Compass provides an end-to-end platform that empowers residential real estate agents to deliver exceptional service to their seller and buyer clients, all in service of our mission to help everyone find their place in the world.
Compass builds the first modern end-to-end real estate platform by integrating agents, buyers, and sellers through technology. Before Compass, no one has achieved the blend of the Natural Intelligence that hundreds of thousands of enterprising real estate agents bring to this market, with the Artificial Intelligence that cloud, mobile, and AI technologies enable.

As one of the fastest-growing technology companies of our generation, in an industry more extensive than any other, we have an opportunity and obligation to build a world-class engineering team and the operating platform that will transform the real estate industry. In 2020 we tripled our Product & Engineering team's size, and in 2021 we went public!

We're looking for a Technical Trainer who will play a vital role in the growth of our Product & Engineering (P&E) organization by creating and improving agile and technical training for our technical staff. You'll have an opportunity to combine a passion for teaching with enthusiasm for technology to drive learning and establish a positive engineering culture. You will also play a key role in helping our organization scale training, internal education, and technical onboarding. You must have excellent communication skills and proven technology training experience.

Responsibilities:

Craft and deliver hands-on training on agile software development to then produce engineering teams, which may include facilitating sprint planning, backlog grooming, daily stand-up meetings, reviews/demos, retrospectives, and other Scrum ceremonies
Influence the implementation of agile best practices across the organization
Develop a train-the-trainer program for our engineering community - Enable others to deliver agile training
Collaborate with our engineering teams to developing and maintaining technical training content, lab exercises, presentations, and accompanying materials for our technical onboardings
Deliver instructor-led classroom training to our engineering teams on agile software development and other ad-hoc training
Own the day to day execution of our technical onboarding program and its associated curriculum

Minimum qualifications:

Technical Degree (i.e. Computer Science, Information Systems) or relevant work experience
Experience crafting and delivering agile training on a large distributed environment (experience as a Scrum Master, scrum leader is a plus)
Experience structuring and delivering technical training programs
Outstanding communication and presentation skills and excellent facilitation skills with the ability to influence change
Ability to understand and convey complex concepts effectively
Experience in or knowledge of learning theory, instructional methodologies, and/or curriculum development
A desire to be coached, trained, and mentored as a Learning and Development expert

Preferred qualifications:

Demonstrate a general understanding of various software engineering concepts (e.g. Compute, Storage, Networking, Database, Security, AI/ML, DevOps)
Knowledge and/or hands-on experience with cloud infrastructure
Coding or scripting experience is a plus.
Experience with Linux at the command line is a plus.

At Compass, our mission is to help everyone find their place in the world. This means we continually celebrate the diverse community of different individuals. As an equal opportunity employer, we stay true to our mission by ensuring that our place can be anyone's place.

Check out our Engineering blog!
Do your best work, be your authentic self.

At Compass, we believe that everyone deserves to find their place in the world — a place where they feel like they belong, where they can be their authentic selves, where they can thrive. Our collaborative, energetic culture is grounded in our Compass Entrepreneurship Principles and our commitment to diversity, equity, inclusion, growth and mobility. As an equal opportunity employer, we offer competitive compensation packages, robust benefits and professional growth opportunities aimed at helping to improve our employees' lives and careers.

JobTitle: Software Development Test Engineer II - Robotics AI
Content_text:
BS in Computer Science or equivalent combination of technical education and work experience.
4+ years of proven experience as QAE, SDET, or SDE
4+ years experience with driving quality across an organization as a holistic plan and not just test execution
4+ years experience with QA methodologies and software testing techniques and tools.

Are you excited about building high-performance robotic systems that can perceive, learn, and act intelligently alongside humans? The Robotics AI team is creating new products and technologies that make this possible, at Amazon scale. The Robotics AI software team is seeking broad, curious engineers to join our diverse, full-stack team. In addition to holistically designing, building, and delivering end-to-end robotic systems, our team is responsible for the core infrastructure and tools that serve as the backbone of our robotic applications, enabling roboticists, machine learning scientists, and software engineers to collaborate and deploy systems in the lab and in the field. Our work spans real-time software, machine learning engineering, big data, simulation, and more.

We are looking for a Software Developer in Test (SDET) to join the Robotics AI team that is more like a startup than a mature enterprise. As part of the SDET team, you will be responsible for innovating and building platform services for robotic workcell testing, workcell orchestration services, and assurance practice on the product. Responsibilities include delivering automated platform solutions for hardware and software including but not limited to support for core functionality, UX, performance, and scale as well as offline report generation. SDET needs to be entrepreneurial, wear multiple hats, work in a highly collaborative environment, and own testing platform quality and features.

As a SDET, you will be working with a unique and gifted team developing exciting products for consumers and collaborate with other cross-functional teams.

About Us:
Work/Life Balance Our team puts a high value on work-live balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.

Mentorship & Career Growth Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. Our senior members enjoy one-on-one mentoring and thorough, but kind, code reviews. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded engineer and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

The Opportunity

Flexport is looking for a creative, technically-minded senior data engineer motivated to solve some of the world's most challenging data problems in global trade. Data is at the heart of our business, and as a Senior Data Engineer, you will work in complex data warehouse environments supporting global trade. You will partner with Data Science and Software Engineering teams to develop scalable and innovative analytical solutions, process and store large amounts of low latency structured and unstructured data, and enable the Data Science and Machine Learning team to execute successful, data-driven strategies.


You will be responsible for:

designing and implementing a data management and analytical environment using custom and open source tools
developing Python or JVM-centric (Java, Kotlin) solutions to automate ETL, analytics, and data platform management
designing and implementing complex data models, modeling metadata, building reports and dashboards and creating reporting tools for data science and ML products users.
writing highly tuned, scalable SQL queries running over large-scale, heterogeneous data warehouses
designing and deploying data infrastructure needed to drive data-driven decision-making solutions supporting Flexport's marketplace and freight forwarding initiatives.


You should have deep expertise in designing, building, and managing large datasets across various data platforms. You should also excel at working with various customers/partners to understand data needs and implement scalable and efficient ETL solutions. Our data science, product, and engineering teams collaborate very closely with our data engineering team to share domain knowledge, test hypotheses at scale, and develop promising solutions that can be quickly and widely deployed. In addition, we are passionate about providing effortlessly accessible intelligence and actionable insights to our end users. Thus, the ideal data engineering candidate is: self-motivated, highly analytical, technically excellent at writing code, and passionate about delivering cutting-edge data solutions.


Locations: San Francisco, Bellevue


You Will:

Design, implement and improve Data Science's pricing, planning, and ML platforms.
Develop and improve the current data architecture, focusing on improving data security, data quality, latency, scalability, and extensibility.
Leverage state-of-the-art technologies to design, pilot, and deploy low latency data architectures supporting pricing, planning, and various ML/AI initiatives.
Collaborate closely with data scientists, data analytics, product, engineering, and business/operations teams to:
develop, implement, and validate key performance metrics
perform statistical analyses and data profiling, and
support production deployment of low-latency machine learning and optimization solutions.
Partner with Data Scientists, Data Analytics, and business/operations partners to design and deploy experiments and measure the impact of policy and system changes.

You Should Have:
Minimum Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field, such as computer science, machine learning, or a related field with 5+ years of industry experience.
Extensive experience and expertise writing and optimizing complex SQL.
Expert knowledge of data warehousing concepts.
Extensive experience in data mining, profiling, and analysis.
Extensive experience with data modeling, ETL design, and the use of large-scale databases in business environments.
Experience programming with languages such as Python, Ruby, Java.
Experience working with large data sets and knowledge of tools for big data analytics and manipulation (e.g., dbt).
Proven ability and experience to design, develop and deploy innovative data solutions and complex production systems (e.g., supporting pricing, planning, predictions, etc.)
Knowledge of engineering and operational excellence using standard methodologies.

Preferred Qualifications
Deep experience and expertise in ETL optimization, designing, coding, and tuning big data processes using dbt or cloud-native solutions (running on kubernetes (k8s))
Extensive experience designing, developing, and deploying data pipelines and applications to stream and process data at low latencies needed to support near real-time production pricing, planning, and ML solutions.
Demonstrate efficacy in building data solutions that support data lineage tracking, ensuring that data, as it flows from sources to consumptions, can be understood, recorded, and visualized.
Knowledge of distributed systems and data architecture and experience in designing and implementing batch and stream data processing pipelines
Knowledge and experience with optimization of the distribution, partitioning, and parallel processing of high-level data structures.

#LI-RP2


About Flexport

We believe global trade can move the human race forward. That's why it's our mission to make global trade easier for everyone. We aim to do this by building the Operating System for Global trade - a strategic model combining advanced technology and data analytics, logistics infrastructure, and supply chain expertise. Flexport today connects almost 10,000 clients and suppliers across 109 countries, including established global brands like Georgia-Pacific, as well as emerging innovators like Sonos. Started in 2013, we've raised over $1.3B in funding from SoftBank Vision Fund, Founders Fund, GV, First Round Capital, and Y Combinator. We're excited about the three big ways we're moving forward after our recent $1B investment from SoftBank Vision Fund in February 2019.

Are you worried about not having any freight forwarding experience?
Don't be! We're building the first Operating System for Global Trade. That's why it's crucial for us to bring people from diverse backgrounds and experiences together with our industry veterans to help move the freight forwarding industry forward.
What's freight forwarding, and why does it matter? Freight forwarding is the coordination and shipment of goods from one place to another, and it's what makes global trade possible. Flexport is on a mission to make global trade easier for everyone because we believe it can help connect the world and break down economic barriers.
We know this industry is complex. That's why we invest in education starting day one with Flexport Academy, a one-week intensive onboarding program explicitly designed to set every new Flexport employee up for success.

At Flexport, our ability to fulfill our mission of making global trade easy for everyone relies on having a diverse, dedicated, and engaged workforce. That is why Flexport is committed to creating and nurturing an environment where anyone can be their authentic self. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, physical and mental disability, health status, marital and family status, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, military and veteran status, and any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

JobTitle: Senior PMT - Maturity Ratings, Prime Video
Content_text:
2+ years of experience with end to end product delivery
5+ years of technical product management, program management or engineering experience
Bachelor's Degree
Experience contributing to engineering discussions around technology decisions and strategy related to a product
Experience owning roadmap strategy and definition

Job summary
Are you interested in shaping the future of movies and television? Do you want to create cutting edge AI that will define the next generation of how customers watch video? Prime Video (PV) is one of the leading digital video services on the Internet today, and we're just getting started. We need your passion, innovative ideas, and creativity to help take the service to new heights.

We are seeking an innovative Sr. Product Manager-Technical (PMT) to bring a vision for what the customer experience can be, and work backwards from there to make it a reality. Our core mission is to bring together PMT’s, engineers, and data scientists to create the technical solutions that can interpret what is occurring in PV digital content. You will harness these capabilities and define the product architecture from end to end, including identifying what new ML models are needed, the backend systems that are required to orchestrate and deliver the experience, and the final customer interaction.

Key job responsibilities

What you will do:

Create the vision and strategy for new AI based products and present your roadmap to senior executives and teams across Prime Video
Partner with data science, engineering, program management, and operations to bring products to market, develop and grow new business opportunities, and enhance the customer experience
Rapidly prototype, test, and iterate on your ideas
Use data to define your proposals and drive your decisions
Most importantly: delight the customer

A day in the life


Proven success in delivering online products and services in a high growth environment
Demonstrated strength in building trust and driving alignment across a diverse, matrixed set of stakeholders
Strong oral and written communication skills, and demonstrated ability to influence others

Viome is on a mission to prevent and reverse chronic diseases. Viome is a high-growth biotech startup that applies AI and machine learning to biological data – e.g., microbiome, transcriptome, and metabolome data – to provide direct-to-consumer personalized dietary and lifestyle recommendations for healthier living. We are a small, fast-growing, interdisciplinary team of passionate experts in biochemistry, microbiology, medicine, artificial intelligence, and machine learning with a shared mission to make illness optional. Lead investors include Khosla Ventures, West River Group, and Bold Capital Partners.
The Financial Analyst will lead our financial modeling and planning functions for Viome. This person must be able to operate independently across multiple teams and be able to combine state of the art AI/ML and statistics forecasting techniques to help define and achieve our growth objectives and deliver on our mission to change how individuals manage their health worldwide.
This is a full-time onsite position at Viome’s office in Bellevue, WA.
Responsibilities:
Reports to Chief Accounting Officer and leads efforts to implement analytic tools, models and maintenance for our forecasting and planning systems across Viome.
Creates and maintains consumer-focused models including machine learning/artificial intelligence (AI/ML) and statistical models using a variety of programming languages and software (such as R, Python, SAS, and SQL).
Maintains models and conducts observational analysis to explore data, test hypotheses, predict outcomes, and inform decisions reporting to the senior management team.
Develops utilities to programmatically deploy and update data visualizations, data sources, and other analytic tools to web based platforms (such as Sisense, RedShift, Snowflake, etc.).
Prepares and presents analysis and findings to senior management and colleagues.
Assists with the preparation of presentation materials for the Board of Directors.
Partners with the accounting team monthly to understand budget to actual variances.
Communicates expert advice, statistical results, and modeling concepts orally and in writing to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Analyzes system design alternatives and identifies potential improvements to existing systems and processes.
Collaborates with appropriate staff to gather input and feedback concerning system needs.
Performs ad hoc financial modeling and analysis
Requirements:
3+ years experience as a Financial Analyst or comparable experience
Experience with Financial Planning & Analysis that includes leading a budgeting process
Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Strong supervisory and leadership skills.
Experience maintaining complex spreadsheets (Excel, Google Sheets)
Experience working in high-tech startup environments. Healthcare background a bonus
Experience with subscription and transactional businesses.
Comfortable working with all levels of management and experienced partnering with leadership
Ability to navigate through vast amounts of data, identify patterns and make relevant management decisions
Thorough understanding of generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP).
Ability to communicate expert advice, statistical results, and AI/ML concepts orally and in writing to both technical and non-technical audiences. Experience with languages and software (including, SQL, Sisense, RedShift, R, Python, Snowflake …) strongly preferred.
Viome Benefits include ...
Health insurance
Dental insurance
Vision insurance
Paid time off
Parental leave
Employee Assistance Program
LTD & STD
Waiting time may apply to benefits
Viome is a 150+ person start-up offering a successful commercial product that has generated high demand and is building out a vision to offer FDA-approved diagnostics and therapeutics to patients. With offices in Washington and New York, we are looking to hire team members capable of working in dynamic environments, who have a positive attitude and enjoy collaboration. If you have the skills and are excited about Viome’s mission, we’d love to hear from you.
Viome does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, gender, disability, veteran, military status, religion, age, creed, national origin, sexual identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, genetic information, or any other basis prohibited by local, state, or federal law.

JobTitle: Senior Software Engineer, Machine Learning Platform
Content_text:
What you'll do:

As a Senior Engineer in the Machine Learning Platform team you will build tools and processes to manage, improve, and rapidly scale our platform. Specifically, you will

Design and build tools and processes to make the release of new machine learning models fast, easy, safe, and minimally disruptive.
Participate in architecture discussions to meet the requirement to serve hundreds of machine learning models at thousands of queries per second.
Ensure that our systems can continue to scale rapidly while addressing rapidly evolving product team needs.
Implement scalable, low-latency, high-throughput, fault-tolerant, extensible, and easily maintainable data processing pipelines for both batch and real-time systems.
Motivate, listen and empathize, and help engineers and data scientists to excel.

What would make you a strong fit:

5+ years of professional software development experience or a degree in CS (or a related field) with 3+ years of experience.
Experience building highly available low-latency systems using Java, Scala, C++ or other object-oriented languages.
Experience working with large datasets and best in class data processing technologies for both stream and batch processing, such as Apache Spark, Apache Beam, MapReduce.
Strong debugging, testing, tuning, and problem-solving skills.
Strong communication & collaboration skills, and a belief that team output is more important than individual output.
Self-starter, with a quick learning curve.

Bonus points:

Familiarity with practical challenges in ML systems such as feature extraction and definition, data validation, training, monitoring, and management of features and models.
Practical knowledge of how to build end-to-end ML workflows.
Experience with building an ML feature store for batch and real-time aggregation/serving.
Knowledge of GCP or AWS cloud stack for web services and big data processing.

About the team:

At Sift we enhance trust and safety in the digital world with our AI driven technology platform. Our products deliver payment protection, ensure content integrity, and protect account defense for businesses around the world. The Machine Learning Platform team exists to enable product teams to construct and operate their production machine learning services as effectively as possible.

The team does this by providing a platform which handles the common needs of the product teams including production system integration, model training, model availability, health and monitoring infrastructure for model serving, and a streamlined model release process.

A little more about Sift:

Sift is the leading innovator in Digital Trust & Safety. Hundreds of disruptive, forward-thinking companies like Airbnb, Zillow, and Twitter trust Sift to deliver outstanding customer experience while preventing fraud and abuse.

The Sift engine powers Digital Trust & Safety by helping companies stop fraud before it happens. But it's not just another anti-fraud platform: Sift enables businesses to tailor experiences to each customer according to the risk they pose. That means fraudsters experience friction, but honest users do not. By drawing on insights from our global network of customers, Sift allows businesses to scale, win, and thrive in the digital era.

Benefits and Perks:

Competitive total compensation package
401k plan
Medical, dental and vision coverage
Wellness reimbursement
Education reimbursement
Flexible time off

Sift is an equal opportunity employer. We make better decisions as a business when we can harness diversity in our experience, data, and background. Sift is working toward building a team that represents the worldwide customers that we serve, inclusive of people from all walks of life who can bring their full selves to work every day.

This document provides transparency around the way in which Sift handles personal data of job applicants: https://sift.com/recruitment-privacy

JobTitle: Product Marketing Manager - Azure Cognitive Services
Content_text:
Product Marketing Manager - Azure Cognitive Services

Consulting Team

Cadence 3 is looking for a Product Marketing Manager. This is an exciting role that will drive usage and consumption of Microsoft Azure, Data AI, Machine Learning, and Cognitive Services workloads. If you're eager to dive into the world of AI and machine learning, this is the job for you. The Machine Translation team is at the forefront of AI research using large scale deep learning to deliver translations that help billions of users overcome language barriers. The translator team incorporates research breakthrough into a highly scalable and available Azure service that powers translation in Microsoft applications like Bing, Edge, Teams and Office. The Translator service is also used by thousands of companies around the world to translate everything from social media content to complete documents.
This team is a unique combination of 'research' and 'product' not seen at many other places. The team has a lofty goal of breaking the language barrier and we have a lot of work left to do. They are a small, agile team, big on autonomy with product marketers working closely side by side with engineering and program managers. They strive to stay current with the latest engineering tools and practices like Git, VSTS, Cloud Build, frequent releases, scrum planning.
RESPONSIBILITIES

The PMM is required to have a strong understanding of their solution area and a good understanding of customer solutions and market ecosystem.
This role represents the relevant Azure solutions, worldwide and is the subject matter expert for go to market planning. In addition, they must be able to articulate the local competitive landscape and develop local compete strategies and product differentiation by leveraging corporate and local research, partner insights and customer feedback.
The Product Marketing Manager (PMM) is responsible for leading the Go-To-Market strategy for Azure Cognitive, Machine Learning, and Translator solutions to deliver customer and partner success resulting in revenue growth and increased market shares within their aligned priorities.
You must develop strong partnerships across marketing, Microsoft partners, and sales to lead and execute the priorities. - Promote programmatic client investments and competitive commercial offerings
Engage in and manage co-marketing digital campaigns with largest ISVs - Land Microsoft Developer cloud marketing (VScode, GitHub, Azure)
Orchestrate community marketing events online and onsite.
Lead the Azure Cognitive Services and Translator business in alignment with other business owners - Empower Customers to Migrate their infrastructure to the cloud and enable them to build skills and govern their cloud journey
Build and land growth plans to win and maximize the local market opportunity, based on the business priorities
Drive business outcomes by executing Microsoft Translator and Cognitive Services Go-To-Market plan to exceed business targets
Provide input on marketing plan development by providing business objectives to Central Marketing Organization and Integrated Marketing Organization
Build a comprehensive marketing plan, for the fiscal year to harmonize with our Central Marketing Organization and integrated marketing organization
Manage content messaging, authoring, and publishing calendar for Microsoft Translator blog, social handles, and online marketing to align with product feature roadmap, updates, and launches
Maintain line of sight into other organizations usage and adoption of Translation services

WORK ENVIRONMENT

Some evening calls due to international work
No travel for this role


COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS

Compensation dependent upon skills and experience.
All full-time employees are eligible for our company-paid medical benefits.
All employees are eligible for our flexible PTO plan.
401k Savings Plan
Employee Development / Continuing Education Benefits
Business Development Commission
Flexible work hours and environment

Katam.ai is an early-phase Seattle-based startup with the mission to democratize machine learning to the wider developer/citizen developer community. Join Katam.ai to build a world class IDE for AI. Katam.ai Text Intelligence is a platform for developers that makes AI accessible to developers by adopting programming concepts familiar to programmers such as decomposition and lifecycle management through source control. Katam.ai Text Intelligence enables developers without machine learning expertise to build custom AI models interactively starting from little or no labeled data. These models enables enterprise automation scenarios like customer support, analysis of legal contracts or financial statements.
We are looking for a senior UX designer to join Katam.ai. We are working to build an elegant experience that involves the human in the loop in building AI models. The Katam.ai experience focuses on extracting the domain knowledge from the human and uses the human knowledge with the underlying machine learning to build high quality AI models. The Katam.ai experience is and AI IDE that simplifies machine learning concepts an put them in the language developers understand. Problems we are trying to solve include how to provide a conceptual flow to build robust models, how to guide the user at each step where the tool informs the user of the next best action to take, how to hide the complex machine learning concepts and let developers focus on conveying their domain knowledge, how to provide the right guidance to the developer on how to improve the model based on real traffic, how to manage the lifecycle of AI models using source control, and other problems that will challenge your critical thinking and creative abilities as much as your programming skills. We value new ideas, team players, and responsible self-starters
Responsibilities
Build an interactive machine learning platform for developers to build and maintain AI models
Work closely with the dev and research team to close the loop on new features and ship science innovation
Qualifications
7+ years of experience building UX for software products
UX experience with machine learning system and/or developer tools is a huge plus
Passion for creating simple and functional UX
MSc./Ph.D in UX-design or related discipline

Consulting Marketing Manager -Government & Public Services

Location is flexible - Preference for Atlanta, Boston, Chicago, Dallas, Philadelphia, Washington, DC


Are you a marketing and communications professional who is unafraid to think differently, always going the extra mile, and keeps current on the latest marketing trends? Are you looking to take your skills to the next level? Are you interested in working with different businesses executing strategic marketing campaigns? Do you thrive in a fast-paced and collaborative environment, working with colleagues in a virtual setting, to meet our business and client needs?

This position is responsible for providing strategic marketing support for our Government and Public Services (GPS) Customers and Marketing Offering Portfolio which developing marketing strategy for our GPS Digital Spectrum services, Human Center Design offerings, our Advertising and Marketing services, and our Human Services Transformation offering spanning federal and state and local government as well as higher education institution clients.

The ideal candidate will be an experienced marketing professional who possesses a strategic mindset with a demonstrated ability to work collaboratively with individuals at all levels of a matrix organization to execute integrated marketing campaigns that drive results.

Work You'll Do:

The GPS Customers and Marketing Offering Portfolio (GPS CM OP) marketing manager will serve as a trusted marketing advisor to business leaders and key stakeholders engaged in this high growth area. In this role you will oversee the strategy, planning and execution of best-in-class, integrated marketing and communications campaigns that support the GPS CM OP, utilizing innovative, go-to-market tools and approaches, and leveraging the full capabilities of the firm, including ecosystem and alliance relationships, to maximize market reach and impact. The GPS CMP OP Marketing Manager will report to the Government and Public Services (GPS) Industry Marketing Leader and will work closely with the GPS CM OP leadership team to differentiate the Deloitte brand, drive Deloitte's business priorities forward, deliver innovative content marketing strategies, and measure impact across the GPS market.

Specific areas of focus include:

Marketing & Communications Fundamentals: Experienced understanding of marketing and communications practices and technology to drive business goals
Project Management and Campaign Activation: Lead in the development, maintenance, and execution of integrated marketing campaigns spanning events, digital channels, social media, email marketing, and video/written content
Business Advisor: Serve as strategic marketing advisor to key stakeholders within GPS CM OP - assist with articulation of value propositions, develop marketing objectives in support of key priorities
Writing: Comfort with drafting different types of content spanning POVs, client success stories, video scripts/story boards
Thoughtware Execution and Commercialization: Design facilitation, editing, internal and external announcements, web postings, etc.
Content Development: Develop and edit content and collateral material and refreshing website content for consistent messaging and clear voice
Social Media: Creation and implementation of full social media plans for campaigns
Digital Marketing: Experience in digital marketing concepts spanning SEO, website development and design concepts
Product Marketing: Experience working in a product marketing department
Alliance Partner Marketing: Experience working with and managing Industry Partner/Alliance relationships and creating Industry Alliance Relationship co-branded experiences and marketing collateral
Event Management: Includes strategy, planning logistics, invitations, registration, conference materials and on-site assistance to create an experience
Impact Reporting: Gathers ROI data and inputs data into standard reports, focusing on data accuracy, storytelling, outcomes, etc.
Project Management: Able to manage multiple projects simultaneously
Collaboration: Comfortable managing multiple priorities in a heavily matrixed and virtual environment
Vendor Management: Able to source and manage vendor relationships
Budget Management: Plan and manage marketing budgets for campaigns

Qualifications:

Experience developing strategies for reaching a diverse audience of leadership personas
Experience in a professional services marketing organization marketing to the government and public sector, preferred
Experience working within the government ecosystem and familiarity with relevant government media organizations and strategic partners preferred
Experience marketing technical, digital and professional services and issues spanning digital transformation, AR/VR, cloud, AI, machine learning, CRM and digital engagement platforms
Experience with experiential design, event management and production
Experience with content marketing techniques, including audience segmentation, search engine optimization (SEO), and persona-based campaigns
Experience with marketing technology and innovation to drive and enhance campaign deliverables
Experience with product marketing concepts and techniques
Strong executive presence, professional client service manner, and demonstrated ability to take initiative, confident
Creative mindset with passion and drive to foster innovation in marketing and communications. Able to manage creative teams and give strategic direction to advance brand position in the market
Strong persuasive skills; able to gain consensus through influence and is comfortable with ambiguity across multiple senior stakeholders
Strong negotiation and problem-solving skills; flexibility and adaptability
Detail-oriented with excellent follow-through skills and able to manage and execute multiple projects and stakeholders simultaneously
Innovative thinker who brings new ideas to the discussion
Strong team player with the ability to work in a matrixed organization with a virtual team
Organized with ability to prioritize and manage client expectations across multiple, competing projects/priorities with aggressive due dates and quick turn-around times
Proficiency in MS Office Products including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Team and SharePoint
Familiarity with Adobe Creative Suite a plus

Other requirements

Bachelor's degree required (Business, Marketing or Communications preferred)
10+ years of experience
Travel up to 10% (while travel of up to 10% is a requirement of the role, due to COVID-19, non-essential travel has been suspended until further notice.)
Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future.

Our success is dependent on building teams that include people from different backgrounds and experiences who can challenge each other’s assumptions with fresh perspectives. To that end, we look for a diverse pool of applicants including those from historically marginalized groups — women, people with disabilities, people of color, people who are lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, and/or gender nonconforming, first and second generation immigrants, veterans, and people from different socioeconomic backgrounds.
The Role
As a Data Engineer at Outreach you will have the opportunity to evolve and shape our data ecosystem. We’re looking for a Data Engineer who is passionate about building resilient data pipelines and enabling data users across the entire organization. You will have a great opportunity to make an impact at a young and growing company and help the Business Systems team partner with the broader organization to evolve and mature our analytics, data science, and automation functions.

If you are familiar with building environments to enable BI engineers and analysts, enjoy finding creative solutions to data problems, and are enthusiastic about learning or improving your skills using best practices in data modeling and ETL/ELT process for delivering multi-dimensional datasets, we have interesting challenges for you.


About The Team
The Business Systems Data Engineering team is on a mission to bring relevant data to every person at Outreach while advancing the use of data and promoting an insight-centric culture. We are a centralized resource providing a suite of services to Outreach business functions across Finance, Analytics, and Support systems, with data as the critical component to a seamless experience.
Your Daily Adventures Will Include:
Implement data ingestion routines that deliver raw data in a usable format
Implement and enhance a modern workflow orchestration platform
Automate data processes and integrations across multiple internal teams
Help with developing, constructing, test, and maintenance of Business Systems data architecture
Provide input and recommendations on technical issues and think through trade-offs and risks and communicate them with team/business stakeholders
Work with stakeholders to establish requirements and explain the benefits/risks of proposed approaches
Recommend and implement solutions to improve data reliability, efficiency, and quality
Basic Qualifications:
3 years of Data Engineering experience
Fluency with SQL querying and optimization (Snowflake and Mysql preferred)
Experience building data pipelines with Python
Experience coding
Experience with modern orchestration platforms like Airflow
Our tech stack: Snowflake, Python, DBT - data build tool, Tableau, Airflow
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with DBT
Experience working with APIs
Experience with CI/CD
Experience with containers (Docker/Kubernetes)
Experience in creating data sources and administering Tableau server
Advanced degree in a quantitative discipline
Familiarity with modern data warehousing architecture and processes
Interest in implementing DataOps concepts
Outreach is the number one sales engagement platform. Using advanced machine learning and AI to automate and prioritize customer touchpoints, Outreach dramatically increases sales reps' effectiveness and ability to drive smarter, more insightful engagement with their customers.
At Outreach, we're on a mission to change the way companies engage with their customers throughout their lifecycle.
We understand how technology can change the game for revenue teams, driving innovation and efficient growth with every interaction, and making every customer-facing rep wildly productive.
Outreachers live out our core values on a daily basis. We're always looking for people who embody our values to come to join us on our mission!
We are hungry craftspeople who are obsessed with continuous improvement. We have grit, take ownership, and are honest with ourselves, our colleagues, and our community. We are one with our customers, and we find strength in diversity and inclusion. When you're part of the Outreach family, we got your back, no matter what.

The Office of the CTO for Microsoft is chartered with understanding, shaping, and accelerating technologies and their impact on Microsoft, industry, and society in order to empower every person and every organization to achieve more. Whether it is providing insights company-wide, giving meaning to an “AI First” company, or helping to drive the impact of “Intelligent Cloud/ Intelligent Edge Computing”, the Office of the CTO is down in the trenches, working with our engineering, field, and strategy teams across the company. We gather information, synthesize best practices, drive cross-company workstreams, support cross-industry partnerships and engage in activities that inform the CTO and the SLT, and move the needle on Microsoft’s strategic and technical direction.
The deputy office is focused on Scale H2 Technologies and includes highly technical, but cross-functional and highly independent leaders who accelerate leading-edge technology to scalable, rapidly growing solutions. This team works across the company by connecting people, resources, and ideas across organizations and disciplinary boundaries. We are the glue between the customer need + strategy + technical execution. We are the 1+1 >2.
Advanced Technology Advisor is an experienced technologist across hardware, software, networking, possessing scientific acumen, operations, and a passion for products. You must have hands-on experience and abilities to scale up, down and across the stack, understand product drivers, and come up to speed rapidly on new tech. In other words, you are the tech savant, that can learn fast, find the big picture and build technical direction through hands-on prototypes.
Responsibilities
Hands-on with cutting-edge technologies, jump-in directly into code, prototype, connect and improve on architectural components of solutions.
Can understand and map technical architecture, hold their own with product teams.
Formulate Point of View, articulate and write down papers and proposals that outline recommendations.
Has strong product acumen, usability research, and user experience background.
Can wade through and understand deep technical concepts, rationalize and align them across organizations.
Strategic thinker, with a thorough understanding of market trends, a passion for deep technical and market analysis, and a capable writer ready to present to C-Suite leaders.
Work with Technical Teams, Business Development, Corporate Development leaders and M12, to align the organization and accelerate scalability of growth businesses.
Technically proficient in AI/ML, Edge devices, Robotics, Autonomy, Networks, Front-end scalability, but most importantly fast hands-on experience building and shipping rapidly scaled products.
Has a proven track record working on innovative technologies, contributing to important strategic technical projects.
Strong operational program manager that leaves no stone unturned, but can communicate at the appropriate level of abstraction, a self-starter who can work in ambiguous environments, keeping the shared goals in mind.
Qualifications
Required
10+ years of experience in progressively senior Technical/Engineering/ CTO role with hands-on experience across startups and large companies
Experience leading technical projects, shipping software, troubleshooting technical issues
Preferred
Founder experience
Be respected by product and technical teams
Excellent communicator and EQ
Be able to lead through influence, work across teams at scale, and feel confident engaging with executives
Artificial Intelligence, 5G, Intelligent Edge, and IoT expertise
Cloud development at scale: Azure or similar
Ph.D. or MS degree in Computer Science
Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.
Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

Conversica is the pioneer and leading provider of Intelligent Virtual Assistants helping organizations attract, acquire and grow customers at scale. Conversica Intelligent Virtual Assistants are AI-powered, SaaS-based software applications that serve as virtual team members and autonomously engage contacts, prospects, customers, or partners in personalized human-like, two-way interactions to drive towards the next best action across the customer revenue lifecycle; whether that’s scheduling a sales meeting, gauging interest to buy additional products or services, or politely but persistently collecting overdue payments.Reaching out to over 100 million people on behalf of thousands of companies, Conversica Intelligent Virtual Assistants are built on a proven and patented intelligent automation platform integrating natural language understanding (NLU), natural language generation (NLG), autonomous action chains and deep learning capabilities that engage prospects over multiple communication channels and in multiple languages.Winning multiple awards including Inc. 5000 fastest growing companies and recognized by Gartner as a Cool Vendor, Conversica is a portfolio company of Providence Equity, Kennet Partners and Toba Capital and is headquartered in Foster City, California in Silicon Valley with additional US offices in Seattle and Bellingham, Washington.We are looking for a high-performing Software Development Manager who is able to lead and manage one or more engineering teams for Conversica. The person in this role should be an experienced engineering professional with a proven track record of delivering value-centric, quality B2B Enterprise SaaS products. We are enhancing our existing and building out the next generation of AI Assistants on our Conversational AI platform.This role can be Remote based and/or work from our office locations in Seattle or Bellingham, WA or Foster City, CA.ResponsibilitiesLead an engineering team developing services and applications in various system areas such as conversation development, natural language and machine learning applications, reporting and analytics, administration and control, and platform servicesOrganize, lead, and participate in design sessions about your services and applications as well as other components from all areas of our systemManage and grow teams and talent for current and future goalsPerform hands-on code development, both individually and in cooperation with team members, test your code, and ship it to productionMaintain and debug your services and applications in our production environmentWork closely with our Product Management, UX and our Customer Success teamsHave fun, be fun, and get a lot doneRequirements7+ years professional hands-on software development experience preferably with high-volume distributed systems experienceBachelor’s degree in Computer Science or similar experience in a related technical fieldExperience managing high-performance engineering teams of 4-10 team membersStrong architecture, design, and coding skills with an understanding of service-oriented-architecture and micro-service-architecture (MSA) patternsStrong demonstrable knowledge of both relational and NoSQL databases, preferably MySQL, redshift, and DynamoDBStrong software development process background in Agile methodologies such as Scrum and KanbanExemplary communication skills (both oral and written) with experience producing technical and design documentation of complex systems and processesIn-depth knowledge of object-oriented methodologies, UML design techniques, event driven architectures, and other design patternsFamiliarity with open-source libraries/frameworks, preferably in Python, JavaScript or PHPExperience with XML, JSON and restful Web-servicesRelevant experience developing applications and mentoring development teams to meet privacy by design and security by design principles.Direct experience enforcing privacy and security perimeter control, access, service, and API design requirements based on roles against a least privilege, zero trust model. The candidate will be expected to manage a team of Software Development Engineers that implement changes to Conversica’s application successfully according to Conversica’s Software Development Lifecycle, Secure Development Policy, Architectural standards, and Security Requirements.General understanding of U.S. and international privacy laws and regulations, especially as it relates to database access controls and security design requirements (Applicable Conversica Regulations - GDPR, CCPA, CAN-SPAM, and COPPA). General understanding of applicable security frameworks (AWS CIS Benchmark, SOC 2, ISO 27001, HIPPA, PCI-DSS)Experience with applied AI frameworks is a plus#LI-RemoteConversica is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity at our company. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this Web site or directly to managers. Conversica does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. We will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Conversica.Job Type: Full-time

Billions of people use our services to connect and communicate in their preferred language, but many of these languages lack traditional NLP resources and our systems need to be robust to the informal tone, slang and typos often found in daily communication. Our research spans multiple areas across NLP and machine learning, including deep learning/neural networks, machine translation, natural language understanding and generation, low-resource NLP, question answering, dialogue, and cross-lingual and cross-domain transfer learning. We are seeking world-class natural language processing experts to join our teams in developing products and platforms, conducting and publishing research, and engineering at scale. We're applying cutting-edge language technologies to a wide range of media understanding challenges at Facebook.


Conduct research to advance the state-of-the-art in neural networks and NLP.
Utilize that research to develop and deploy scalable neural network models into production to impact billions of people using Facebook.
Collaborate with team members from other research and applied research teams working on a variety of deep learning and NLP problems.


Currently has or is in the process of obtaining a PhD degree or postdoctoral assignment in Natural Language Processing or a related field.
1 or more years experience with developing modern NLP systems.
Must obtain work authorization in country of employment at the time of hire, and maintain ongoing work authorization during employment.


Research and software engineer experience demonstrated via grants, fellowships, patents, internship, work experience, and/or coding competitions.
Research experience in cross-lingual understanding, few-shot learning, and/or zero-shot learning.
First-authored publications at peer-reviewed conferences (e.g. ACL, EMNLP, NAACL, AAAI, ICML, NeurIPS, or similar).
Experience with Statistics, Natural Language Processing, ML platforms, and algorithms.
Experience with scripting and coding.
Experience with responsible AI, Ethical AI, Symbolic AI, and reasoning paradigms.


Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.


Facebook is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.Facebook is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations-ext@fb.com.
