SIHB Core Competencies
Core Competencies are foundational commitments and skills that all SIHB staff are expected to develop. These competencies define common measures for performance that are applied to every role in the organization.
Commitment to Indigenous and Organizational Values: Everything we do at SIHB is centered on Traditional Indian Medicine. It is our responsibility to maintain cultural integrity in all that we do.
Accountability: All employees of SIHB effectively manage their own work and the work of their teams. We take ownership of our actions and decisions. We all strive to deliver the highest quality work and care, while respecting our teammates and relatives.
Collaboration: SIHB is a team-oriented organization. As team members, we share the responsibility of working toward a common purpose. We collaborate with our colleagues across the organization to deliver the highest quality of care and results in alignment with our mission, vision, values and Theory of Change.
Communication: We practice effective and clear communication with staff, relatives, teams and community. We demonstrate empathy among each other and with those we serve, and transparency in our decision making.
Customer Service Orientation: All employees of SIHB recognize the needs of the diverse community we serve. We put the needs of our relatives first by delivering the highest quality, professional, responsive, and innovative care. Our relatives come first and deserve the best.
Position Summary: This position is a senior-level management position responsible for directing operations of SIHBs Dental Department. The director works closely with other senior leadership staff to carry out the mission of the SIHB in the delivery of culturally appropriate, high quality, accessible healthcare.
Organizational Structure/Reporting Relationships: The Dental Director reports to the Chief Executive Officer and is a member of the dental team. This position works closely with leadership across the agency. There are direct reports for this position.
Organizational Responsibilities
Hold Indigenous values and practices with respect and integrity
Hold yourself accountable to the highest standard by being resourceful, innovative, creative and solutions-oriented
Actively participate in organizational activities with the understanding that success is achieved through teamwork.
Recognize that communication is central to the organizations success and actively champion your words and actions to maintain respect for others, encourage constructive feedback, be open to share laughter and acknowledge differences in skills and opinions, all while keeping others best intentions in mind.
At SIHB, we refer to our customers as Relatives. Our Relatives come first and deserve the best. Serve the needs of our Relatives first by delivering the highest quality, professional, responsive and innovative care.
Job Responsibilities
Provide dental care services as a clinic dentist.
Participate in planning and development of dental services. Assist in identification of revenue streams, budget, and funding needs.
Participate in state, local, and other relevant discussions to represent community and agency needs and resources. Stay informed of legislative, licensing or other changes affecting dental service delivery or funding.
Ensure requirements are met for current licensure/certification and accreditation. Prepare, coordinate, and facilitate dental reviews and audits.
Ensure maximum utilization of resources; monitor productivity and implement operational improvements as required.
Oversee implementation of dental quality improvement activities; ensure regular monitoring and reporting as required.
Ensure appropriate oversight and supervision of dental staff. Ensure consistent implementation of policies and procedures.
Other duties as assigned related to position.
Background Qualifications
Required:
Graduation of School of Dentistry and current Washington State Dentist license.
At least two years experience as a practicing dentist.
Experience with electronic health records.
At least one year supervisory experience.
Knowledge of dental regulations and requirements.
Excellent communication skills.
Ability to lead service delivery team of professional and entry-level staff.
Familiarity with health and social issues facing American Indians/Alaska Natives and a desire to promote the delivery of appropriate health services to this population.
Ability to successfully complete a background check.
Experience working with the unique healthcare needs and social issues facing American Indians/Alaska Natives (AI/AN) and the desire to promote the delivery of appropriate health services to this population.
Work Environment: Clinic hours operate currently 8-5p M-F with every other week Saturday clinics. All dentists will be required to rotate in weekend clinics as above. Dentists work on 4- 10 hour shifts per week (with time allowed for non-face-to-face time).

The Education Partnerships Associate position is responsible for sales operations, sales support, and new customer development with U.S. higher education institutions. The Education Partnerships Associate will identify regional and national markets to grow AstrumU’s network of education partner institutions, and has responsibilities directly related to management of: sales forecasting, pipeline management, converting leads to closed contracts, and sales operations. The individual who will excel in this role will provide strategic advice to prospective customers on suitability of products and solutions based on critical business needs, prepare compelling proposals and deliver exceptional presentations. AstrumU’s education partnerships are growing rapidly. The Education Partnerships Associate will be a critical team member in driving results for company-wide initiatives of scaling new partner development with dozens of leading U.S. universities.


This position requires an in‐depth knowledge of higher education technology solutions, specifically within the categories of enrollment management, student journey management and alumni engagement initiatives. The position also requires knowledge of the Education industry at large, with a focus on higher education data-driven strategy. Must have the ability to research and develop customer solutions with AstrumU personnel; including product managers, data science leads and engineering staff.
Principal Accountabilities

Sales operations and sales support for AstrumU’s national go-to-market strategy across higher education institutions
New customer development across professional school target personas in higher education, partnering with Deans and Associate Deans on AstrumU’s AI-powered solutions to demonstrate personalized ROI of credentials to prospective students.
Manage sales materials, proposals and contract agreements with Education Partners.

Implement strategy for Education Partner go-to-market business development and sales activities
Travel for Education Partner prospecting and sales efforts.
Continually evaluate Education Partner process strategies and recommend efficiencies and Partner Success improvement.
Participate in revenue budget forecasting and ongoing budget variance reporting.
All ratified employees and contractors with access to confidential customer data and information must agree to abide by the company privacy code of conduct.
AstrumU is committed to training and development: monthly security-training is mandatory and is logged and audited.
Required Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree from an accredited higher education institution.
2+ years of experience in Higher Education, technology sales or related experience.
Strong background in new customer development, go-to-market strategies and innovative technology solutions.
Thorough understanding of technology, SaaS solutions, and general IT architecture.
Must be knowledgeable and have experience working directly in SAAS technology sales and/or higher education industry sales.
Knowledgeable of AstrumU's offerings unique value proposition for Education Partners.
Working knowledge of enrollment marketing and management, student journey management, alumni engagement and corporate relations for higher education institutions.
Displays a basic understanding of competitors’ products and service offerings.
Must have exceptional communications skills (both verbal and written) and a strong drive to help customers with creative solutions.
Proven success in the development and presentation of Education Partner proposals, strategic SaaS solutions and success in closing complex technical sales.
Strong listening and analytical skills are required to determine customer needs and requests.
Strong presentation skills are required, both in person and via teleconference or videoconference.
Ability to make sound decisions with the information at hand, with the end goal of Partner satisfaction and positive revenue generation.
Project lead and management experience.
Well organized, with attention to detail.
Excellent organizational skills allowing to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
Valid Driver’s License.

Who we are:

Dataminr puts real-time AI and public data to work for our clients, generating relevant and actionable alerts for global corporations, public sector agencies, newsrooms, and NGOs. Our leading AI platform detects the earliest signals of high-impact events and emerging risks from vast amounts of publicly available information. Our real-time alerts enable tens of thousands of users at hundreds of public and private sector organizations to learn first of breaking events around the world, develop effective risk mitigation strategies, and respond with confidence as crises unfold.

Dataminr is making its mark for growth and innovation, recently earning recognition on the Deloitte Technology Fast 500, Forbes AI 50 and Forbes Cloud 100 lists. We also earned accolades for 'Most Innovative Use of AI' from the 2020 AI & Machine Learning Awards.

Join our team and help the world manage risk in real time. You'll work with 800+ talented people across eight offices, united by our passion to collaborate, make a difference, and have fun while doing it!
Who you are:

You're self-motivated and self-directed with a passion for building and maintaining relationships with customers, fully understanding their needs, and advocating on their behalf. You understand your customers' strategic objectives and help them achieve success as an expert on Dataminr's First Alert product. You are knowledgeable of major trends and events impacting US national security, publicly available information, and big data and can translate these into actionable insights for your customers.

As a Customer Success Manager, you will drive First Alert product adoption, renewal, and usage among First Alert customers, as well as build a strategy to foster account growth. You are excited to combine your interests in technology, government, national security, and customer success to transform the way our customers adopt and use First Alert.

Responsibilities:

Expand the scope and scale of First Alert adoption, while driving successful customer outcomes within your assigned portfolio
Collaborate with Client Engagement Executives to develop and execute short and long term strategies for your assigned portfolio to meet business goals
Help build and improve scalable systems to support and engage customers throughout the customer lifecycle
Design and implement scalable programs that seamlessly integrate First Alert into customer workflows, and align with customer's enterprise level objectives
Partner with and lead Customer Success Associates to drive product adoption, renewal, and customer satisfaction
Develop and maintain relationships across your account portfolio through capability briefings, product demonstrations, trainings, and execution of playbooks / regular check-ins
Serve as a trusted advisor to the customer being well-versed in best practices, customer mission areas, and customer needs for optimal performance throughout the customer lifecycle
Serve as a First Alert platform expert ensuring customer engagements support organizational goals and drive positive outcomes for the customer beyond basic platform features and functionality
Collect customer feedback and clearly articulate recommendations for First Alert product development to our engineering and product teams
Successfully leverage data-driven metrics and reporting to understand and stay ahead of risks and opportunities that impact retention and growth

Desired Skills and Experience:

Bachelor's degree or equivalent relevant experience in a related field
5-7 years of customer success/account management experience OR experience implementing and leading military, accounts, programs, or operations supporting senior military leaders
Software/SaaS and people management experience are a plus
Specific experience supporting the public sector, including but not limited to the US Department of Defense. US Army experience is a plus.
Knowledge and/or experience with publicly available information and the real-time alerting needs of public sector organizations, including but not limited to military, law enforcement or emergency management
Outstanding communication and presentation skills, with an emphasis on communicating both orally and in writing with senior military leaders and decision makers
Ability to communicate complex concepts to a wide range of audiences, including technical and non-technical customers
High level of accountability and the ability to execute independently on multiple and competing projects and deadlines
Ability to think on your feet, work through ambiguity, and problem solve in real-time
Detail-oriented with excellent organizational skills and a strong focus on delivering the best possible client experience
Ability and desire to work collaboratively with a team
Must currently hold or have the ability to obtain a Secret clearance at a minimum

Why you should work here:

We recognize and reward hard work with:
company paid benefits for employees and their dependents, including medical, dental, vision, disability and life insurance
401(k) savings plan with company matching
flexible spending account for out-of-pocket medical, transit, parking and dependent care expenses
We want you to be your best, authentic self by supporting you with:
a diverse, driven, and passionate team of coworkers who want you to succeed
individual learning and development fund and professional training
generous paid time off; including sick leave and 100% company paid parental leave
remote working friendly perks such as expanded telehealth options for mental and physical well being, virtual yoga, meditation and health and fitness app reimbursements

…and this is just to name a few!

Seattle Indian Health Board is seeking TWO Traditional Health Apprentices to join our amazing team!
SIHB Core Competencies
Core Competencies are foundational commitments and skills that all SIHB staff are expected to develop. These competencies define common measures for performance that are applied to every role in the organization.
Commitment to Indigenous and Organizational Values: Everything we do at SIHB is centered on Traditional Indian Medicine. It is our responsibility to maintain cultural integrity in all that we do.
Accountability: All employees of SIHB effectively manage their own work and the work of their teams. We take ownership of our actions and decisions. We all strive to deliver the highest quality work and care, while respecting our teammates and relatives.
Collaboration: SIHB is a team-oriented organization. As team members, we share the responsibility of working toward a common purpose. We collaborate with our colleagues across the organization to deliver the highest quality of care and results in alignment with our mission, vision, values and Theory of Change.
Communication: We practice effective and clear communication with staff, relatives, teams and community. We demonstrate empathy among each other and with those we serve, and transparency in our decision making.
Customer Service Orientation: All employees of SIHB recognize the needs of the diverse community we serve. We put the needs of our relatives first by delivering the highest quality, professional, responsive, and innovative care. Our relatives come first and deserve the best.
Position Summary: The Traditional Health Apprentice’s main responsibility is to provide and support Traditional Indian Medicine (TIM) services at SIHB (including Thunderbird Treatment Center). This position will assist in the provision and promotion of cultural education to both Native and non-Native patients, service providers and the community at large.
Organizational Structure/Reporting Relationships: This position reports directly to the Traditional Health Program Director and is a member of the Traditional Medicine Team. This position has no direct reports.
Organizational Responsibilities
Hold Indigenous values and practices with respect and integrity
Hold yourself accountable to the highest standard by being resourceful, innovative, creative and solutions-oriented
Actively participate in organizational activities with the understanding that success is achieved through teamwork.
Recognize that communication is central to the organization’s success and actively champion your words and actions to maintain respect for others, encourage constructive feedback, be open to share laughter and acknowledge differences in skills and opinions, all while keeping others’ best intentions in mind.
At SIHB, we refer to our customers as Relatives. Our Relatives come first and deserve the best. Serve the needs of our Relatives first by delivering the highest quality, professional, responsive and innovative care.
Job Responsibilities
Coordinate the development of a culturally based service approach that focuses on an indigenous and trauma informed system of care
Work with clinical staff and participate in the coordinated care teams to provide traditional medicine services to relatives (patients)
Develop, maintain, and monitor educational program schedules which are designed for AI/AN people and SIHB staff to learn about Native traditions and cultural practices considering both tribal diversity and universal beliefs
Coordinate and monitor the effectiveness of culturally based programs, classes, and activities for relatives
Work with relatives and community members, volunteers, and SIHB staff to implement program activities
Purchase and monitor program supplies
Maintain file and data reporting systems which contribute to program analysis and evaluations to monitor program performance standards and requirements
Provide support to TIM Practitioners as needed
Actively participate in internal quality-improvement teams and work with members proactively to drive quality-improvement initiatives in accordance with the mission and strategic goals of the organization, federal/state/local laws and regulations, and accreditation standards.
Other job-related duties as assigned.
Background Qualifications
Required:
High school degree or GED.
Advanced education preferred but not required (example: qualified TIM practitioner).
Knowledge of AI|AN traditional and cultural activities.
Knowledge of community resources for traditional health services.
Communication and networking skills; ability to work independently.
Ability to work varied hours, including evenings and weekends as required.
Knowledge of computer applications necessary to fulfill job duties.
Experience participating in AI|AN cultural events and activities; strong background in AI|AN community work preferred.
Experience teaching AI|AN arts and crafts.
Experience providing TIM services preferred.
Work well under pressure, meet multiple and often competing deadlines.
At all times, demonstrate cooperative behavior with supervisors, subordinates, colleagues, clients/relatives, and the community.
Experience working with the unique healthcare needs and social issues facing American Indians/Alaska Natives (AI/AN) and the desire to promote the delivery of appropriate health services to this population.
Able to lift 30 pounds and to perform physically demanding tasks.
Valid Washington State driver’s license, proof of car insurance and use of a personal vehicle.
Work Environment: Clinic hours are Monday-Friday during normal business hours, with evening hours and some Saturdays. Duties may involve long hours performing sedentary work at computer terminal.

Our Purpose

SonderMind is a VC-backed digital health company redesigning behavioral health through covered and timely access, increased utilization, and data-validated quality outcomes. We are a team of Explorers, Builders, and Change Makers democratizing the complicated world of behavioral healthcare for therapists and clients alike.


How you'll make an impact

As a Software Engineer on our Data Science team, you will help design, develop, and maintain data-driven services and pipelines supporting internal research and experimentation as well as driving measurably improved mental health outcomes for our users.


Success Looks Like
Make meaningful improvements to the team's technical and onboarding documentation while building a working knowledge of existing services and architecture
Successfully own the implementation of a major feature or service all the way to production
 Be a foundational component of the team's ability to deliver business value at a high velocity


What you'll do
Collaborate with peers and internal stakeholders to foster team agility
Design, develop, and maintain distributed services supporting highly available workloads
Proactively seek out (and improve) documentation and intra-team knowledge sharing
Effectively estimate time to implement designs


What you'll bring with you
Critical Competencies
Quality of Work: Freedom from errors and mistakes and the ability to consistently meet objectives

Collaboration & Teamwork: Team-oriented, focus on "we" over "me".
Learning Agility: shows a strong willingness to learn and adjust to new people and environments. Actively works to understand strengths, identify opportunities to develop, embrace new ways of thinking and apply new information
Solution Orientation: sees problems as opportunities. Understands, captures, and enhances stakeholder vision. Adjust the solution to suit the problem and stakeholder


 Required Experience
3+ years experience professionally developing software in a team environment
Experience translating customer requirements into technical features and developing code to implement said features
Ability to write well-structured, maintainable, idiomatic code with good documentation
Experience with service-oriented-architecture or designing functionally-decomposed systems
Working knowledge of at least one major public cloud platform


Preferred Experience
Undergraduate degree (or better) in Computer Science or a closely related field
Experience with microservice development in Go or Python (especially with frameworks like Gin or Flask)
Experience working with Data Scientists or ML/AI Engineers
Experience developing containerized services with Docker and Kubernetes
Experience working in a high-security industry or other strong experience with compliance-based data-privacy concerns


Other Details

This role can sit in any of these cities : Austin, TX, Boston, MA, Chicago, IL, Denver, CO, Nashville, TN, Madison, WI, Pittsburgh, PA, Raleigh, NC, or Seattle, WA.

Compensation range for this position is $95,000-$125,000. Actual title and compensation are commensurate with experience and skills.
What we value

Transparency: We say what we mean and mean what we say
Bucketworthiness: We can be relied upon to not let our bucket leak
Ownership: We take initiative to act before being asked
Courage: We move fast, take calculated risks and (sometimes) fail
Empathy: We treat others with respect and assume their best intentions
Passion: We loosely hold strong opinions, debate and then commit forcefully


Commitment to an Inclusive Workplace

Mental wellness impacts people of every community. At SonderMind, building and supporting a diverse workforce is foundational to our goal to redesign behavioral healthcare to be more approachable and accessible. SonderMind is a committed equal opportunity employer and provides a workplace that will not tolerate discrimination or harassment.

Our employees may be exposed to sensitive personal information throughout their regular duties. For this reason, we maintain exceptionally high expectations of ethical conduct and require all incoming employees to pass a background check.


Our Employee Benefits Philosophy

As a leader in redesigning behavioral health we are walking the walk with our employee benefits package. We focus on meeting SonderMinders wherever they are and supporting them in all facets of their life with both mental and physical aspects in mind. Where most companies say "good enough" we ask ourselves "how can we do better." That includes:

Therapy coverage benefits to enable our employees to get the care they need
Employer-paid disability & AD&D to cover life's unexpected - not only that, we cover the difference in salary for up to Eight weeks of short-term disability leave
Eight weeks of paid parental leave (if the parent also qualifies for STD, this benefit is in addition)
A generous PTO policy and a company mandate of at MINIMUM three-weeks of PTO a year; flexible work-from-home policy
A commitment to reward our team members for the long-term success and growth of SonderMind with stock option grants
Competitive market salary, up-to 4% salary company match on 401K, professional development and advancement opportunities as we rapidly scale, and so much more.

Your next challenge:

AI2 is seeking a Predoctoral Young Investigator (PYI) to join our Semantic Scholar Research team.

The PYI program offers predoctoral candidates the opportunity to prepare for graduate-level research through partnership with strong mentors from the Research team, participation in cutting edge research, and co-authorship of papers at top venues. This program aims to position candidates for successful entry into a top graduate program. For potential candidates who are already enrolled in graduate studies, the PYI program offers the opportunity to work with researchers at AI2 on collaborative projects for the benefit of both AI2's initiatives and your thesis work. For potential candidates who are choosing between entering a PhD program or seeking employment in industry, the PYI program can provide valuable exposure to graduate-level research and help inform your career decisions.

PYIs on our team have the opportunity to:

Define and lead ambitious, high-impact research projects,
Collaborate with and learn from team members across AI2, including scientists and engineers,
Author scientific papers for publication in high-profile conferences or journals,
Implement and share open source software to improve access to our research,
Contribute to the Semantic Scholar project through new models or software systems.
Learn about and leverage Semantic Scholar & AI2 data, engineering infrastructure, and research tools,
Gain experience in a supportive and fast-paced industry research environment

Please apply by Jan 15th, 2022 for full consideration, though applications may continue to be considered until positions are filled.

We are currently hiring for start dates in 2022. Please reach out to s2-research-careers@allenai.org with any questions about the hiring process or timeline. Note for early applicants that we are unlikely to consider your application until the stated deadline; if this does not work for you, please reach out to the above email.


What you'll need:

Bachelor's or master's degree, or expected to graduate with one before the start of the PYI program.
Interest in entering a PhD program in Computer Science or related field in the next 1-3 years. We accept applications from candidates who have yet to apply to PhD programs, as well as candidates who are already accepted into a PhD program.
Excited about conducting graduate-level research in natural language processing, human-computer interaction, language and vision, machine learning, information retrieval, knowledge representation, data science, or other related fields. We do not require prior experience in these areas, but successful PYI candidates are those who have been able to articulate why they're interested in pursuing research in these areas & why they're uniquely qualified to do so.
Strong software engineering skills.

Bonus qualifications:

Preprints or publications on AI-related topics at AI or HCI venues.
Experience with deep learning frameworks (e.g. PyTorch, Tensorflow).
Contributions to open-source research libraries (e.g. AllenNLP, spaCy).
Familiarity with building web interfaces. Understanding how to turn an idea into a working, browser-based interface is a plus.
Experience conducting user studies.


Why Semantic Scholar?

As a Predoctoral Young Investigator on our team, you'll have the unique opportunity to see your research improve the productivity and discovery experience of millions of scholars who use Semantic Scholar (semanticscholar.org).

We collaborate frequently with researchers on other AI2 teams focused on natural language processing and computer vision, among others. Our main office has close ties and unique access to researchers at the University of Washington, only 1.5 miles away. Researchers excited about such internal and external collaborations are encouraged to apply.

See our team page (https://research.semanticscholar.org/publications) for examples of our work.


Who We Are:

The Allen Institute for Artificial Intelligence is a non-profit research institute in Seattle founded by Paul Allen and headed by Professor Oren Etzioni. The core mission of AI2 is to contribute to humanity through high-impact research in artificial intelligence.

In addition to AI2's core mission, we also aim to contribute to humanity through our treatment of each member of the AI2 Team. Some highlights are:

We are a learning organization – because everything AI2 does is ground-breaking, we are learning every day. Similarly, through weekly AI2 Academy lectures, a wide variety of world-class AI experts as guest speakers, and our commitment to your personal on-going education, AI2 is place where you will have opportunities to continue learning alongside your coworkers.
We value diversity - We seek to hire, support, and promote people from all genders, ethnicities, and all levels of experience regardless of age. We particularly encourage applications from women, non-binary individuals, people of color, members of the LGBTQA+ community, and people with disabilities of any kind.
We value inclusion - We understand the value that people's individual experiences and perspectives can bring to an organization, and we are building a culture in which all voices are heard, respected and considered.
We emphasize a healthy work/life balance – we believe our team members are happiest and most productive when their work/life balance is optimized. While we value powerful research results which drive our mission forward, we also value dinner with family, weekend time, and vacation time. We offer generous paid vacation and sick leave as well as family leave.
We are collaborative and transparent – we consider ourselves a team, all moving with a common purpose. We are quick to cheer our successes, and even quicker to share and jointly problem solve our failures.
We are in Seattle – and our office is on the water! We have mountains, we have lakes, we have four seasons, we bike to work, we have a vibrant theater scene, and we have so much else. We even have kayaks for you to paddle right outside our front door. We welcome interest from applicants from outside of the United States.
We are friendly– chances are you will like every one of the 100+ (and growing) people who work here. We do.

AI2 is proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at hr@allenai.org or you may call us at 206-548-5600.

SIHB Core Competencies
Core Competencies are foundational commitments and skills that all SIHB staff are expected to develop. These competencies define common measures for performance that are applied to every role in the organization.
Commitment to Indigenous and Organizational Values: Everything we do at SIHB is centered on Traditional Indian Medicine. It is our responsibility to maintain cultural integrity in all that we do.
Accountability: All employees of SIHB effectively manage their own work and the work of their teams. We take ownership of our actions and decisions. We all strive to deliver the highest quality work and care, while respecting our teammates and relatives.
Collaboration: SIHB is a team-oriented organization. As team members, we share the responsibility of working toward a common purpose. We collaborate with our colleagues across the organization to deliver the highest quality of care and results in alignment with our mission, vision, values, and Theory of Change.
Communication: We practice effective and clear communication with staff, relatives, teams, and community. We demonstrate empathy among each other and with those we serve, and transparency in our decision making.
Customer Service Orientation: All employees of SIHB recognize the needs of the diverse community we serve. We put the needs of our relatives first by delivering the highest quality, professional, responsive, and innovative care. Our relatives come first and deserve the best.
Position Summary: With appropriate guidance, the Outreach Worker will be responsible for identifying and engaging American Indian and Alaska Native (AI/AN) youth in services focused on mental health and wellness. This position will outreach and network with AI/AN youth served by Seattle Indian Health Board through clinical and traditional health services, as well as other organizations that serve AI/AN youth.
The Outreach Worker will primarily be working public health and behavioral health among urban Native youth. Working collaboratively with program staff and community partners, the Outreach Worker will participate in data collection activities and the creation and implementation of data-informed prevention resources.
Organizational Structure/Reporting Relationships:
This position reports directly to the Program Manager and is a member of the UIHI team.
Organizational Responsibilities
Hold Indigenous values and practices with respect and integrity
Hold yourself accountable to the highest standard by being resourceful, innovative, creative, and solutions-oriented
Actively participate in organizational activities with the understanding that success is achieved through teamwork
Recognize that communication is central to the organization’s success and actively champion your words and actions to maintain respect for others, encourage constructive feedback, be open to share laughter and acknowledge differences in skills and opinions, all while keeping others’ best intentions in mind
At SIHB, we refer to our customers as Relatives. Our Relatives come first and deserve the best. Serve the needs of our Relatives first by delivering the highest quality, professional, responsive, and innovative care
Job Responsibilities
Identify and network with Seattle Indian Health Board programs and providers serving AI/AN youth
Identify and network with community partners and other agencies serving AI/AN youth
Participate in advisory meetings and/or coalitions with community partners and stakeholders on a continual basis
Build relationships with partners to promote and enhance coordinated, effective service delivery
Network with colleagues and promote participation in program activities
Provide information and perform project outreach at community events and other sites
Engage youth in services and activities to promote positive life skills building and to prevent underage substance misuse
Recruit youth to participate in project activities including surveys and focus groups
Facilitate survey and focus group activities including data collection and incentive distribution
Participate in the development of research and evaluation tools, such as survey questionnaires, forms, and procedures for gathering and processing data
Maintain electronic files and records, databases, and/or computer tracking systems for project documentation and monitoring
Assist with preparing grant deliverables and progress report submission
Plan and staff events and training in support of the project and the Urban Indian Health Institute
Schedule, coordinate, facilitate, and plan for meetings, including managing calendars, preparing agendas and minutes, and hosting for both in-person and online formats
Support Traditional Health integration to achieve the overall department goals and objectives as assigned
Promote the organizations vision, mission, and values at all levels
Other job-related duties as assigned
Background Qualifications
Required:
High school diploma required. College degree preferred.
Minimum of one year of experience working with youth, experience working with American Indians/Alaska Natives (AI/AN) youth preferred.
Experience working with tribes and/or tribal organizations and the desire to promote the delivery of appropriate health services to the AI/AN population preferred.
Interest in substance use research and/or prevention preferred.
Valid Washington State driver’s license, proof of car insurance, and use of a personal vehicle.
Candidates must complete an acceptable Background Check as part of the hiring process.
Ability to assess situations and make clear decisions which are timely and in the best interests of the organization.
Adept at working independently or in a team environment, whichever is considered appropriate for the situation.
Demonstrate strong communication and networking skills, including public speaking, writing, group facilitation, and communicating cross-culturally with diverse partners, and interacting with people of all ages and cultural backgrounds.
Demonstrate cooperative behavior with supervisors, colleagues, clients/patients, and the community in all situations.
Knowledge of computer applications necessary to fulfill job duties.
Work well under pressure, meet multiple and often competing deadlines.
Ability to work varied hours, including evenings and weekends as required.
Work Environment:
This position is required to be full-time in the office. Office hours are 8-5, Monday through Friday with varied hours, including 1-2 evenings and/or weekends per week as required for events.

JobTitle: SVP of Platform Engineering - AI + ML & venture capital back...

The expectation is over the next 18 months you will grow a team of 25 engineers to 75 - 100. Core platforms you will lead are mobile, b2c, b2b, data and cloud. Lots of true AI + ML no code. This is a series b funded company that has been in business for 4 years, in 2020 business grew and was profitable. The platforms you lead will be used on a global scale with lots of international consumers and b2b fintech clients. Candidates who have true product engineering experience combined with leading + building high growth engineering teams are the best fit. At Compass, we envision a world where the experience of selling or buying a home is simple and pleasant for everyone. Founded in 2012, Compass provides an end-to-end platform that empowers residential real estate agents to deliver exceptional service to their seller and buyer clients, all in service of our mission to help everyone find their place in the world.
At Compass, we envision a world where the experience of selling or buying a home is simple and pleasant for everyone. Founded in 2012, Compass provides an end-to-end platform that empowers residential real estate agents to deliver exceptional service to their seller and buyer clients, all in service of our mission to help everyone find their place in the world.

About the role

Compass is looking for backend software engineers to help us build the future of real estate. We are building an end-to-end real estate technology platform that empowers agents and consumers. The AI team is responsible for building intelligent tools which help agents grow their business. We develop features which help agents prioritize their efforts and operate in an efficient manner. We are looking for someone with a proven track record of delivering critical backend components and building out customer facing features.

At Compass You Will:

Deploy machine learning models into production, and support these models throughout their lifecycle.
Collaborate closely with our machine learning scientists to move models from experimentation phase to production.
Build out customer facing features that help agents make decisions and grow their business.
Work with product managers to discern customer needs and translate these needs into an end product.

What We Look For:

5+ years experience is preferred.
Ability to collaborate with scientists, product management and work with an engineering-focused, iterative team to build and establish product requirements.
Strong skills in coding and algorithms.
Comfortable building prototypes from scratch.
Experience working with a microservice based architecture.
Experience with AWS development.
BA/BS or MS in Computer Science/Machine Learning or equivalent and 5+ years experience is preferred.
Do your best work, be your authentic self.

At Compass, we believe that everyone deserves to find their place in the world — a place where they feel like they belong, where they can be their authentic selves, where they can thrive. Our collaborative, energetic culture is grounded in our Compass Entrepreneurship Principles and our commitment to diversity, equity, inclusion, growth and mobility. As an equal opportunity employer, we offer competitive compensation packages, robust benefits and professional growth opportunities aimed at helping to improve our employees' lives and careers.

Notice for California Applicants

Young Investigator, AllenNLP

Who You Are:

AI2's AllenNLP team seeks a creative, postdoctoral Young Investigator who has a strong interest in natural language processing.

The AllenNLP team collaborates frequently with researchers on AI2's other teams focused on commonsense reasoning and the Semantic Scholar engine, among others. Our main office has unique access to researchers at the University of Washington, only 1.5 miles away. Researchers excited about such internal and external collaborations are encouraged to apply.

At AI2, you will be working with world-class AI researchers and talented software engineers. We perform team-based, ambitious research, with a mandate to strive for big breakthroughs, not just incremental progress, in an exciting and interactive workplace.

The Young Investigator position:

Duration: 1-3 years
Start date: Flexible
Candidates: Are within one year of completing their PhD, or already have a PhD
The Allen AI Young Investigator is a postdoctoral program offering unique benefits. The program will enable you to balance working collaboratively on an AI2 project while pursuing an independent research agenda.

Your Next Challenge:

Dedicated AI2 mentor: Mentorship in research, grant writing, and more
50% collaborative work on an AI2 project
50% work on your own projects

What You'll Need:

You are within one year of completing their PhD, or already have a PhD.

The Allen AI Young Investigator is a postdoctoral program offering unique benefits. The program will enable you to balance working collaboratively on an AI2 project while pursuing an independent research agenda.

Who We Are:

The Allen Institute for Artificial Intelligence is a non-profit research institute in Seattle founded by Paul Allen and headed by Professor Oren Etzioni. The core mission of AI2 is to contribute to humanity through high-impact research in artificial intelligence.

In addition to AI2's core mission, we also aim to contribute to humanity through our treatment of each member of the AI2 Team. Some highlights are:

We are a learning organization – because everything AI2 does is ground-breaking, we are learning every day. Similarly, through weekly AI2 Academy lectures, a wide variety of world-class AI experts as guest speakers, and our commitment to your personal on-going education, AI2 is place where you will have opportunities to continue learning alongside your coworkers.

We emphasize a healthy work/life balance – we believe our team members are happiest and most productive when their work/life balance is optimized. While we value powerful research results which drive our mission forward, we also value dinner with family, weekend time, and vacation time. We offer generous paid vacation and sick leave as well as family leave.
We are collaborative and transparent – we consider ourselves a team, all moving with a common purpose. We are quick to cheer our successes, and even quicker to share and jointly problem solve our failures.
We are in Seattle – and our office is on the water! We have mountains, we have lakes, we have four seasons, we bike to work, we have a vibrant theater scene, and we have so much else. We even have kayaks for you to paddle right outside our front door. We welcome interest from applicants from outside of the United States.
We are friendly– chances are you will like every one of the 100+ (and growing) people who work here. We do.

Position Summary: The Call Center Representative’s (CCR) main responsibility is to exhibit exemplary internal and external customer service. They will efficiently, professionally, and accurately respond to callers. They must possess strong communication, both electronic and verbal skill. CCR’s will work with various departments to ensure effective operational flow.
While guiding patients through the systems of care and remove any barriers one may experience in accessing the care and services they need. The CCR’s will provide a warm and welcoming experience.

Organizational Responsibilities
Hold Indigenous values and practices with respect and integrity

Recognize that communication is central to the organization’s success and actively champion your words and actions to maintain respect for others, encourage constructive feedback, be open to share laughter and acknowledge differences in skills and opinions, all while keeping others’ best intentions in mind.

Job Responsibilities, Qualifications and Education
Job Responsibilities:
Self-motivated; exhibit exemplary internal and external customer service, in a friendly, enthusiastic, and outgoing manner.

JobTitle: Chief Technology Officer & Chief Architect Perioperative Sol...
Content_text:
Why this opportunity is unique:
This is one of the very unique and rare opportunities in your career where you can flex your entrepreneurial spirit and work in a startup environment but….with the full support & backing of a formidable Fortune 1000 company.

You’ll be a critical leader in the Perioperative Solutions Group which was setup a few months ago with the aim of radically changing how new innovations are brought to market in the perioperative space. The group operates in a new agile lean incubator model to accelerate innovation, experiment with new business models, build new organizational capabilities and develop growth options at a rapid pace.

We’re building an exciting business at a very fast pace and are rapidly establishing ourselves as a formidable market player and we need the very best to join us…..

The role:
You will create, design, and develop next-generation workflow optimization tools, analytics products, and oversee the integration of acquired assets into the technology stack of existing operating companies. Across a landscape of constantly evolving advances in HCIT, this product will be powered by a blend of big data and AI to deliver the highest impact in improving workflow, quality, productivity, experience, and revenue of the operating room. This leader will:

Lead development, engineering, data management, operations, infrastructure, and security, with a focus on delivering high quality products and services to the market.
Be a thought partner to the General Manager in redefining what’s possible in the hospital space in terms of innovation, technology, quality, and speed to market.
Develop a prioritized multi-year roadmap to create new solutions and drive measurable competitive advantage in the market. Determine the investments necessary in terms of people and technology.
Communicate with substance, confidence, and conviction the technology vision/strategy to all stakeholders including clients, customers, regulatory agencies, team members, and the Board of Directors.
Continually survey the technology landscape and incorporate new technologies into the existing strategy and platforms, including mobile, cloud, digital, predictive analytic frameworks, and security.
Review and continuously improve the organizational structure, the framework/governance for prioritization and the communication lines for the business.
Ensure that all systems and technology are in full compliance with all regulatory agencies.
Drive major projects to completion within budgeted time frames and cost models while working to measure and deliver on expected ROI including ownership of QA / Test methodology and responsibility for Development, Quality and Deployment.

The person:
You are an accomplished technology strategist with notable experience across multiple healthcare technology companies. This includes an understanding of the regulatory requirements of the Healthcare industry. You will have a steep career trajectory, meaningful breadth of experience and the potential for further career growth. You have deep experience across cloud-based software, machine learning, AI, and big data in a variety of entrepreneurial and intrapreneurial environments. You are incredibly detail-oriented and hands-on, but also able to set an inspiring vision for the organization.

Professional Background & Attributes:
You have 10+ years of progressive technology leadership in a dynamic organization. You have a proven track record of building, acquiring, and integrating technology solutions.

You have a proven ability to create breakthrough strategy that defines the clear long-term competitive advantages and core strengths of the institution.

You are proficient at aligning the structure, processes, and offerings of the organization with a clear strategic plan, incorporating multiple businesses and future revenue streams.

You possess the leadership and technology experience along with a hands-on, ‘get it done’ mentality that is a hallmark of other successful leaders at Fortive.

You are an exceptional people leader committed to recruiting and retaining the best talent. You have a true dedication to investing in your team and developing future leaders that may serve AHS and Fortive in different capacities.

Our Values

We build extraordinary teams for extraordinary results

We believe in growth and invest in our people to make it happen. We are always leaning into the next challenge, imagining the next breakthrough, and designing the next innovation.

Customer success inspires our innovation

Our story is intertwined with our customers’. Their goals are our inspiration. Our innovations are their path to success. Together, we make each other better.

Kaizen is our way of life

Kaizen, or continuous improvement, means we can always do better. It’s the reason we never settle. This commitment to better is the key to our growth and deeply ingrained in our culture: learning from our successes and failures, growing as individuals and teams, and always looking for ways to improve.

We compete for shareholders

Competing for shareholders keeps us on task, always looking for the most efficient ways to improve our companies’ performance. The better we serve our customers, the more value we create, to fuel innovation across our businesses. This helps us keep loyal shareholders and employees, for the long haul.

Why Fortive is a great place to work:
It all starts with the people and the culture. You will enjoy working with colleagues who have a genuine desire to help you solve challenges. This keeps us wired. Our culture is one of continuous improvement. We come into work every day striving to make the organization a little better than it was the day before. We ask the tough questions and push each other to be bold. This occurs in an environment that fosters authenticity and transparency. There are no games. No hidden agenda. No politics. What you see one day is what you will get any other day.

About the Advanced Healthcare Solutions Segment:
In April 2019, Fortive completed the acquisition of Advanced Sterilization Products (ASP) from Johnson & Johnson for $2.7B. This seminal transaction strengthened our commitment to the healthcare sector, with a focus on providing solutions to enhance the safe operation of hospitals and healthcare facilities worldwide. In October 2019, Fortive subsequently completed the acquisition of Censis Technologies from Riverside Capital to enhance its offering to hospitals and ambulatory surgery centers worldwide and begin its journey in the SAAS (Software as a Service) space. The ASP & Censis acquisitions were a game-changer for Fortive in that the healthcare businesses became a growing share of overall revenue and the sector became fundamental to the go-forward strategy. Fortive is in the enviable position of creating and investing in a new healthcare platform that will complement our other two operating segments.

The Advanced Healthcare Solutions segment is led by Barbara Hulit, a former Operating Company President/Danaher Group Executive and BCG Partner, and she is supported by a Vice President of Human Resources and Chief Financial Officer. The following companies comprise the $1B+ Healthcare Platform and are led by Operating Company Presidents: ASP is a leading global provider of innovative sterilization and disinfection solutions, and a pioneer of lowtemperature hydrogen peroxide sterilization technology. Censis is the leader in surgical instrument and asset management software offering a range of solutions, including Censitrac, a highly advanced, web-based software system focused on maximizing operating room throughput and regulatory compliance. Fluke Biomedical is the premier, global provider of test and measurement equipment and services to the healthcare industry serving biomedical engineers, quality-assurance technicians, medical physicists, oncologists and radiationsafety professionals. With a continuous focus on driving innovation, towards the end of 2019, the segment completed a joint Growth Acceleration initiative between ASP & Censis focused on innovating in the Perioperative arena, the project resulted in the identification of opportunities in this new market space for us to pursue and drove the creation of a new leadership role that sits on the AHS Leadership Team. A couple of months ago, Suneel Shorey was appointed as the General Manager of Perioperative Solutions.

Fortive Corporation and all Fortive Companies are equal opportunity employers that evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, ancestry, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions), age, marital status, disability, veteran status, citizenship status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, and other characteristics protected by law. Individuals who need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process should call +91-XXXXXXXXXX or e-mail applyassistance@fortive.com to request accommodation."

JobTitle: Principal Customer Delivery Architect, AI/ML Strategist
Content_text:
Bachelor’s degree in a highly quantitative field (Computer Science, Machine Learning, Operational Research, Statistics, Mathematics, etc.) or equivalent professional or military experience
10+ years of industry experience working with external or internal customers in selling and AI/ML programs, projects, or related work
Experience participating in the sales lifecycle (directly or indirectly)
Experience in management consulting or related work
Experience in leading executive briefings and customer workshops focused on AI / ML strategy, use case and roadmap development

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is looking for experienced and motivated business-oriented technologists who possess a unique balance of business knowledge, AI/ML depth and effective interpersonal skills. This role will focus on supporting customers looking to use AI/ML to enhance their business or operational outcomes.
The AI/ML Customer Delivery Architect (CDA) Strategist is a growth role within the Professional Services Intelligence practice. They have the unique ability to put together cutting-edge solutions that bring together data using a combination of deep technical knowledge, sales/business acumen, and strong interpersonal skills. You will evangelize AWS AI/ML with other customers and help drive revenue growth across a broad set of industry-specific use cases. As a trusted customer advocate, the Principal ML Strategist will create best practices around AI/ML team structure, project approaches, and business measurement. The ability to connect AI/ML with business value is critical to the CDA AI/ML Strategist role.

This role is responsible for partnering with Professional Services’ sales team to dive deep into a customer’s business outcomes, to collaboratively propose solutions during sales pursuits, and pre-qualify a particular set of outcomes that would result from a formal data science (AI/ML) Professional Services engagement.

Thereafter, the AI /ML CDA Strategist remains meaningfully engaged on a part-time basis with that customer, Amazon team, and project/ program to provide oversight resulting in high-value, predictable, and successful delivery. A successful candidate will enjoy diving deep into data, doing analysis, discovering root causes, and proposing long-term solutions using AWS AI/ML and other services.

This is a hybrid role requiring exceptional sales strategy support and delivery skills. The person in this role will come with a unique data science expertise, strong interpersonal skills, experience in selling and hands-on building, coupled with cross-industry business acumen, including a heavy dose of passion for continued knowledge acquisition and growth, obsession for customers and their success using AWS to align with the desired business outcomes.

Do you have what it takes to bring yourself, your customers, and your team to the next level?

ROLE AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Own the approach (business, organizational, technical) and ultimate success around specific AI/ML projects
Discuss complex industry-specific business concepts with executives, line managers and data scientists
Engage with various AWS teams, including data & Analytics, IoT, business development, marketing, partners and regional professional services organizations during pre and post sales cycle
Drive large, complex sales opportunities to closure and through delivery
Ensure customer success in ideating and launching AI/ML on the AWS platform
Educate customers on the value proposition of AWS AI/ML and participate in deep business discussions to ensure solutions are designed to capture business value and drive the intended success metrics
Conduct workshop sessions to identify AI/ML opportunities with our customers considering or already using AWS
Capture and operationalize best-practice knowledge for enterprises that wish to drive machine learning more holistically (e.g., deploying a customer center of excellence)
Author or otherwise contribute to AWS customer-facing publications such as whitepapers
Build deep relationships with senior individuals within customers to enable them to be AI/ML advocates
Act as a business liaison between customers, services, data scientists and support
Make meaningful contributions to deep business discussions
Contribute to the creation of best practices, packaged offering, white papers, workshops, etc...

This is a customer facing role. You will be required to travel to client locations and deliver professional services when needed.

Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have thirteen employee-led affinity groups, reaching 85,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance
Our team puts a high value on work-life harmony. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here. We are a customer-obsessed organization—leaders start with the customer and work backwards. They work vigorously to earn and keep customer trust. As such, this is a customer facing role in a hybrid delivery model. Project engagements include remote delivery methods and onsite engagement that will include travel to customer locations as needed.

Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.


Master’s degree or PhD in a highly quantitative field (Computer Science, Machine Learning, Operational Research, Statistics, Mathematics, etc.)
Publications or presentations in recognized ML journals or conferences
Strong organizational skills with an ability to manage numerous demands from internal / external stakeholders and Customers
Ability to collaborate with global/enterprise account sales and delivery teams to drive adoption of AI/ML Solutions into top accounts
Experience and passion for designing and developing innovative AI/ML solutions that leverage natural language processing, computer vision, statistical learning theory.
Familiarity with AWS AI services (e.g., Amazon Personalize), ML platforms (Amazon SageMaker), and open-source frameworks (e.g., MXNet, TensorFlow, PyTorch, SparkML, scikit-learn) to help our customers build AI/ML models
Ability to communicate complex topics to an audience with various functional knowledge, i.e. presentation skills with a high degree of comfort with both large and small audiences; High level of comfort communicating effectively across internal and external organizations
Ability to think strategically about business, product, and technical problems and develop strategic, baselined, data modeling processes; ability to accurately identify cause-and-effect relationships
Experience in data exploration and analytics to discover hidden patterns and insights

Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

JobTitle: Platform Solution Engineer, MuleSoft HLS (All levels)
Content_text:
To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.
Job Category
Sales
Job Details
The MuleSoft Healthcare & Life Sciences Business Unit is looking for motivated hands-on technologists to join our very hardworking Platform Solution Engineering team to accelerate MuleSoft’s growth by building innovative, differentiated solutions that enable Digital Transformation in a market that will reach 75B over the next four years. As a MuleSoft Platform Pre-Sales Solution Engineer, you will work with our most strategic prospects and customers in a trusted advisor capacity. You will demonstrate and validate how MuleSoft’s Anypoint Platform can bring together their digital investments into an application network, which will enable faster time to change and innovation. The extended MuleSoft sales team will rely on your deep technical expertise as a Platform Engineer, product and domain knowledge throughout the sales cycle to solve comprehensive Healthcare & Life Sciences digital problems through the persuasive execution of solution design, prototyping, demonstrations, webinars and architectural workshops .


Your team will work with many multi-functional teams within MuleSoft as well as the broader Salesforce organization to help design and build innovative, integrated solutions with Health Cloud, Slack, Tableau, Service Trace and Einstein AI. You will be given all the necessary tools, training and empowerment to excel in your role to directly influence business results, while working hands-on with market leading Integration, API Management, CRM, Analytics, RPA and Collaboration software.



Responsibilities:
Be a technical solutions authority, helping customers with design and architecture of Workshops, Proofs of Concept, and custom Demos that align with the customer’s technical and business requirements.
Work across multiple customer-facing sales and partner teams and product engineering to improve the product's vision, while also ensuring that regional businesses and organizations continue to be successful.
Understand and help establish customer requirements and grow trusted client relationships throughout the product validation stage of the sales lifecycle while aligning business value to your technical design/solution.
Combine software development, Architecture, DevOps, Security and systems administration expertise with an aptitude for technical consulting, troubleshooting, and analysis to support field sales in helping customers understand the value of the MuleSoft Anypoint Platform in the Healthcare vertical.
Ensure 100% customer satisfaction across assigned set of accounts in order to secure the technical win.
Prioritize customer needs and coordinate with support, product, and engineering teams to help support customer needs to ensure customer success.
Design and build MuleSoft solutions to competitively differentiate and accelerate innovation by thinking out-of-the-box to solve problems in new, modern ways.
Bring thought leadership in the form of technology and industry knowledge to support enablement and marketing events.

These are the core skills you'll need to be successful:
5+ years software engineer and/or sales engineer experience at SAAS, Open Source, Software Consulting, or Enterprise Software company.
Solid understanding of Integration, API Management solutions, Cloud technologies, open source business models, CI/CD and Security concepts
Excellent at interpreting and designing Architectural models (Conceptual, System, Technical, Security, etc....)
Confident leading Digital Transformation projects and discussions with Healthcare & Life Sciences Product Managers, Developers, Engineers, and Executives.
Creative problem solver.
T hrive working in a high profile, fast-paced, collaborative culture.
Hands-on application development experience in Java, .Net, scripting or SOAP/REST development either in an enterprise or academic environment.
Hands-on experience with Integration, API, Microservices and Event-Driven patterns.
Excellent presentation abilities and composure in front of all levels of technical audiences.
Some experience with OAS, RAML, GraphQL, REST, AsyncAPI, Kubernetes, Docker, Microservices patterns and concepts.
Knowledge of other Integration and API lifecycle management platforms.
Excellent network administration and troubleshooting skills.

Bonus points:
MuleSoft development and architecture experience will get you top points.
MuleSoft developer and/or architect certification.
Healthcare and Life Sciences domain expertise, including Regulatory and Compliance
AWS/GCP/Azure Cloud Certifications
Experience with K8 / Docker.
Fluent working on Linux OS.
Familiarity with CI/CD pipeline.
Experience with cloud container solutions and distributed computing technology such as EKS, AKS and GKE
Experience with Cloud technology solutions and/or running and supporting large complex systems at scale.
Understanding of Unix/Linux or Windows systems from kernel to shell and beyond, including system libraries, file systems, and client-server protocols.
What you’ll achieve:


3 Months
Become certified in MuleSoft’s Developer, API design trainings
Complete MuleSoft’s Kickstart sales training
Begin to build your architecture reframe and whiteboarding skills through shadowing and customer-scenario role playing
Complete a simulated project, based on a real use case, that allows you to apply and showcase the MuleSoft skills you have learned in your first 3 months.
12 Months
Become certified in all Product, Architecture, and Sales Messaging trainings, provided by MuleSoft
Successfully deliver your Self Service asset by end of the second quarter
Support marketing with evangelism activities (writing blogs, participating in webinars, speaking at industry events, etc.)
Develop Proofs of Concept (PoCs) and Custom Demos as part of an account team to demonstrate the art of the possible
Participate in the continuous improvement of MuleSoft products by making technical contributions and by providing feedback from the field to Product Marketing and Engineering.
Effectively contribute to MuleSoft’s growth by supporting the technical sales efforts in our most strategic Healthcare & Life Sciences accounts

About MuleSoft:


A Salesforce company Our mission is to help organizations change and innovate faster by making it easy to connect the world’s applications, data, and devices. Companies like Spotify, McDonald’s, and Unilever rely on MuleSoft to stay agile, deliver faster, and make the most of their IT investment with API-led connectivity. Hiring exceptional people who want to build a great company together is our number one priority, and we’re committed to providing an equal opportunity workplace where everyone is supported and inspired to do their best work. We work tirelessly to build this culture, and we’re proud to have been named the #1 Top Workplace in the Bay Area and the best place to work 6 years in a row.

JobTitle: Senior Director, Engagement Services Leader - Tableau
Content_text:
To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.
Job Category
Customer Success Group
Job Details
What you’ll be doing…
This is a new and exciting role within the Tableau Global Services Delivery Organization. This individual will lead a growing team of Engagement Managers as well as Sales Delivery resources that support specific strategic sales pursuits.
The Senior Director, Engagement Services Leader will be required to forge close and positive relationships across the global selling teams, while accurately aligning Engagement Managers to support specific sales engagements. This leader will ensure our Engagement Managers are helping to support the sales cycle by engaging with the customers and sales teams, translating customer comments and requirements into specific business outcomes, crafting and educating the customer on the art of the possible, prioritisation the services needed to successfully deliver the engagements, and ensuring our delivery teams complete the vision defined throughout the sales process.
In addition to leading the Engagement Managers, this resource will also be responsible for leading a team passionate about sales support. These resources will focus on engagements identified by the sales team, where they see significant upside potential for the customer/prospect to expand their value and footprint of Tableau. These customers need to see Tableau working for them, with their data, before making their buying decision. Engagements can range from days to weeks in duration. The Senior Director, Engagement Services Leader, will need to act as the gatekeeper of requests, lead the resources, prioritize and identify risks to the sales team, and act at the single point of contact for this group.
As part of the Service Delivery Leadership team, this individual will also work with other Service Directors and Service Products teams to help identify and build a series of repeatable outcome-based offerings that can be used to help our Sales teams better position and drive outcomes-based offerings.
This position requires a senior individual with a strong blend of relationship building skills, sales skills, team management skills, a forward looking vision, experience driving business outcomes based analytics solutions, digital transformation experience, business, enterprise architecture and consultative skills. It is an expectation of the role that this individual will be able to build and maintain senior executive relationships both internally and with customers.
Some of the things you’ll be doing include …
In collaboration with the sales account teams, you will be required to support account and opportunity planning, and resource management activities.
Drive strong Prioritization and Communication skills to ensure teams are assigned where they are most needed, and expectations and constraints are properly communicated to requesting teams.
Build an outcome based business culture within the team, and conceptualise to look for common outcome based use cases that can be repeatable in other areas.
Push the status quo boundaries of team size and skills needed for full successful delivery, opening up the art of the possible.
Knowledge and ability to articulate key concepts in digital transformation, customer experience and cloud adoption.
Understand the customer’s business strategy and technology needs; identifying the key capabilities and technology enablers required to support these.
Be accountable for the development of business case documents, visioning proposals, enterprise architecture artefacts, delivery roadmaps and executive presentations.
Work within a matrix-style organization, working across multiple teams and partners.
Mentor and guide sales and presales resources on strategic opportunities.
Participation in the delivery of solution standard methodologies, reference architectures, educational sessions and industry summits to existing customers, partners and to internal audiences. Serve as a Trusted Advisor to our customer’s technology and business leaders, demonstrating the collective intelligence of our Architect Community and Data Culture dreamers to accelerate business value and reduce risk.
Assist the team to drive, through governance and attention to critical architecture decisions, adherence to standards and best practices in domains such as: Security, Performance, Integration, Analytics, Mobile, Release Management and Development Lifecycle.
Advocate and be the voice of an outstanding data and analytics culture.
Grow the Engagement Manager practice globally by chipping in to internal central initiatives.
Who you are…
Enterprise Experienced. Experience in enterprise architecture principles and tools. Multi-year experience in either a software vendor or enterprise architecture fields.
Team Mentor . Be a mentor and growth engine for helping a newer team grow optimally across the globe to help drive new business.
Strategic & Value Based Salesperson. Proven experience in crafting, selling or implementing technology-based solutions. Ability to communicate the business value of technology decisions along with the business value they deliver.
Tech Obsessed . Good understanding of the architectural principles of cloud based platforms including SaaS, PaaS, multi-tenant, multi-tiered infrastructure.
Industry Alignment. Experience with Analytics Tools, AI solutions, and Tableau.
Digital Transformation Leader. Key experience in Digital Transformation and Business Architecture.
You are a Recruiter! Tableau hires company builders and, in this role, you will be asked to be on the constant lookout for the best talent to bring onboard to help us continue to build one of the best companies in the world.
For Colorado-based roles: Minimum annual salary of $164,100 . You may also be offered incentive compensation, bonus, restricted stock units, and benefits. More details about our company benefits can be found at the following link: https://www.getsalesforcebenefits.com/
