We've been successful in this unique business for over 30 years and we continue to advance our technology and business processes to remain years ahead of what our competition is able to offer.Location: This position is open to candidates currently living in the Seattle area. We are not accepting applications from remote or relocating candidates at this time.Job Overview: The Data Analyst role provides data analytics to ABC Legal Services leadership and employees. Analytics duties include data extraction from our Postgres database, providing reports on data extractions, analyzing data to create insights, creating Metabase visualizations and reports as needed, and identifying issues/problems/opportunities with data collection and storage. The role may ultimately offer opportunities to practice advanced skills such as predictive analytics/ML, database administration, and software development.Salary Range: $55K-70K depending on experience**No remote options**Key Responsibilities: Generate Metabase reports and charts using GUI query builder and native SQLQuery our database directly as needed to address specific company and employee needsAcquire increasing familiarity with the structure and content of our large (400 table) production databaseProactively test the validity and cleanliness of data, and suggest appropriate fixesQualifications: Bachelors Degree and minimum 1 year of relevant experience required1 years or more experience working with MySQL or another RDBMS in a professional or academic capacityAbility to interface with clients to provide excellent Customer Service and explain technical/statistical concepts to non-technical peopleAbility to understand and apply basic statistics concepts, such as probability distributions and hypothesis testsCompetitive candidates may additionally possess one or more of the below: Advanced statistics skillsExperience with predictive models/ML/AIAdvanced data visualization proficiency in a library like ggplot or seaborn, or BI software such as TableauExperience with the AWS ecosystem of products and solutionsBenefits/Perks: At ABC Legal, we have a small tech department with a culture that makes it easy to learn new skills, take on new roles, and have your voice heard by upper managementComprehensive Medical, Dental, and Vision coverage401(k) retirement plan with 5% matchingPTO and 10 paid holidays per yearJob Type: Full-timePay: $55,000.00 - $70,000.00 per year

The Cloud & AI Corporate Strategy team is chartered with defining the strategy and growth for Microsoft’s Cloud & AI business. The team has built a track record of spotting trends early and using those insights to drive Microsoft’s strategy and direction.
The group broadly focuses on three sets of activities:
Corp Strategy and Thought leadership: Thought leadership on the major shifts in the technology industry such as Digital Transformation (e.g., this was the team that originally pushed for Microsoft’s strategy shift towards the cloud- https://news.microsoft.com/download/archived/presskits/cloud/docs/The-Economics-of-the-Cloud.pdf)
Product Strategy: Translating strategy into product reality across Azure, Business SaaS, Artificial Intelligence, IoT, Mixed Reality, Developer, big bet M&A (e.g., the team drove the GitHub, 5H and Nuance acquisitions).
Customer Strategy: Directly engaging with C-suite of top Microsoft customers to help them formulate their Digital Transformation strategy
You will play a key role in both the continuing transforming of one of the world’s largest software companies as well as transforming whole industries as we help customers charter their Digital Transformation journey. You will be a leader in the team and directly engage with the most senior leaders of the company.
Lead multiple concurrent projects for top leaders of the company across thought leadership, product strategy, and customer strategy
Build a deep network of senior relationships inside the company
Lead, coach, and hire team members of the strategy team
Work with experts and stakeholders across the organization (e.g., Product Teams, Sales, Finance, Corp Dev, Marketing, Biz Dev) as well as externally (e.g., Industry Analysts, Partners, Customers)
Build consensus and effectively influence senior-level stakeholders
Strong executive presence and ability to influence the most senior leaders at the company
Passion for technology/technology experience
A ‘question the status quo’ and entrepreneurial mindset
Desire to continuously learn and develop new skills
Responsibilities
People Management
Managers deliver success through empowerment and accountability by modeling, coaching, and caring.
Model - Live our culture; Embody our values; Practice our leadership principles.
Coach - Define team objectives and outcomes; Enable success across boundaries; Help the team adapt and learn.
Care - Attract and retain great people; Know each individual’s capabilities and aspirations; Invest in the growth of others.
Business Partner Relationships
Manages key points of contact with internal teams (e.g., Finance, Marketing, Engineering); manages and cultivates relationships with senior internal leaders (e.g., GM-level, CVP, EVP, CEO). Acts as an advisor to senior leadership as a domain expert within Microsoft , leveraging deep technical/product and business knowledge, market awareness, and subject matter expertise to inform strategic business decisions.
Project Leadership
Manages multiple Strategy projects and teams across organizational boundaries as a project lead through goals, deliverables, feedback, resource balancing, and timing expectations; proactively identifies complex roadblocks and address them.
Team Development
Drives a positive, cohesive team culture across project and Strategy team; develops junior team members and peers. Mentors junior colleagues by providing coaching and apprenticeship; solicits feedback from internal partners and provides feedback to team members. Owns recruiting and onboarding efforts for Strategy team members by conducting interviews, making decisions on candidates, overseeing onboarding, supporting team member career transitions.
Qualifications
Required/Minimum Qualifications
Bachelor's Degree in Business, Finance, Economics, Liberal Arts, Computer Science, or related field AND 8+ years marketing, strategy, business planning, consulting, banking, finance, economics, and/or partner organization experience
OR Master's Degree in Business Administration or related field AND 6+ years marketing, strategy, business planning, consulting, banking, finance, economics, and/or partner organization experience
OR equivalent experience (e.g., scaling a business, incubation, driving change in a large company, entrepreneurship, management consulting).
2+ years experience in Strategy, Management Consulting, and/or Finance.
2+ years people management experience.
Additional or Preferred Qualifications
Bachelor's Degree in Business, Finance, Economics, Liberal Arts, Computer Science, or related field AND 15+ years marketing, strategy, business planning, consulting, banking, finance, economics, and/or partner organization experience
OR Master’s Degree in Business Administration or related field AND 12+ years marketing, strategy, business planning, consulting, banking, finance, economics, and/or partner organization experience
OR equivalent experience (e.g., scaling a business, incubation, driving change in a large company, entrepreneurship).
6+ years experience in Strategy, Management Consulting, and/or Finance.
5+ years people management experience.
Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.
Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

JobTitle: newAI/ML - ML Engineering Manager - Personal and Private Learni...
Content_text:
Summary
Posted: Dec 3, 2021
Weekly Hours: 40
Role Number:200310406
Siri is deployed to hundreds of millions of devices worldwide helping our users with their daily tasks, just by asking. The mission of Private learning team within Siri Understanding group is to take Siri to the next level of intelligence while preserving privacy of our users. We believe every interaction with Siri is an opportunity to learn, we also believe Privacy is fundamental and universal human right. We are looking for an experienced ML Manager to help us make Siri more intelligent and personal by learning from users without compromising their privacy.
Key Qualifications
At least 6 years of relevant industry experience; including multiple years leading technical teams and helping team members grow in their careers
Demonstrated ability to build efficient teams and drive innovation in a fast-paced environment
Ability to lead technical design discussions from concept to implementation
Knowledge in machine learning and/or data science and the ability to effectively connect with partner teams
Proven track record of successfully running product releases
Excellent multi-functional interpersonal skills
Description
Description
As an ML manager you will build the technical vision, roadmap for the product and lead collaborative efforts with data science and ML partners across Siri. You are a strong problem solver and excellent at dealing with ambiguities while leading a group of smart ML engineers who are on the bleeding edge of AI innovation. You possess excellent communication skills and you enjoy bringing people together to deliver delightful experiences to users.
Education & Experience
M.S degree or PhD in Computer Science or equivalent experience
Additional Requirements

Basic Qualifications

Strong communication skills and ability to influence
5+ years of Industry or Enterprise Technology experience driving large initiatives, preferably working in a partner, pre-sales solution engineering, solution architecture or business development role
Previous roles showing understanding of cloud and distributed computing concepts
Professional experience with AI/ML required

JOB DESCRIPTION
Are you comfortable making decisions that analyze market data, product features and business terms to develop recommendations that represent a win-win for all parties? Can you take complex scenarios and simplify them down to the essentials, crafting an elegant approach that drives customer adoption and revenue growth?

As an AI/ML Specialist Solutions Architect (SA) focused on Cloud Intelligence within Amazon Web Services (AWS), you will have the exciting opportunity to help shape and deliver on a strategy for using intelligence and insights to programmatically scale AWS’s cloud computing business. Your responsibilities will include working directly with customers and partners and supporting the AWS Sales, Marketing, BD, and product teams to help win competitive sales engagements. You will serve as an expert resource on knowledge of cloud, IT applications and infrastructures, working with our field teams to understand the benefits of migrating to AWS. When necessary, you will bring in other AWS resources to help our customers properly evaluate their options. This Specialist SA will be responsible for creating original content, handling technical and business escalations from the global sales team, and relaying insights back to the product team.

The ideal candidate will possess a business and technical background that enables them to drive engagements and communicate the benefits of AWS to IT architects, engineering teams and C-Level executives. You should have demonstrated ability to think strategically and long-term about the complex business and technical needs of customers. You should also have detailed knowledge and a strong technical understanding of cloud concepts, vendors in general, and AWS specifically.

The ideal candidate will provide insight on blockers, and innovation opportunities unique to this industry segment’s cloud adoption, to support a business and tech analysis.

Roles & Responsibilities:

Serve as a key member of the Cloud Intelligence team in helping to drive AWS engagements with our customers and partners.
Able to handle questions or concerns about AWS value proposition, as compared to our competitors
Manage deal review updates and interview pipeline end-to-end
Produce insights based on customer feedback
Research and analyze competitors
Work with AWS Sales, BD, Product, and Marketing teams, drive proactive competitive intelligence conversations and positive engagements with our customers
Understand the business and technical requirements of our customers and partners and determine how their needs can best be met by AWS.
Provide training to internal stakeholders
Be a go-to sales resource and sales liaison between cloud intelligence and the field.
Handle a high volume of engagements and the fast pace of the cloud computing market

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

Strong communication skills and ability to influence
5+ years of Industry or Enterprise Technology experience driving large initiatives, preferably working in a partner, pre-sales solution engineering, solution architecture or business development role
Previous roles showing understanding of cloud and distributed computing concepts
Professional experience with AI/ML required

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

Inquisitive mindset and ability to ask questions that uncover insights
Experience in market research, business intelligence, consulting, or competitive intelligence
Demonstrable analytical skills, ability to thrive in a detail-oriented environment
Effective communication skills with both technical and non-technical individuals
Proven ability to engage and influence executives and roadmaps
Technical Certification on AWS and/or other public cloud platforms; AI certification a plus

Preferred Qualifications:

Inquisitive mindset and ability to ask questions that uncover insights
Experience in market research, business intelligence, consulting, or competitive intelligence
Demonstrable analytical skills, ability to thrive in a detail-oriented environment
Effective communication skills with both technical and non-technical individuals
Proven ability to engage and influence executives and roadmaps
Technical Certification on AWS and/or other public cloud platforms; AI certification a plus

RedCloud is seeking a Business Manager (AI) to support immediate client operations. RedCloud Consulting is a business and IT consulting company with local Puget Sound Enterprise and Mid-sized clients. We have been recognized by Seattle Business Magazine and ranked #1 on their “Best Companies to Work for in Washington” for Mid-Sized Businesses list, awarded #1 Fastest Growing Company in Washington by Puget Sound Business Journal, and named on the Inc. 500/5000 list.

Responsibilities include but are not limited to:
Experience applying subject matter and consultative expertise to deliver high-value operational execution to our client’s most pressing or complex client businesses.
Ability to develop a strong working relationship with the client and confirm his/her expectations, including in-scope deliverables, format, status reporting content and cadence, feedback, and transition plans.
Works in a trusted advisor capacity for the client, providing thought leadership beyond expectations and developing a roadmap for long-term strategy (if applicable).
Proven ability to conduct a landscape assessment of key project stakeholders to determine relevant stakeholder knowledge, gaps/challenges, and other risks/obstacles to success. Further, develop execution, risk mitigation, and transition plans, to create a repeatable framework for quality project execution.
Must be able to focus on constant operational process improvement across all stakeholders and business functions, always thinking several steps ahead of the team.
Exceptional ability to implement and evangelize use of project management best practices (e.g., project plans, weekly status reports and meetings, prioritized issues resolution log, risk log including mitigation measures, transition plans).
Ability to develop and present prioritized findings from project gap analysis (e.g., when aligning business requirements against proposed internal or commercial technology solutions).
Lead stakeholder meetings and provide follow-up minutes (as appropriate), leveraging best practices.

Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:
Ability to develop a strong working relationship with the client and confirm their expectations, including in-scope deliverables, format, status reporting content and cadence, and feedback.
Familiarity with and ability to leverage appropriate Project Management tools and resources.
Determine and engage relevant stakeholders, available resources, assess gaps and challenges, and identify project risks and obstacles as well as viable solutions.
Exceptional ability to implement and evangelize use of project management structures (e.g., project plans, weekly status reports and meetings, prioritization, etc.)
Desire and ability to learn quickly and work in a fast-paced environment.
Able to work effectively both independently and within a team environment.
Detail-oriented, process-oriented, results-driven
Solid facilitation skills at multiple management levels
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills
Cross-functional group coordination and collaboration
Ability to thrive in ambiguous or rapidly changing environments.

About Us:
RedCloud is a boutique, business and technology consulting firm providing local companies with expert-level support for over two decades. Whether it’s to solve a specific business challenge or to provide additional support for an ambitious project, we can help bring even the most visionary endeavors to fruition.

Anchored by a foundation of "integrity-based consulting", the RedCloud team of subject matter experts collaborate closely with clients to develop and implement high-level solutions, bringing stability, growth, and innovation together for long-term success. We provide a broad array of business and technology consulting services through RedCloud’s core services: Empower Operations, Empower Sales and Marketing, Empower Customers, Empower Security and Privacy.
Visit http://www.redcloudconsulting.com/ for more info.

At Shelf Engine, our mission is to reduce food waste through automation. We harness the power of AI to provide real-time, intelligent forecasting and fully automated ordering to food retailers across the United States. We're able to drastically reduce the amount of food waste generated while simultaneously maximizing sales and expanding margins for grocers—a triple win for suppliers and retailers, consumers, and the environment.
Shelf Engine is searching for a talented Controller to join our growing team and report directly to our Head of Finance. This position is key in building an efficient, robust, and world class finance function within a rapidly growing company. The goal is to help Shelf Engine scale its Accounting team as we continue to grow. You'll accomplish this by being a self-starter, motivated to find optimal ways of doing things and establishing new processes that scale. You will be responsible for managing and performing the day-to-day accounting operations including AR/AP, General Ledger, Treasury, Payroll, Tax, and Consolidation, as well as managing financial audits and special projects. You are equally excited about learning and mentoring a great team to provide amazing results. There will be plenty of opportunities to grow your career in this role. If you have a passion for solving complex financial problems, this may be your dream job.

This position is based in Seattle, WA

As a Controller, you will:

Manage all accounting processes for the Company
Lead a team of professional accountants, including managing deliverables, mentoring, and coaching in a productive, team-focused environment
Manage the preparation of monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statements
Implement, document, and maintain adequate and effective processes to improve the close and reporting cycles to ensure timely and accurate reporting
Develop, implement, and ensure compliance with internal financial and GAAP accounting policies and procedures
Assist the Head of Finance with financial reporting to external investors and stakeholders, as well as with various ad-hoc financial projects and requests
Act as the primary liaison with our external auditors and manage that relationship to maintain compliance and ensure due diligence readiness
Implement, document and maintain adequate and effective internal controls
Maintain relationships with bankers, attorneys, insurance providers, and service providers and manage the contracts and related instruments (financing, asset management, capital, and stock options) for compliance and notification.
Own the tax function, assisting in the preparation of quarterly tax returns, annual audits, and annual tax return preparations
Monitor debt levels and compliance with debt covenants, optimize working capital, and prepare cash flow forecasts
Ensure compliance with all other applicable laws, rules, and regulations
Embrace our company principles through inclusive, authentically-kind, and empathetic interactions with our team and our customers

We think you would make a great Controller if you have:

8-10+ years' work experience including a mix of private and public company experience, including 2+ years managing a team
Public accounting firm experience with a Big 4 accounting firm working with a mix of private and public company clients is strongly preferred
Experience in the technology sector preferred, but not required
Bachelor's or Master's degree in accounting required
Professional certification required (CPA or CMA)
Strong knowledge of technical GAAP requirements
A solid understanding of internal control design and operational efficiency
Strong organizational, process management, and communication skills and high attention to detail
Advanced time-management skills to handle multiple deliverables simultaneously in a fast-paced, high-growth, and rapidly changing environment
Experience managing a cap table preferred, but not required

What Shelf Engine offers you:

A unique opportunity to join a fast-growing sustainability startup early on, making a meaningful impact on the team as well as the environment
An inclusive work environment that emphasizes each team member's personal and professional growth
Competitive salary in the range of $175,000-$200,000 based on skills and experience
Pre-IPO equity with a four-year vesting schedule
PTO that is unlimited and self-managed for full time employees
100% employer-paid premiums for medical, dental, and vision insurance for employees, and 50% covered for eligible dependents
Coverage for life insurance, short- and long-term disability, and access to a robust Employee Assistance Program
Optional employee contribution of pre-tax dollars to medical and dependent care FSA accounts
401k plan through Guideline to contribute to your financial future
Seattle only: Company-paid ORCA transit card

About Us:

At Shelf Engine, you will join a team of driven, passionate, and caring people hungry to make change in an untapped industry. We're not only solving complex technical problems at scale but also tackling key initiatives with significant environmental impacts. Our team is determined to disrupt a massive industry and leave behind a positive legacy for generations to come.

Shelf Engine is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Meta Platforms, Inc. (Meta), formerly known as Facebook Inc., builds technologies that help people connect, find communities, and grow businesses. When Facebook launched in 2004, it changed the way people connect. Apps and services like Messenger, Instagram, WhatsApp, and Novi further empowered billions around the world. Now, Meta is moving beyond 2D screens toward immersive experiences like augmented and virtual reality to help build the next evolution in social technology.Instructions on how to apply, click “Apply to Job” online on this web page.


Research, design, and develop new optimization algorithms and techniques to improve the efficiency and performance of Facebook's platforms
Design and implement large-scale distributed software systems to serve large numbers of complex requests simultaneously and without failure
Utilize technical research background, train new ranking models, and run experiments
Create tools for migrating large bodies of user data across systems for new products, scalability efforts, and development of new core infrastructure
Use machine learning, statistics, or other data techniques to build algorithms
Suggest, collect, and synthesize system requirements from stakeholders and create effective feature roadmaps
Analyze and resolve computer challenges from a system engineering standpoint


Employer will accept a PhD Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Physics, or related field and 6 months of work experience in job offered or in a computer-related occupation. Experience must include 6 months of experience in each of the following:
Gathering, manipulating, or analyzing complex, high-volume, high-dimensionality data from varying sources
Communicating complex research in a clear, precise, and actionable manner
Research in topics closely related to machine learning, NLP, recommendation systems, pattern recognition, signal processing, data mining, artificial intelligence, information retrieval, or computer vision
Performing research that enables learning the semantics of data (images, video, text, audio, or other modalities) and advances the technology of intelligent machines
Devising better data-driven models of human behavior
Adapting standard machine learning methods to best enterprise modern parallel environments: distributed clusters, multicore SMP, or GPU
Developing highly scalable classifiers and tools leveraging machine learning, statistics, regression, rules-based models, or mathematical models
Java, C++, Perl, PHP, or Python.




Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.


Facebook is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.Facebook is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations-ext@fb.com.

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field,
8+ years experience building successful production software systems,
6 years management experience (including a combination of experience hiring, managing performance, and providing technical leadership),
The ability to take raw product requirements and develop software architectures and designs to bring them to life,
Experience defining system architectures and exploring technical feasibility tradeoffs,
3+ years building systems that build and leverage AI-based technologies.

Want to disrupt an industry by delighting customers? Looking for a job where your work can have direct and massive impact? Excited to join one of the newest and most exciting AWS services? Come be a leader on a team that is building a product that will touch millions of people daily.

We are just getting started building the most advanced call center system in existence!

Amazon Connect is a highly disruptive cloud-based contact center that enables businesses to deliver engaging, dynamic, and personal customer service experiences. Amazon Connect is the result of the ten years of development that went into building the tools Amazon uses to provide its award winning customer service at massive scale and launching it as a publicly available AWS service. With Amazon Connect, you can create your own cloud-based contact center and be taking calls in minutes. Amazon Connect leverages the power of Artificial Intelligence and the large ecosystem of AWS services such as Amazon Lex, Amazon Polly, AWS Lambda, Amazon S3 and Amazon Kinesis to provide a truly frustration free, easy-to-use, extensible, and natural customer experience. With this technology, we are transforming an industry and the way customers interact with businesses and how agents service them.
We have a rapidly growing customer base and an exciting charter in front of us that includes solving highly complex engineering and algorithmic problems.

Amazon Connect Team is looking for a passionate and talented Senior Manager responsible for a new, unannounced set of features. The position represents a rare opportunity to be a part of a fast-growing business soon after launch, and help shape the technology and product as we grow. You will be playing a crucial role in developing the next generation contact center, and get the opportunity to design and deliver scalable, resilient systems while maintaining a constant customer focus.

To succeed in this position, you'll establish teams that work with customers as well as tech leaders within the team and across AWS. You'll drive operational improvements across internal and external organizations, while building new systems that leverage AI in the call center environment. You'll drive a culture that values operational excellence, security, customer focus, and continuous improvement.

Learn more about Amazon Connect here:
https://aws.amazon.com/connect/

Media coverage on Amazon Connect:
https://techcrunch.com/2017/03/28/aws-amazon-connect/

Power of Amazon Connect:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9qky_E39-_I

About Us
Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance
Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.

Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.


Experience in designing and building sophisticated fault-tolerant distributed systems,
Understanding of developing software with systems-level performance constraints,
Familiarity with communications and metrics,
Experience with Java, web technologies (HTML, JavaScript, etc), multi-threaded programming, and telephony systems,
Experience in driving systemic operational improvements,
Experience building AI-based models.

Amazon is an Equal Opportunity Employer – Minority / Women / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation / Age

PhD in Economics or closely related field

Job summary
Core AI is an interdisciplinary team on the cutting edge of economics, statistical analysis, and machine learning whose mission is to solve AI and ML problems that have high risk with abnormally high returns. Our team leverages the strengths of our engineers and scientists to build solutions for some of the toughest business problems here at Amazon.

We are looking for a seasoned economist who is able to provide structure, including sourcing, defining, and leveling, around complex and varied business problems. We seek creative thinkers who can combine a strong economic toolbox with a desire to learn from others, and who know how to execute and deliver on big ideas.

This role will be to work within Core AI to help support research and development on rapid proofs of concept for high-impact projects. The economist will have access to engineering and econometric tools, as well as Amazon's Scholar Residency Program, which consists of world-class academic scientists and researchers collaborating with internal partner teams to facilitate the delivery of Scholar led science into engineering systems

Responsibilities:

Work within Core AI teams to consult with internal partner terms on collaboration opportunities and to assess potential for impact.
Own the development of economic models and manage the data analysis, modeling, and experimentation necessary to validate your model.
Effectively communicate econometric models to business teams and incorporate feedback into project analysis/modeling.
Strong research track record, drives results.
Effective verbal and written communications skills.
Exhibits high business judgment.
Dives deep, thinks big and has convictions
Experience in applied statistics, econometrics, or consulting.
Experience in applied economic analysis.
Experience in using one of Stata, R, or Python is required.

The Legal Analyst participates actively in the development and implementation of best in class Legal department operations. Responsible for identifying requirements, defining and providing metrics for the Legal department at global level, he/she will work closely with Finance and IT (where necessary) and will find innovative ways to help improve Legal processes and provide expert recommendations and insights to Legal leadership, helping drive data-based strategic decisions.

The position is Full time-based at our Washington, WA headquarters and reports directly to Pythonwise’s Executive Director, Legal Operations & Strategy.

Define relevant data points and metrics for the Legal function

Drive review of requirements for and creation of a Legal Metrics Dashboard, including for example contract metrics, litigation/outcomes metrics, Legal function scorecard, metrics related to communications and Online Reputation management

Take an active role in driving the digitization of the Legal and Risk department, leveraging technology/AI for metrics, analytics and improvement of existing processes

Benchmark department practices (eg, overall spend, spend on technology, hiring and staffing, outside counsel spend and selection, department quality of service to internal clients, etc.) against industry standards and produce dashboards and reports on the same along with any recommendations to improve efficiency and lower costs.

Work with Finance and relevant stakeholders to help better understand insurance spend; help define end to end process for increased visibility & control.

Work with lawyers to assess and select appropriate attorneys and law firms using AdvanceLaw, Persuit, or otherwise


Requirements:

J.D. or Master’s Degree or equivalent in Law

3 years + experience in a related position utilizing data analysis tools and techniques or metrics research in a corporate environment, with exposure to process improvement, operations/methods analysis.

Cultural alignment – Excellent judgment, positive personality and sense of humor, Unwavering personal and professional ethical standards; drives excellence and innately collaborative

Implement a regular review globally of firm timekeeper rates and analysis against preferred vendor list

Assist with firm rate negotiation, matter-specific budgeting, and billing disputes

Communication skills – Excellent communication skills – both written and spoken. Comfortable working with department leaders and senior management.


Desired Skills:

Digital savviness and learning agility – Extremely comfortable with technology, able to recognize and act on evolving technology trends impacting the business, quick to learn and master new tools.

Strategic and critical thinking – Ability to conceptualize and articulate practical and creative solutions to meet legal requirements and business needs; inquisitive, challenges status quo, thinks outside the box, exhibits strong levels of insight and intellectual curiosity

JobTitle: newAI/ML - ML Engineering Manager - Personal and Private Learni...
Content_text:
Summary
Posted: Dec 3, 2021
Weekly Hours: 40
Role Number:200310406
Siri is deployed to hundreds of millions of devices worldwide helping our users with their daily tasks, just by asking. The mission of Private learning team within Siri Understanding group is to take Siri to the next level of intelligence while preserving privacy of our users. We believe every interaction with Siri is an opportunity to learn, we also believe Privacy is fundamental and universal human right. We are looking for an experienced ML Manager to help us make Siri more intelligent and personal by learning from users without compromising their privacy.
Key Qualifications
At least 6 years of relevant industry experience; including multiple years leading technical teams and helping team members grow in their careers
Demonstrated ability to build efficient teams and drive innovation in a fast-paced environment
Ability to lead technical design discussions from concept to implementation
Knowledge in machine learning and/or data science and the ability to effectively connect with partner teams
Proven track record of successfully running product releases
Excellent multi-functional interpersonal skills
Description
Description
As an ML manager you will build the technical vision, roadmap for the product and lead collaborative efforts with data science and ML partners across Siri. You are a strong problem solver and excellent at dealing with ambiguities while leading a group of smart ML engineers who are on the bleeding edge of AI innovation. You possess excellent communication skills and you enjoy bringing people together to deliver delightful experiences to users.
Education & Experience
M.S degree or PhD in Computer Science or equivalent experience
Additional Requirements

Basic qualifications

Computer Science or equivalent degree with at least 15 years relevant experience. At least 10 years of experience managing software engineering teams in a ‘leader of leaders’ role.
Technically credible to lead a team of world class software engineers and leaders to deliver the right products with scalable engineering design.
A passion for people management and mentorship including hiring and developing diverse talent.
Experience working with and influencing senior level stakeholders and cross-functional partners
Demonstrated ability to manage and launch multiple high-complexity projects and multiple competing priorities in a fast-paced environment
Experience capturing requirements and working directly with engineers to develop products
Strong verbal communication and presentation skills
Excellent analytical skills, with ability to work successfully across all engineering and research disciplines
Experience building, developing and driving large scale global teams
Strong business and technical vision.
Excellent written and verbal communication is required with the ability to present the customer vision and complex technical ideas in a clear and concise manner to a variety of audiences including SVPs.

Job summary
About This Role
Time & Pay Innovation is looking for a dedicated single threaded leader (STL) to innovate on behalf of employees and solve complex product and technical challenges along the way. This leader will partner with PXT, business line leaders, and partner product and technology teams to drive time and pay solutions. A successful STL will provide strong vision and direction for the team, responsible for setting the three-year strategic direction for the invention and scaling of new time and pay experiences to serve millions of Amazon employees. This person will innovate frequently developing people, process and programs that delight customers, scale, and have high impact. They will need to drive technology solutions to serve customers and reduce manual processes.

The ideal candidate will be an innovative, seasoned technical leader with a demonstrated history leading organizations that create great customer experiences. The candidate will have a track record of delivering large-scale, customer-facing products, built on simple and elegant software architecture. The leader will have multi-disciplinary experience, and will have managed multi-team organizations while maintaining the ability to dive deep on customer experience and delivery and technical architecture. Success in this role requires close collaboration with senior business and HR leaders across Amazon and the ability to partner effectively with technical peers to set long term technical direction. Hiring and developing diverse talented leaders will be critical for this role. The leader of this organization will be driving some of Amazon’s most critical work and millions of employees will be directly impacted by their contributions. The director will have global scope, serving employees worldwide.

Key job responsibilities

The successful candidate will be able to:

Drive the development of innovative products from vision to implementation, providing expertise and thought leadership to the broader product and tech teams, and influencing colleagues and stakeholders.
Hire and develop world-class diverse talent
Manage, develop, and lead a large multi-disciplinary organization (Product Managers, Software Development Managers, Principal Engineers, etc.).
Solve large scale and highly complex problems using the latest technology and science.
Form partnerships and work closely with senior leaders/execs across Amazon.
Drive effective teamwork, communication, collaboration and commitment across multiple disparate groups with competing priorities
Effectively lead large programs, dependencies and bottlenecks, manage stakeholders, anticipate and make trade-offs, and balance the business needs versus technical constraints
Lead a global organization, leveraging metrics and anecdotes to improve the customer experience
Bring your creativity and diversity of thought to our team.

About the team
What is Time and Pay?
Time and Pay Innovation brings world class service delivery, technology and science together to improve the daily lives of Amazonians worldwide. Time and Pay innovation is building the world’s most complex and scaled human resource systems in the world to manage transactions for millions of workers, from a diverse set of businesses from drivers to AWS data techs to retail store employees. As Amazon has added two new leadership principals - Strive to be Earth’s Best Employer and Success and Scale Bring Broad Responsibility - there’s no better place in the company to bring these LP’s to life than right here in Time and Pay.

Our North Star is to build a world-class time and attendance system that’s a competitive advantage for Amazon – intuitive and friction-free for all users, enables management of time and pay with close to zero defects, is available on-demand as new businesses launch, and can flexibly support future innovation. We are tackling new, hard problems that Amazon has not solved at scale, creating fundamentally improved employee experiences for our company’s heroes on the front line. We are developing a suite of solutions (including self-service hardware and software solutions that can be configured flexibly and quickly to support Amazon’s rapid growth). Our organization is a balance of start-up vision and operational excellence, technical complexity and clear product definition, with global scope of more than one million Amazon employees across more than 25 countries and a dozen businesses from our fulfillment centers to retail stores to AWS data centers.

We're building the future of work. Are you ready to embrace the challenge?

Preferred qualifications

Masters or PhD in Computer Science/Engineering or related discipline.
Experience managing a cross functional organization as single-threaded leader of engineering and product.
Experience leading teams applying Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence.
Experience working internationally, and building global solutions.

Experience in operational excellence and process improvement methodologies like Six Sigma and Lean

Excellent customer intuition; success in creating innovative solutions for complex customer problems
Technical fluency; comfort understanding and discussing technology concepts, experience evaluating tradeoffs and new opportunities with technical team members ·
Hands-on, ‘roll up your sleeves’ mindset, with the ability to be a change agent in the org
Strong strategic ability to define the right strategy and develop the product roadmap to deliver it

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

Product Managers at TikTok connect ambiguous opportunities to ambitious outcomes. They do this by working with teams of diverse talent to identify clear goals, develop comprehensive strategies, and ensure successful execution.

The Business Integrity team's mission is to uphold ethical advertising on TikTok, and we're looking for teammates who are passionate about fostering best faith business practices toward our global audience. Product Managers in Business Integrity will be part of an experienced team, working alongside experts in engineering, data science, operations and policy. At the same time, new team members will also be joining an initiative that has only just gotten started--we have far more questions than answers--even as new challenges appear each day. Thus, candidates must be hungry for perspective when forming their product hypotheses, but also relentless in driving those hypotheses toward tangible results.

This role is located in either Mountain View, CA or Seattle, WA.

Responsibilities

Define success by leading team definition of product scope, strategy and solutions
Nurture team empathy for needs and wants of both customers and competitors
Keep teammates from disciplines spanning engineering to operations set up for success
Align team development with company priorities through concise communication

Experience & Education
1. 3+ years experience in product management, having launched at least one product from scratch
1) Experience building solutions addressing content quality or authenticity a plus
2) Experience building solutions based on artificial intelligence or machine learning a plus
2. Bachelors or Masters degree, degree in Computer Science or Engineering a plus

Qualifications
1. Experience working side-by-side with engineers
2. Experience synthesizing data both quantitative and qualitative to inform product decisions
3. Outstanding interpersonal skills communicating both in person and in writing
4. Ability to influence without authority
5. Intellectual humility, honesty and curiosity

TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We believe individuals shouldn't be disadvantaged because of their background or identity, but instead should be considered based on their strengths and experience. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

TikTok is committed to providing reasonable accommodations during our recruitment process. If you need assistance or an accommodation, please reach out to us at Recruiting.Corp@tiktok.com or Recruiting.GBS@tiktok.com

Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Computer Science or related field
Experience building businesses from the ground up
Experience leading engineering and product teams
Experience applying machine learning approaches to complex problems.
Experience building complex software systems that have been successfully delivered to customers at scale

Job summary
Amazon’s Choice makes shopping simpler and more fulfilling for customers. By curating products at massive scale, and highlighting them when they resonate most with customers, Amazon's Choice earns customers' trust as a reliable resource for shopping decisions, and helps them complete billions of purchases worldwide each year on Amazon stores and Alexa. This also creates an opportunity to help customers make even better shopping decisions, and accelerate Amazon flywheel, creating billions of dollars of incremental value along the way. We are looking for a senior leader to take this program to the next level, leading a group of experienced engineers, scientists and product managers, and partnering with key stakeholders across Amazon, to invent, build and scale the product, technology and science that will magically help customers simplify their shopping and increase satisfaction with their purchase.
The ideal candidate will be comfortable building, growing, inspiring and leading a functionally diverse team to:

Develop a strong product vision to grow Amazon's Choice value to customers
Evolve the technical strategy for web-scale reliability, with extension points and experimentation capabilities that enable rapid iteration on incremental features and CX.
Leverage science (e.g., deep learning, reinforcement learning, economics) to create unparalleled trust and convenience
Define success metrics and valuation frameworks, and build the data infrastructure to support them.
Partner strategically with stakeholder teams across Amazon to leverage their capabilities in Amazon's Choice and/or leverage Amazon's Choice capabilities to help them achieve their goals.

Key job responsibilities
This leader is responsible for hiring and developing a highly technical team, rapidly inventing and shipping new experiences that redefine convenience in shopping at Amazon stores, and with Alexa.

A day in the life
This leader will help reshape how Amazon customers search, browse and engage with recommendations to improve the shopping experience WW, qualifying, ranking and curating highly relevant products to highlight for customers. They will will work closely with: Alexa, Search, Personalization, Pricing, Delivery Experience, and Seller teams, drafting working back documents, technical strategies, and UI/UX designs.


Strong understanding of the technology and product development lifecycle, and experience designing and delivering best in class products.
Experience managing teams applying Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence.
Experience building global solutions.
High judgment on customer- or business-related decisions, including one-way doors.
A passion for people management and mentorship; hiring and developing great people; growing a diverse team and an inclusive culture.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

ABOUT BREAKTHROUGH ENERGY

Established in 2015 by Bill Gates and a coalition of private investors concerned about the impacts of accelerating climate change, Breakthrough Energy supports the innovations that will lead the world to net-zero emissions. We are building on the proven model of public-private partnerships that Gates has already used to transform health, education, and public welfare around the world. Breakthrough Energy is a network of entities and initiatives, including investment funds, nonprofit and philanthropic programs, and policy efforts linked by a common commitment to scale the technologies we need to achieve a path to net zero emissions by 2050. We are encouraging the development of new net-zero energy technologies, championing policies that speed innovation from lab to market, and bringing together governments, research institutions, private companies, and investors to expand and enhance clean-energy investment.

Breakthrough Energy embraces diversity and recognize our responsibility to provide a diverse and inclusive work environment. We value the benefits that arise from a diverse organization and are committed to fostering a culture of diversity, equity, and inclusion where employees of all backgrounds can collaboratively work and serve Breakthrough Energy's mission. This is extended to all areas of the employee lifecycle and experience, including recruitment, hiring, compensation, training, promotions, career development programs, and benefits. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity, and sexual orientation), parental status, national origin, age, disability, genetic information (including family medical history), political affiliation, military service, or other non-merit-based factors. We encourage diverse candidates to apply.

JOB DESCRIPTION OVERVIEW

Breakthrough Energy is seeking a Senior Research Scientist to join the Breakthrough Energy Sciences team, focused on the team's Energy System Modeling work. Breakthrough Energy Sciences has built a high-resolution open-source energy systems modeling platform to help governments, regulators, advocates, industry experts, and academic researchers navigate potential decarbonization pathways.

In this role, you'll apply cutting-edge technologies to solve the energy and climate problems. As a Research Scientist, you will collaborate with a growing team of research scientists, software engineers, data scientists, and the product lead who are building an open-source simulation and optimization platform to study how to transition to a net zero energy system. The outcome of the work will provide decision support for future energy system planning, operation, and policy making. The ideal candidate will be self-driven, passionate, proactive, and be able to succeed within an open, collaborative, startup-like environment.

CORE RESPONSIBILITIES

Conduct analyses of power-system simulations and optimizations using publicly available data sources and open-source software, and communicate results in both reports/papers and presentations
Research and develop models of energy system infrastructure and operations (both baseline and optimized) and develop specifications for how these models can be included in Breakthrough Energy open-source software tools
Collaborate with external research institutes and universities
Work with a diverse team on specific topics:
Current electric grid infrastructure and demand
Projections of buildouts of generation, transmission, and energy storage
Modeling of current & future market operations (e.g. security-constrained unit commitment, dispatch of both short-duration and long-duration energy storage)
Electrification of traditionally-fossil-fueled end-uses (e.g. transportation and building heating)
Demand-side flexibility (current and future)
Additional grid-coupled networks such as hydrogen and carbon-capture

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS

Experience working with large-scale mathematical optimization problems and modeling tools
Strong analytical, research, and communication skills

PREFERRED EXPEREINCE

Experience working for energy industry consulting companies, ISOs, RTOs, or large utilities highly preferred
Experience working for power system software vendors highly preferred
Experience with energy policy and regulatory analysis highly preferred
5+ years of experience modeling, optimizing, and simulating large electric power systems
5+ years of experience code development and review in Python, Julia, or other modern high-level object-oriented language
Experience of improving performance of large-scale simulation/optimization with ML/RL/AI techniques
PhD degree in Operational Research, Industrial System Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or a similar field of study

Breakthrough Energy's commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion is also represented in our compensation philosophy. We are committed to offering starting salaries on the value of the position within the market. We do not believe salary should be based on a candidate's ability to negotiate, previous salary history, or any other non-skills-based attributes. Breakthrough Energy believes that transparency is a pathway to achieving pay equity. We offer candidates a competitive compensation package that includes salary and generous benefits.

Breakthrough Energy will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodations. If reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and/or to receive other benefits and privileges of employment, please contact Craig Staples at craig@breakthroughenergy.org.

JobTitle: Account Manager, Startup Team | Seattle, SF, or LA
Content_text:
Bachelors Degree or equivalent additional years of experience
5+ years of sales or total experience 3+ years of technology related sales or business development experience in (IAAS, SAAS, Cloud, Software, or Technology)

Job summary
As an Account Manager for Startups at Amazon Web Services (AWS), you will be the strategic lead responsible for driving cloud adoption within a group of stellar startups at the forefront of machine learning development.

AWS offers a complete set of cloud services that enable all companies, from startups to enterprises, to run virtually everything in the cloud, including application development, model training, big data analytics, and AI/ML platforms.

Startups, represent a critically important subset of customers to AWS. These companies have unique needs, technical considerations, sales cycles, and growth trajectories that distinguish them from traditional companies. These businesses require different engagement strategies and sales motions from sellers to effectively acquire, grow, and retain them on the AWS platform long-term. As AWS continues to rapidly grow, we seek a Startup Account Manager to earn trust and help drive growth amongst a set of well-funded, high-potential startups.

The ideal candidate possesses a strong sales acumen, knowledge of the startup ecosystem, a passion for (and familiarity with) machine learning trends. You will be working with startups building cutting edge AI and ML solutions, so extensive collaboration with external contacts and internal teams will be key to build and execute on plans to meet and exceed sales quota.

Your responsibilities will include driving revenue, crafting partnerships, accelerating innovation through service adoption, and ensuring these startups select AWS as their primary cloud provider.

You will align closely with counterparts in business development, marketing, solution architecture and partner teams to lead execution of coordinated go-to-market strategies and sales plays.

You will also work closely with business development teams who are driving strategic support, global co-programming, and portfolio engagement to help drive top-of-funnel customer acquisition and accelerate seller cycles in the field.

Candidates will be working with startups building cutting edge AI and ML solutions and should have a good understanding of machine learning technologies and how startups are using them to enhance services and processes for end customers.

The ideal candidate will have a strong entrepreneurial spirit who is prepared to work in a fast-paced, often ambiguous environment, execute against ambitious goals, and consistently embrace the Amazon Culture

Roles & Responsibilities:

Ensure customer success with early, mid and late-stage startups
Drive revenue and market share in a defined territory or industry vertical
Accelerate customer adoption through well-developed sales engagements and successful GTM Strategy
Meet or exceed quarterly revenue and goal targets. - Develop and execute against a comprehensive account/territory plan.
Create & articulate compelling value propositions around AWS services.
Accelerate customer adoption by engaging Founders, CxO, Board of Directors and VC influencers
Work with partners to extend reach & drive adoption. - Develop long-term strategic relationships with key accounts.

Successfully work in a large-scale environment, leading collaboration with AWS resources (Solution Architects, Business Development, Marketing, Partners, Support, and Service teams) to drive customer solution adoption at scale.

Moderate travel to customer sites is required.

Work/Life Balance
Our team is focused on balancing life with work, and does this via work autonomy and by prioritizing solutions and processes that enable the success of our customers. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.

Mentorship and Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new team members. Our team has a broad mix of experience levels and Amazon tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We also encourage curiosity and ownership of self-service learning opportunities within Amazon Web Services’ internal training and certification resources.

Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and we host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

About the team
Inclusive Team Culture

Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.

Mentorship & Career Growth

Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

Location open to San Francisco Bay Area, LA Metro, or Seattle

MBA/MA/MS degree
Previous cloud expertise at a technology company and/or AI/ML background
Passion for helping startups grow
Passion for and familiarity with AI/ML and Cloud trends
History of working for, or selling to tech startups
Experience working with founders is desirable
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Comfortable delivering results amid ambiguity and change
