Allen AI Predoctoral Young Investigator, Mosaic

Who You Are:

PYI candidates have graduated with a bachelor's or master's degree in a relevant field and are preparing to enter a PhD program in the next 1-3 years. We also welcome applications from candidates already enrolled in a PhD program who wish to align their work with AI2's endeavors, and we are happy to work on a case-by-case basis with regards to work arrangements if there is a mutual fit.

Why Mosaic:

Interested in building machines with commonsense intelligence? With the Mosaic team, you will be at the forefront of research in Commonsense in AI. As a Pre-doctoral Young Investigator, you'll have the opportunity to work on various aspects of commonsense in AI:

How should we model commonsense reasoning capabilities?
How should we represent commonsense in our AI models?
How should we reason across modalities - e.g. images and text?
How should we collect and organize commonsense knowledge?
How should we benchmark commonsense reasoning capabilities of AI?
How should we reason through generation?
How should we identify and mitigate biases in our datasets?
How should we <your ideas here>?

Your Next Challenge:

The Allen AI Predoctoral Young Investigator on the Mosaic team offers predoctoral candidates the opportunity to prepare for graduate-level research through partnership with strong mentors, participation in cutting edge research, and co-authorship of papers at top venues. This program aims to position candidates for successful entry into a top graduate program. For potential candidates who are already enrolled in graduate studies, this program offers the opportunity to work with researchers at AI2 on collaborative projects for the benefit of both AI2's initiatives and your thesis work.

Gain strong research experience through direct collaboration with AI2 researchers
Co-author papers with AI2 researchers and get published in top venues
Learn about and leverage AI2's data, engineering infrastructure, and research tools
Gain industry experience in a supportive, agile, mission-driven environment
No grant writing, teaching, or administrative responsibilities required

Who We Are:

The Allen Institute for Artificial Intelligence is a non-profit research institute in Seattle founded by Paul Allen and headed by Professor Oren Etzioni. The core mission of AI2 is to contribute to humanity through high-impact research in artificial intelligence.

In addition to AI2's core mission, we also aim to contribute to humanity through our treatment of each member of the AI2 Team. Some highlights are:

We are a learning organization – because everything AI2 does is ground-breaking, we are learning every day. Similarly, through weekly AI2 Academy lectures, a wide variety of world-class AI experts as guest speakers, and our commitment to your personal on-going education, AI2 is place where you will have opportunities to continue learning alongside your coworkers.
We value diversity - We seek to hire, support, and promote people from all genders, ethnicities, and all levels of experience regardless of age. We particularly encourage applications from women, non-binary individuals, people of color, members of the LGBTQA+ community, and people with disabilities of any kind.
We value inclusion - We understand the value that people's individual experiences and perspectives can bring to an organization, and we are building a culture in which all voices are heard, respected and considered.
We emphasize a healthy work/life balance – we believe our team members are happiest and most productive when their work/life balance is optimized. While we value powerful research results which drive our mission forward, we also value dinner with family, weekend time, and vacation time. We offer generous paid vacation and sick leave as well as family leave.
We are collaborative and transparent – we consider ourselves a team, all moving with a common purpose. We are quick to cheer our successes, and even quicker to share and jointly problem solve our failures.
We are in Seattle – and our office is on the water! We have mountains, we have lakes, we have four seasons, we bike to work, we have a vibrant theater scene, and we have so much else. We even have kayaks for you to paddle right outside our front door. We welcome interest from applicants from outside of the United States.
We are friendly– chances are you will like every one of the 100+ (and growing) people who work here. We do.

AI2 is proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at hr@allenai.org or you may call us at 206-548-5600.

Job summary
Do you want to create worldwide impact in Robotics? The Robotics AI team at Amazon builds high-performance, real-time robotic systems that can perceive, learn, and act intelligently alongside humans—at Amazon scale.

Our mission is to enable robots to interact safely, efficiently, and fluently with the clutter and uncertainty of real-world fulfillment centers. Our AI solutions enable robots to learn from their own experiences, from each other, and from humans to build intelligence that feeds itself.

We hire and develop subject matter experts in robotics with a focus on motion planning, computer vision, deep learning, intelligent control, semi-supervised and unsupervised learning. We target high-impact algorithmic unlocks in areas such as scene and activity understanding, closed-loop control, robotic grasping, and manipulation in high-contact environments—all of which have high-value impact for our current and future fulfillment networks.

Key job responsibilities
We are seeking hands-on, Applied Scientist who will be deep in code and algorithms; who has a wealth of robotics experience, and who is technically strong in building scalable ML solutions. As an Applied Scientist in Robotics AI, you will contribute to the research and development of advanced robotic systems; you will work along with other top-notch scientists and engineers to deliver the world's most scalable and robust robotic systems. In addition to coming up with novel solutions and prototypes, you will directly contribute to implementation. A successful candidate has excellent communication skills and a drive to achieve results in a collaborative team environment.

You should enjoy the process of solving real-world problems that, quite frankly, haven’t been solved at scale anywhere before. Along the way, we guarantee you’ll get opportunities to be a fearless disruptor, prolific innovator, and a reputed problem solver—someone who truly enables AI and robotics to significantly impact the lives of millions of consumers.

PhD and 7+ years of industry experience in Robotics, machine learning, computer vision, autonomous controls, sensing and/or field operations.

Are you interested in being part of a small agile team, helping to grow one of Azure’s fastest growing businesses? Are you a creative problem solver looking to drive impact? If so, then the Azure Data + AI + Mixed Reality Product Marketing team has an opportunity for you.
We are looking for a strong marketer to help grow Azure AI’s offerings. This role requires critical thinking, cross-group collaboration and storytelling skills as well as a passion for technology and developer audiences. In this role, you will help define and drive the messaging for Azure AI’s speech and language services and be responsible for customer facing technical content and customer evidence to define market perception and drive adoption. You will also be responsible for developing and delivering demonstrations for executive-level event keynotes.

Drive analyst/influencer engagement for Azure AI
Apply innovative storytelling techniques to create great customer evidence to inspire practitioners

Aptitude for quickly learning new and emerging technologies
Experience with AI offerings is a plus
Ability to explain customer scenarios and solution architectures in a broadly relatable manner
Excellent verbal and written communication skills and storytelling skills are required
Strong project management, critical thinking and cross-group collaboration skills are required
1-2 years of product marketing/product management experience is a plus
A Bachelor’s degree (or equivalent) in Computer Science or some related discipline is preferred
Some travel required

JobTitle: SVP of Platform Engineering - AI + ML & venture capital back...
Content_text: One of my high growth venture capital backed clients is looking for a VP of Engineering. In this role, you will lead engineering efforts. The expectation is over the next 18 months you will grow a team of 25 engineers to 75 - 100. Core platforms you will lead are mobile, b2c, b2b, data and cloud. Lots of true AI + ML no code. This is a series b funded company that has been in business for 4 years, in 2020 business grew and was profitable. The platforms you lead will be used on a global scale with lots of international consumers and b2b fintech clients. Candidates who have true product engineering experience combined with leading + building high growth engineering teams are the best fit. Please note this role would require you to relocate to Ohio over the next 6 to 12 months. 100% remote is not an option. Your engineering teams will sit in the US and also in Europe. Please reach out directly if you are interested in discussing: https://www.linkedin.com/in/lou-russo-2ba5006/Job Type: Full-timePay: $200,000.00 - $300,000.00 per yearEducation:Bachelor's (Preferred)Experience:Management: 1 year (Preferred)Work Location: Multiple Locations

What we offer
Our company culture is focused on helping our employees enable innovation by building breakthroughs together. How? We focus every day on building the foundation for tomorrow and creating a workplace that embraces differences, values flexibility, and is aligned to our purpose-driven and future-focused work. We offer a highly collaborative, caring team environment with a strong focus on learning and development, recognition for your individual contributions, and a variety of benefit options for you to choose from. Apply now!
POSITION SUMMARY
We are seeking a Data Scientist to join us in reshaping the face of global commerce! SAP is uniquely positioned to achieve this task, as hundreds of billions of events, representing more than 75% of the world’s transaction revenue, touch an SAP system. Come join SAP's Intelligent Spend Management team (ISM). We are leveraging large amounts of heterogeneous “big data,” artificial intelligence, machine learning, and cutting-edge technologies to drive innovation and create insights for our customers.
As a Data Scientist on our team, you’ll join an agile, fun, and productive team of data scientists that are working to connect the world’s data and unlock new insights that will drive SAP innovations. To achieve this, you’ll partner closely with engineers in the Data & AI Platform team, who are working to build tools, services, and technologies to support large-scale data exploration.
The ideal candidate for this role will have a big-picture vision, a love of technology, and a can-do attitude with a passion to redefine norms and drive innovation. This is a high-impact role on a rapidly growing team, where you’ll have the opportunity to directly contribute to the success of the ISM team. This position will help define goals, create, and test models, and drive innovation in close collaboration and partnership with other researchers and engineers.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Work with data science team members, product managers, and external stakeholders to identify opportunities for new and innovative data analytics insights, metrics, and features.
Collaborate with other data scientists, product owners, and business/engineering teams to turn data into valuable and actionable insights for our customers.
Drive excellence in data science work, performing experiments, documenting results, analyzing data, delivering new models, analysis, and insights.
Develop and monitor metrics to evaluate the importance and success of data analytics, working to ensure their adoption and health.

REQUIRED SKILLS
BA/BS required, preferably in a quantitative field (e.g. Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Finance, Economics)
2+ years’ experience in data modeling and using data analytical tools and techniques (e.g., Python, SQL, Hadoop, R)
Proficient with data analysis and modeling software such as R and/or scripting languages such as Python
Experience with Cloud-based data processing and machine learning technologies such as Tensorflow, SageMaker, and ML Pipelines
Proficient at implementing both supervised and unsupervised machine learning models
Familiarity with statistical models and data mining algorithms
Familiarity with Data Science techniques such as clustering, anomaly detection, etc.
Ability to effectively communicate complex analysis to internal and external stakeholders at all levels
We are SAP
SAP innovations help more than 400,000 customers worldwide work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively. Originally known for leadership in enterprise resource planning (ERP) software, SAP has evolved to become a market leader in end-to-end business application software and related services for database, analytics, intelligent technologies, and experience management. As a cloud company with 200 million users and more than 100,000 employees worldwide, we are purpose-driven and future-focused, with a highly collaborative team ethic and commitment to personal development. Whether connecting global industries, people, or platforms, we help ensure every challenge gets the solution it deserves. At SAP, we build breakthroughs, together.
Our inclusion promise
SAP’s culture of inclusion, focus on health and well-being, and flexible working models help ensure that everyone – regardless of background – feels included and can run at their best. At SAP, we believe we are made stronger by the unique capabilities and qualities that each person brings to our company, and we invest in our employees to inspire confidence and help everyone realize their full potential. We ultimately believe in unleashing all talent and creating a better and more equitable world.

Microsoft runs on trust. As our lives and businesses are becoming increasingly digitized, trust is the glue that holds our world together. To create and enhance this trust, we must proactively protect our customers, partners, and Microsoft from operational risk.
The 3rd Party Compliance Engineering team subscribes to a 'lean startup' culture in shipping modern, customer-centric, data driven products that offer unparalleled levels of risk protection. We embrace collaboration, agility, and the belief that experimentation (failing fast) drives innovation. In our daily work, we demonstrate growth mindset, ownership, grit, vision, curiosity, and courage; we require you to bring those values as well. When you join this award-winning team, you will become a member of a diverse, and inclusive cohort of extremely talented engineers- each of whom love sharing knowledge, have big hearts, and small egos. You will work and learn from experts across domains that include cloud architecture, distributed systems, business process automation, AI/ML, cybersecurity, digital fingerprinting, philanthropy, and operations. When surveyed anonymously, 100% of our team agreed that their roles had real purpose, and their job was more than just a job.
Now let us talk about you. We are looking for a talented, insatiably curious Software Engineer with experience designing and building highly available, resilient, containerized cloud-hosted microservices. You want to build best-in-class solutions using robust coding practices and the latest tech. You have passion and desire to work under an Agile DevOps culture and you enjoy the rhythm of a fast-paced startup environment. You relish the opportunity to create world-impacting solutions that most people wouldn't believe are possible, and yet you also feel motivated when contributing in small ways. If this sounds like you, and you buy into our team's values, then come help us build a foundation of trust for our world's digital future.
Responsibilities
Build and ship the next generation of highly scalable, cloud native applications and large scale distributed microservices.
Bring excellent software engineering habits and produce high quality code that is unit tested, code reviewed, and checked in regularly for continuous integration.
Collaborate with colleagues including product owners, UX designers, ML Engineers/Researchers, data scientists and other engineers to create delightful and meaningful experiences for our customers.
Evangelize and/or propose new ideas while ‘bringing others along” with strong communications.
Demonstrate a sense of pride, ownership, and personal accountability for the end-to-end product.
Continuous learning and working closely with the latest technologies in Microsoft.
Qualifications
Required qualifications:
A minimum of a bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Engineering or a related field, or equivalent alternative education, skills, and/or practical experience.
2-year minimum experience in software development using OOP, C#, .NET Core, NoSQL.
Preferred qualifications:
Experience working with cloud computing platforms like Azure, AWS.
Experience with container technologies such as Kubernetes, Docker, and more.
Strong understanding of data structures, algorithms, multi-threaded, asynchronous programming patterns and solving complex problems, strong inclination for architecting at scale.
Exposure to Agile software delivery; familiarity with the Application Lifecycle Management using Azure DevOps/VSTS.

About DataRobot
DataRobot was founded in 2012 to democratize access to AI. Today, DataRobot is the AI Cloud leader, delivering a unified platform for all users, all data types, and all environments to accelerate delivery of AI to production for every organization. DataRobot is trusted by global customers across industries and verticals, including a third of the Fortune 50, delivering over a trillion predictions for leading companies around the world. Learn more at datarobot.com.
About the Opportunity
As a UX Researcher, you will have the opportunity to lead innovative research with demonstrable impact on customer engagement and product lead growth.
Would be joining the product design team to shape the future of our customer-facing product through a data driven research approach. You will be one of the first dedicated researchers at DataRobot and will have the responsibility of establishing best practices for user research and testing for the product team.

What we want you to do:
Conduct research efforts to deepen our knowledge of the customer’s goals and workflow that will help drive the future of our product strategy.
Deliver actionable insights to other teams by helping to define and shape research initiatives and infrastructure; maintain an easily accessible database of insights.
Conduct and guide research projects from start to finish using methods such as diary studies, surveys, user/usability testing, A|B testing, and qualitative analytics.
Work collaboratively and partner with customer teams, product managers, designers and engineers to present customer findings.
Advocate for the power of research throughout the company.
Synthesize research to identify innovative opportunities to meet our customer’s evolving needs.

Who You Are:
You are a skilled, professional user researcher with 4+ years of relevant experience conducting research for enterprise B2B products, experience in the AI field a plus.
You are able to tell compelling stories, communicate insightful research findings, and explain your process and decisions to a wide range of stakeholders.
You are proficient in a variety of quantitative and qualitative research methodologies.
You can conduct comprehensive research at scale.
A self-starter when it comes to problem solving, requiring only minimal help from a manager or research lead.
Ability to perform all research related tasks in the research project lifecycle: Create a test plan, write a screener, recruit users, schedule users, moderate test, create video clip highlights, top line results, create research findings summary, and effectively present and share results.
Experience with remote testing tools.
Established relationships with trusted research vendors a plus.

Are you passionate about Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning and Deep Learning? Do you want to be at the bleeding edge of innovation in AI? Do you believe in the scaled impact a platform can have? If that is you, then we should talk.

Alexa’s Secure AI Foundations (SAIF) Platform is the platform that thousands of Alexa Scientists, Modelers, Engineers, and Researchers use to invent new technology that powers Alexa - one of the most advanced customer obsessed AI systems in production around the world.

We are looking for a leader to help build up our SensAI technical docs and instructional design team. As manager of our SensAI technical documentation team, you will drive cross-cutting documentation and instructional programs for product launches making SAIF the best AI development platform in the world. The work this team does will be mission critical to enabling AlexaAI scientists to leverage our AI/ML platform in a self-service way, enabling SAIF to scale and spend more time innovating on behalf of our science and engineering partners.

We want to bring ease-of-use, customer experience, and ability to self-serve to the forefront as critical features of our products. In order to enable this, you will have the opportunity to participate in the design of new platforms and overcome complex technical and customer experience challenges at scale. You will work in a fast-paced environment and take on unique challenges that will delight customers and have a highly visible impact on our platform and customer experience.

You will be a catalyst for effective teamwork, communication, collaboration and commitment across multiple geographically separated groups delivering jointly on mission critical systems. You will contribute to our success with your hands-on project management skills, understanding of SAIF strategic direction, technical expertise, business knowledge, and excellent leadership and negotiation skills. You will be responsible for working with Product Management to develop documentation roadmap, ensure product designs are built with end-users in mind, align content subject-matter experts, and prioritize execution and delivery including project plans and risk management.

You should be a problem solver who is excited by hard never-been-solved before challenges, and enjoys working with science and tech teams collaboratively. You should be somebody who is passionate about customers and about leading programs that have both broad influence and unique science and technical challenges to solve. The ideal candidate will have experience leading delivery across science and engineering disciplines and an established track record of delivering large complex programs.

Job responsibilities

Build and lead team of technical and programmer writers for self-service, easy-to-use AI/ML platform.
Define creative, high quality, and clear documentation and instructional design roadmaps based on customer and stakeholder needs, team strategy, and vision
Develop detailed, crisp business requirements, and user stories that can be used to create product specifications and architecture for the capabilities offered
Manage prioritization and trade-offs among needs of various customer and stakeholder groups, as well as, security, system performance and scalability.
Create buy-in for vision and roadmap both internally and across key partners
Proactively identify and resolve issues that may impair the team’s ability to meet strategic or technical goals.

JobTitle: Senior Technical Program Manager - Amazon Connect (AWS)
Content_text:
7+ years design/implementation/consulting experience with distributed applications
Technical degree required; Computer Science or Math background highly desired
3+ years' of experience working with engineering teams to define, scope and prioritize product requirements
3+ years' of experience with system-level design and architecture of enterprise-scale services

Are you inspired to work with a team than launches products with direct and massive impact on Amazon’s customers? Are you excited to join one of the newest and most exciting AWS services?

Amazon Connect is a highly disruptive cloud-based contact center that enables businesses to deliver engaging, dynamic, and personal customer service experiences. Amazon Connect is the result of the ten years of development that went into building the tools Amazon uses to provide its award winning customer service at massive scale and launching it as a publicly available AWS service. With Amazon Connect, you can create your own cloud-based contact center and be taking calls in minutes. Amazon Connect leverages the power of Artificial Intelligence and the large ecosystem of AWS services such as Amazon Lex, Amazon Polly, AWS Lambda, Amazon S3 and Amazon Kinesis to provide a truly frustration free, easy-to-use, extensible, and natural customer experience. With this technology, we are transforming an industry and the way customers interact with businesses and how agents service them.
See our section in Andy Jassy 2020 re: Invent keynote

We have a rapidly growing customer base and an exciting charter in front of us that includes solving highly complex engineering and algorithmic problems. We are looking for passionate and talented Technical Program Manager to join us to innovate on this new service that addresses customer needs to build modern contact centers in the cloud. The position represents a rare opportunity to be a part of a fast-growing business soon after launch, and help shape the technology and product as we grow. You will be playing a crucial role in developing the next generation contact center, and get the opportunity to design and deliver scaleable, resilient systems while maintaining a constant customer focus.

We are looking for a highly effective Senior Technical Program Manager that can lead a team to quickly design and deliver systems while maintaining a constant customer focus.
The Technical Program Manager for this team needs a sound understanding of the fundamentals of communications and practical experience building large-scale distributed systems. If you become the Senior Technical Program Manager, you will work with design, technical, and business leaders to set strategy and define the product. You will drive, track, and report the development effort to leadership and partners. You will define the engagement model and manage internal/external dependencies and relationships. You will be key leader responsible for delivering the distributed systems and analytics that will enable AWS to continue changing the software industry by delivering more capabilities to more customers.

This team is a great fit for you if


You enjoy working with a fun team that prides itself on a great work environment with an inclusive group of people that are working together towards a common goal.
You are sensitive to customer needs and interested in working on a service that will be used, directly and indirectly, by millions of customers and has a meaningful impact to their functions and interactions.
You’d like to be directly responsible for solving real customer problems.
You are a passionate learner and are motivated to take on new challenges.

·

You want to have fun; surround yourself with a highly talented pool of engineers that like to solve complex problems, but also enjoy work life balance.

·
Learn more about Amazon Connect here.

Media coverage on Amazon Connect can be found here, here and here
Power of Amazon Connect

Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee -led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.


An understanding of Web Services, AWS, and/or Cloud Computing
Sound business judgment with the ability to think creatively, analyze quantitatively, problem-solve, scope technical requirements and prioritize
Demonstrated ability to adapt to new technologies and learn quickly
Exceptional interpersonal and relationship management skills
Ability to succeed in a fast-paced, innovative, and rapidly evolving industry and business organization
Track record for being detail-oriented with a demonstrated ability to self-motivate and follow-through on projects
Working knowledge of software development tools and methodologies · Strong written communication skills
Presentation skills with a high degree of comfort speaking with executives and engineers.
Strong problem-solving skills; the ability to analyze problems and develop actionable and appropriate tactical plans quickly

TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy.

TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, Mountain View, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Mumbai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo.

The speech audio music team mission is to empower content interaction and creation using speech & audio related technologies. We are focus on cutting-edge R&D in areas like speech & audio, music processing, natural language understanding and multimodal deep learning, we are looking for top talents to work on these exciting technologies, integrate them into various TikTok products and ultimately bring the joy to our global user base!


Conduct cutting-edge research and development in music information retrieval, music creation, music/audio signal processing, interactive music and related fields.
Transfer advanced technologies to ByteDance products.
Explore new products with music intelligence technology at its core.
Masters or PhD in computer science, mathematics, engineering or related field;
Experience in one or more areas of music intelligence and deep learning, including but not limited to:
Music information retrieval
AI music composition and creation
Digital signal processing for music and audio
Interactive music
Sequence models and generative models
Multimodal ML with music, audio and video.
Familiar with deep learning frameworks such as Tensorflow and Pytorch.
Highly competent in algorithms and programming; Strong coding skills in C/C++ and Python.
Familiar with engineering principles and best practices.
Ability to work collaboratively in a fast paced, multi-functional environment.

TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We believe individuals shouldn't be disadvantaged because of their background or identity, but instead should be considered based on their strengths and experience. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

About Futureforce University Recruiting
Our Futureforce University Recruiting program is dedicated to attracting, retaining and cultivating talent. Our interns and new graduates work on real projects that affect how our business runs, giving them the opportunity to make a tangible impact on the future of our company. With offices all over the world, our recruits have the chance to collaborate and connect with fellow employees on a global scale. We offer job shadowing, mentorship programs, talent development courses, and much more.
Job Category
Customer Success Group
Job Details
Tableau (a Salesforce company) is a clear market leader in the Gartner Magic Quadrant for BI & Analytics. We build software that helps people see and understand data. Not only do we build world-class products, Tableau is also one of the world’s fastest growing marketable skills in the job market! And, if that isn’t enough...we’re also now part of Salesforce , one of the largest software groups in the world.
We believe everyone can be a Trailblazer ! Join us and discover a future of new opportunities.
Description:
Tableau is hiring a fast-growing Consulting / Professional Services team across Globally, including Associate Consultants as part of our Campus Recruiting Program. As an Associate Solution Consultant you’ll be a customer facing consulting in the leading edge industry of analytics, helping our customer see and understand their data!
The perfect candidate will be enthusiastic about technology and an outstanding and friendly communicator (written and verbal) and will be proactive about investigating intricate or technical concepts and helping others do the same. They have a natural curiosity and enjoy solving puzzles, and are real team players who thrive in a collaborative environment.
Responsibilities:
Work with more experienced Tableau consultants delivering high quality deliverables and outcomes to customers in consulting engagements
Developing and delivering skills in Tableau Desktop, Server and Tableau Online
Ability to describe Tableau solutions to customers in a way that is articulate, accurate, and persuasive
Build relationships with stakeholders both internally and externally
Building consulting skills across the Tableau product suite to become trusted advisory to our customers
Required Skills/Experience:
Bachelor's degree and a Dec 2021 -May 2022 graduate
Strong technical competency in data science and/or data analytics with interest in AI/ML
Understanding of data engineering concepts, data management, SQL and ETL
Ability to communicate technical concepts clearly and effectively
Ability to prioritize and escalate issues as required
Ability to learn concepts quickly and develop technical and consultancy skills
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, especially as it applies to data
Innovator who continually studies new technologies and functionality
Interpersonal skills to build relationships and contribute to teamwork
Results-orientation and ability to move forward without complete information
Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage expectations around project deadlines
Desired Skills/Experience:
Visual Analytics and analytics development experience
Programming abilities or abilities to read code in one or more of the following languages: Python, C#, Java, Javascript
Experience/expertise in infrastructure virtualization, Linux and Windows servers, networking and containerization will be an added bonus
What's in it for you?
Clear and structured career path
World Class Training & Development in the areas of professional growth and product knowledge
Constant learning and knowledge sharing with some of the best complex selling professionals in the industry
Opportunity to make a massive impact on your customers' business by providing the best Analytics solutions in the world
Chance to work in a dynamic, fun and challenging environment where you we will make sure you reach your full potential
Gym subsidy, Education Subsidy, 7 Volunteering Days a year among other benefits!
Map your Future:
We provide extensive training and mentoring including Tableau Bootcamp
With our strong coaching culture we aim to develop world-class sales leaders.
After a period of continuous target achievement and learning & development you will have the opportunity to move into more senior consulting roles as part of your career progression plan

Facebook is seeking a Technical Program Manager (TPM) with large-scale distributed software systems experience and a background in data/machine learning systems. This person will be deeply involved in identifying longer term strategies and building scalable, secure, reliable, efficient, and privacy focused Data and ML products and platforms. This person will partner closely with engineering, product and other cross-functional teams to identify problem statements, create roadmaps, scope programs aligning them with business priorities, define milestones and success metric, and drive them to completion by aligning and leading large cross-functional teams.


Build strong and aligned program teams to efficiently deliver on shared goals.
Collaborate with Engineering and business owners to define program requirements, set priorities, and establish scope which includes defining the roadmap and long-term strategy of the teams that you are partnering with.
Manage cross functional dependencies, risks, and changes effectively by optimizing scope, schedule, and resources accordingly.
Develop and own communication plans to effectively and proactively communicate program status, issues, and risks to stakeholders.
Partner with cross functional teams to drive technical analysis, design, development, testing, implementation, and post implementation phases.
Define and track key metrics and key quality and performance indicators and drive cross functional execution of program deliverables.
Proactively identify and analyze complex, long-term, critical infrastructure problems with engineering leaders and stakeholders.
Influence product decisions to align with higher company initiatives.
Drive internal and external process improvements across multiple teams and functions including reducing the manual efforts through automation.


B.S. in Computer Science or a related technical discipline, or equivalent experience.
7+ years of software engineering, systems engineering, hardware engineering, or technical product/program management experience.
Experience delivering tech programs or products from inception to delivery.
Knowledge of user needs, gathering requirements, and defining scope.
Experience operating autonomously across multiple teams, demonstrated critical thinking, and thought leadership.
Communication experience and experience working with technical management teams to develop systems, solutions, and products.
Organizational, coordination and multi-tasking experience.
Analytical and problem-solving experience with large-scale systems.
Experience establishing work relationships across multi-disciplinary teams and multiple partners in different time zones.

Microsoft 365 Defender is experiencing explosive growth and innovation protecting people, services, and devices around the world. Our vision of ‘security for all’ includes solutions that go beyond managing endpoints to secure the cloud, identities, and services of a customer’s security strategy, including solutions outside of the Microsoft Security portfolio.
We are seeking a motivated Principal Product Manager to help bring new & differentiated security solutions to market through the combination of best-of-breed and best-of-suite security capabilities with the power of AI and automation, anchored in Zero Trust. You will partner with security, services, and engineering teams to create, scale, and deliver new security solutions that are driven by innovation, quality, and reliability. The scale of Microsoft Security, Compliance, and Identity operations means that you will be partnering with a diverse, worldwide team ensuring that our solutions are best in class for the world.
If you are excited about creating new business value and amazing customer impact through core technical innovation, power of collaboration and a startup like mindset, then this is the role for you.
Responsibilities
This Individual contributor role will require you to work across multiple teams with focus on following responsibilities:
Customer focus: In this role, the Product Manager will work with internal and external customers on understanding/anticipating their needs and identify differentiated integration & innovation opportunities to solve the problems and delight the customers.
Product Definition: The Product manager will convert customer requirements into crisp, prioritized product roadmap, backlog, specifications with clear objectives and key results to measure success.
Technical Excellence: The Product Manager is responsible for working with engineering ensuring that the product truth is grounded in technical excellence. The PM will be expected to continuously identify opportunities for leveraging automation and AI at scale to help meet/exceed the scale, performance, security, reliability, operational efficiency goals for the service and business.
Data Driven Decisions: The Product Manager will be responsible for defining KPIs, ensuring every aspect of the service is instrumented and delve deep into the data to identify key insights and drive decisions based on them.
Collaboration: The Product Manager will identify and own problems and collaborate with partner teams to solve them. The PM will be expected to create an inclusive environment that brings a diverse set of ideas to the table to deliver innovative, high quality, timely solutions to the problems.
Operational Excellence: The Product Manager will work with each component team ensuring we have high confidence project plans and execution rhythm leadings to timely, high-quality delivery.
Qualifications
Required Qualifications
Bachelor’s Degree or above in Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Product Management, or related fields
8+ years of experience in shipping technical products & cloud services as a product manager, program manager through cross-team collaboration
Preferred Qualifications
An understanding of Microsoft Security technologies, cloud technologies and modern security operations
Strong cross-team collaboration skills
Strong technical problem-solving skills
Data analytics skills and ability to drive data driven decisions
Passionate customer advocate
Relentless drive for results
Excellent written & oral communication skills
Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. About the team
At Zillow Group, we believe that home matters, and we are on a mission to help everyone get into a home where they can thrive. The process of buying, selling, or renting a home should be easy!

The Core NLP and Conversational AI Team builds products that transform the way real estate works, by reducing friction in the home buying, selling and renting process. Our team handles machine learning tasks across the multiple business lines including Premier Agent, Shopping, Rentals and Zillow Offers, absorbing significant amounts of data and building ML and deep learning models to drive transactions and revenue. These solutions ingest large volumes of data and process it to build and deploy large production models that improve the home buying/selling and renting experience.
About the role
We are seeking a Principal Applied Scientist to operate in a novel space and craft the next generation of NLP solutions that will lead our vision. In this role, you will
Contribute in scientific and technical direction for NLP applications at Zillow Group
Think creatively and challenge established assumptions and expectations, not by building on what we already have, but coming up with new insights that fuel innovation
Build models and insights from data to guide the future of Zillow's business and develop highly engaging user experiences
Be the domain expert to whom members of teams across the company turn for expertise, review, and feedback
Build real-time low-latency machine learning platforms
Be hands-on in technical feature development, design, code-reviews, and prototyping
This role has been categorized as a Remote position. “Remote” employees do not have a permanent corporate office workplace and, instead, work from a physical location of their choice which must be identified to the Company. Employees may live in any of the 50 US States, with limited exceptions. In certain cases, an employee in a remote-designated job may need to live in a specific region or time zone to support customers or clients as part of their role.
In Colorado, the standard pay range for this role is $177,100.00 - $282,900.00 Annually. This range is specific to Colorado and may not be applicable to other locations.
Who you are
We're looking for someone who is both a leader that empowers and guides team members, but also a roll-up-the-sleeves and get it done technical expert. More specifically, you should have the following:
8+ years of experience with natural language processing
At least 5 years in machine learning or applied science/research in academia or industry
A Ph.D. in the field of NLP/ML or related fields will set you apart!
Outstanding communication and collaboration skills with PMs, other Scientists and Engineers.
Experience in mentoring junior scientists on the team
Ability to understand business requirements and formulate machine learning solutions methodically
Excellent coding skills and expertise with a high-level programming language such as Python or Java
Experience training machine learning models in deep learning frameworks like PyTorch, Tensorflow, etc.
In addition to a competitive base salary this position is also eligible for equity awards based on factors such as experience, performance and location.
Get to know us
Zillow is reimagining real estate to make it easier to unlock life’s next chapter.
As the most-visited real estate website in the United States, Zillow® and its affiliates offer customers an on-demand experience for selling, buying, renting or financing with transparency and nearly seamless end-to-end service. Millions of people visit Zillow and its affiliate sites every month to start their home search, and now they can rely on Zillow to help them finish it — and no matter what job you're in, you will play a critical role in making this vision a reality.
At Zillow, we're powered by our innovative and inclusive work culture, where everyone has the flexibility, support and resources to do the best work of their careers. Our efforts to streamline the real estate transaction is supported by our passion to redefine the employee experience, a deep-rooted culture of innovation, a fundamental commitment to Equity and Belonging, and world-class benefits. But don't just take our word for it. Read our reviews on Glassdoor and recent recognition from multiple organizations, including: Fortune’s 100 Best Companies to Work For® List 2021 Bloomberg Gender-Equality Index 2021, Human Rights Campaign (HRC) Corporate Equity Index and HRC’s Best Place to Work for LGBTQ Equality 2021, Fortune Best Workplaces for Technology 2020, Fortune Best Workplaces for Millennials 2020, Fortune Best Workplaces for Parents 2020, and the Deloitte Technology Fast 500.
Zillow Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment with the best employees. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. Job Description:
One of Fortune’s Best Places to Work, Perkins Coie, LLP, a leading international law firm, is seeking a Technology Transactions & Privacy Associate Attorney in our Seattle, Chicago, Dallas, Denver, New York, Palo Alto, and Washington, DC office. We’ve created a firm culture that is based on collaboration, dedication to serving our clients and mutual respect. If you are interested in joining the team, please apply at the link below.
Perkins Coie LLP is seeking associates to join our cutting-edge Technology Transactions & Privacy practice. The ideal candidate will have 5-7 years of experience in one or more of the following areas: drafting and negotiating licensing and technology agreements, advising on intellectual property issues, supporting M&A and financing transactions, supporting transactions involving new technologies such as AI and blockchain, and advising start-ups and emerging companies on development, manufacturing, and product launch issues.The ideal candidate will also have subject matter expertise in enterprise software, cloud services, outsourcing, artificial intelligence, blockchain, financial technologies and payment systems, mobile applications, e-commerce, digital content, and/or hardware. Candidates must have experience both working on teams and managing components of transactions independently through closing, experience supervising more junior associates and be able to effectively manage internal and external client and counsel relationships. Candidates with experience working at an AmLaw 100 law firm are preferred. Excellent academic credentials are required. To apply, please attach your cover letter, resume and law school transcript.
This position may be filled in Denver and in accordance with the Colorado Equal Pay Act, the compensation range for this position in Colorado is $280,000 – $325,000 depending upon experience. Perkins Coie may provide a discretionary bonus annually. Information regarding benefits can be found here .

KenSci, a leader in healthcare BI & AI innovative solutions, is on a mission to transform healthcare with data-driven insights and improve human lives. We are a diverse group of engineers, clinicians, data scientists, research scientists, and product leaders committed in building products that emphasize adoption of healthcare-based AI technologies. We focus on Responsible AI to build secure, explainable, fair, and responsible products that optimize clinical outcomes and operational efficiency across the care continuum.


Role

We are looking for a full-time Research Scientist with expert knowledge in applying deep learning techniques for computer vision. This role requires technical leadership, development of repeatable & consistent research methods, and collaboration among product/business leaders, engineers, and clinicians.


This key and visible role will join our strategic mission in building AI algorithms for medical images such as CT scans, X-Rays, and MRIs. The role reports to KenSci’s Research VP.

Your Impact

Your work will help clinicians make better and consistent decisions: We collaborate deeply with our clinical and business customers to bring the promise of predictive analytics to clinical and operational intervention.
You will accelerate adoption of AI in healthcare: AI in healthcare is in its early days and we seek ambitious contributors and partners willing to commit to the journey. Through your work you will help solve complex problems while focused on adoption of technology with measurable outcomes for patients and care providers.
You are the key to building a great culture: “Come as you are” and contribute to the culture, values, and mission of company to give and seek best for everyone.


Core Responsibilities

As a Research Scientist at KenSci you will be engaged in some or all following activities:

Explore and apply relevant deep machine learning algorithms for medical images
Build and develop algorithms within principles of Responsible AI that deliver explainable, fair, secure, transparent, and accountable outcomes.
Communicate with product and business to lead technical design and deliverables for research, development, and deployment of AI algorithms for images
Work with large data sets, integrate diverse data sources, data types and data structures
Create automation to rapidly and consistently evaluate and/or deploy models.
Operate in an Agile/Scrum environment to deliver high quality software products


Qualifications

You are a great match if you have the following skills and qualifications:

PhD or foreign equivalent in Computer Science, Biomedical Engineering, Statistics or imaging-related field, or a
MS and 2+ years of experience in deep machine learning applications for images
Expertise in deep machine learning algorithms for images
Strong knowledge of linear algebra, statistics, and calculus
Expertise in python with use of TensorFlow and/or PyTorch libraries
Experience with building machine learning pipelines on public cloud technologies such as Azure, Google Cloud, or AWS
Proficiency in image pre-processing and visualization techniques for purpose of evaluation and explanations
Focus on research publications and ability to simplify complex technical problems into simple easy-to-remember concepts
Collaborate and connect with other disciplines within KenSci to help shape a culture of trust and transparency

Preferred Qualifications

Prior industry experience building machine learning or AI systems
Prior healthcare industry experience
Prior research publications at reputed journals and conferences on imaging


Our Benefits

Competitive Salary with Annual Bonus
Medical, Dental, and Vision Benefits
401K Retirement Plan
Company-paid Life Insurance
Flexible Time Off and Flexible Work Schedule
Commuter Benefits
Unlimited Snacks and Beverages (in office)
Thoughtful, Diverse, and Supportive Coworkers


KenSci is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or other medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

Executive Administrative Assistant to CFO- Direct Hire/Full time, Bellevue, WA OR can be 100% Remote US West Coast based.D-Wave is the leader in the development and delivery of quantum computing systems, software and services and the world’s first commercial supplier of quantum computers. Our mission is to unlock the power of quantum computing for the world. We do this by delivering customer value with practical quantum applications for problems as diverse as logistics, artificial intelligence, materials sciences, drug discovery, scheduling, cybersecurity, fault detection, and financial modeling. D-Wave’s systems are being used by some of the world’s most advanced organizations, including NEC, Volkswagen, DENSO, Lockheed Martin, USRA, USC, and Los Alamos National Laboratory. To date, D-Wave has raised over $300 million in equity and is the beneficiary of multiple Canadian government grant and loan programs.Due to growth in our executive team, D-Wave has an exciting opportunity for an experienced executive assistant. This role will support our Chief Financial Officer and will be based either in Bellevue, Washington or remotely from the US west coast. The responsibilities and duties of this position have a significant impact on the efficiency and performance of the CFO. Attention to detail in executing top-level assignments contributes to the overall effectiveness and success of the company. In addition to general administrative duties, you will:Play a key role in project managing important executive-led initiatives, often of a very confidential nature.Proactively manage executive calendars, including last minute shuffling, while interacting with a wide variety of internal and external constituents. This may include a diverse group of shareholders, board of directors, prospective investors, bankers, public accountants, security analysts, and other internal executives at D-Wave.Your curious nature will look for ways to optimize time and efficiency in our busy, fast paced start up environment.Work collaboratively on a small, geographically dispersed, Executive Administrative team while also taking initiative to work independently to complete tasks in a positive way.Work collaboratively and support other members of the Executive Administrative team. Note: This is not a manager role.Other Responsibilities: Schedule complex travel accommodations and monitor all aspects of the trip in real-time.Organize and manage key external and internal meetings in a timely and accurate manner.Process expense reports, vendor invoices and purchase orders as needed.Prepare and format information for internal and external communication: emails, presentations, reports, etc., while paying close attention to detail.Take minutes during executive meetings and help to identify and drive action items.Manage phone calls and distribute follow up correspondence as appropriate.Carefully draft correspondence for dissemination to employees, members of the board, investors, bankers, customers, and business leaders.Establish and maintain internal and external contacts on behalf of the CFO.Collect and prepare information for use in discussions and meetings of executive staff, board of directors, and outside individuals.Set-up and maintain records and files that contain confidential information.Ensure company information is maintained in a confidential manner.Complete special projects independently as requested by the executive team.Perform other related duties as assigned.Who you are: You pride yourself on gaining the trust of those you support, being their right-hand person, making their life easier, ensuring things are in their place and catching mistakes before they happen. You enjoy contributing to key projects, you embrace new communication technologies and can capture the key points and action items in meetings, even with very complex technical discussions. You are tech savvy with great experience with tools such as Office/PowerPoint, SharePoint, Slack, Confluence, Zoom and more*Required Education and Experience: *Associate degree or equivalent. BA/BS degree preferred.5+ years’ executive assistant experience supporting a senior level CFO in the technical industry.Experience, poise, and comfort interacting with senior executives, board of directors, investors and representatives from industry, academia, and government.Ability to handle confidential information with discretion.Very experienced with the MS Office suite, specifically Outlook, Word, Excel and PowerPoint. Tech Savvy.Commitment to accuracy and strong attention to detail.Excellent interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills including ability to review and edit written communications effectively.Highly organized with excellent time management skills in a rapidly changing environment under tight deadlines and with minimal supervision.Strong research and sourcing abilities.Superb business etiquette and calm professional demeanor.Ability to use sound judgment and make decisions of a routine and complex nature in highly confidential situations.If you’re an organized person who loves problem solving and playing a key role in an exciting, growing tech company, this is the role for you!This role will be based onsite in Bellevue, WA (100% remote for all locations during the COVID pandemic) or can be 100% remote if based on west coast USA. Must be legally able to work in the US without sponsorship and based in the US currently.This business uses E-Verify in its U.S. hiring practices to achieve a lawful workforce. E-Verify® is a registered trademark of the U.S. Department of Homeland Security.*No 3rd party candidates will be accepted.*It is D-Wave Systems Inc. policy to provide equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, physical or mental disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state/provincial, local law.Job Type: Full-time

JobTitle: Staff Software Engineer, Natural Language Processing
Content_text:
Minimum qualifications:

Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
10 years of software development experience, or 8 years with an advanced degree.
Experience with software development using Python.
Experience with applied Natural Language Processing.
Preferred qualifications:

Master’s degree or PhD in Engineering, Computer Science, or a related technical field.
15 years of professional software development experience.
Experience with software development using C++.
Experienced with Tensorflow or similar frameworks.
Experience with computer vision models and approaches.
About the job
Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our products need to handle information at massive scale, and extend well beyond web search. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to Google’s needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to take on new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward.

Google Cloud Document AI (DocAI) provides components and solutions to enterprises for automating document workflows using state-of-the art Computer Vision and Natural Language Processing. Our team is at the forefront of reducing the tedium in paperwork for consumers, enterprises, and institutions, and generally organizing unstructured enterprise documents and making them useful. This is a $5B and growing market with customers looking to Google to lead in higher quality, and better integrated solutions. Not to mention Document AI being a differentiating feature to bring more customers to Google Cloud Platform in general.
Our team is responsible for exploring and developing algorithms that extract structured information from documents and text, and productionizing those algorithms to help both internal and external users quickly build high-accuracy document processing solutions.

Google Cloud provides organizations with leading infrastructure, platform capabilities and industry solutions. We deliver enterprise-grade cloud solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology to help companies operate more efficiently and adapt to changing needs, giving customers a foundation for the future. Customers in more than 150 countries turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to solve their most critical business problems.
Responsibilities
Apply, design, and develop cutting-edge Natural Language Processing methodologies for entity extraction to convert unstructured documents into structured data.
Develop the long-term strategy and roadmap for how DocAI can adapt (fine-tune) its entity extraction solutions across domains (document types). Balance long-term technology investments with short-term core priorities.
Communicate and collaborate broadly across multiple stakeholders in DocAI and Research.
Be involved, a deeply technical mentor, thought leader and innovator.
Build and experiment with model architectures and features in Tensorflow, data analysis and exploration. Design, implement and maintain distributed, highly-available NLP components for production use.
Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

At Shelf Engine, our mission is to reduce food waste through automation. We harness the power of AI to provide real-time, intelligent forecasting and fully automated ordering to food retailers across the United States. We're able to drastically reduce the amount of food waste generated while simultaneously maximizing sales and expanding margins for grocers—a triple win for suppliers and retailers, consumers, and the environment.
Shelf Engine is searching for a talented Senior Data Scientist to join our growing team. In this role, you will research, build, and launch new algorithms and solutions to solve complex problems for a rapidly evolving product. The goal is to help Shelf Engine develop best-in-class machine learning and advanced statistical models to achieve business objectives. You'll accomplish this by clarifying requirements, scoping projects, identifying appropriate algorithms from ideation to launch and iteration. If you have a passion for problem solving, working collaboratively with a great team of data scientists and engineers, and making a huge social impact, this may be your dream job.

As a Senior Data Scientist at Shelf Engine, you will:

Research, build, and launch machine learning and advanced statistical models to solve complex problems
Learn and share knowledge with the team to determine strategies, solutions, and initiatives
Provide technical mentorship and expand training to improve data science best practices
Design, analyze, and interpret the results of experiments
Work closely with Engineering, Operations, and Customer teams to identify problem areas and develop robust, scalable solutions
Embrace our company principles through inclusive, authentically-kind, and empathetic interactions with our team and our customers

And we think you would make a great Senior Data Scientist if you have:

3-5+ years industry experience with some combination of:
Experience putting models into production or with a live online system
Experience working with big data and standard tooling (e.g. Python, SQL, Spark)
Experience with performance monitoring and automated alerting
Experience with production ML tooling (e.g. Airflow, Databricks, Azure, AWS, or GCP)
You have worked in production and can incorporate testing, monitoring model performance, Git, and Airflow into your workflow.
You have experience in advanced machine learning, statistics, experimentation, and optimization.
You have a Masters/PhD degree in a STEM field.
You are authorized to work in the U.S. for any employer.

What Shelf Engine offers you:

A unique opportunity to join a fast-growing sustainability startup early on, making a meaningful impact on the team as well as the environment
An inclusive work environment that emphasizes each team member's personal and professional growth
Competitive salary in the range of $150,000-$175,000 depending on skills and experience
Pre-IPO equity with a four-year vesting schedule
PTO that is unlimited and self-managed for full-time employees
100% employer-paid premiums for medical, dental, and vision insurance for employees, and 50% covered for eligible dependents
Coverage for life insurance, short- and long-term disability, and access to a robust Employee Assistance Program
Optional employee contribution of pre-tax dollars to medical and dependent care FSA accounts
401k plan through Guideline to contribute to your financial future
Seattle only: Company-paid ORCA transit card

About Us:

At Shelf Engine, you will join a team of driven, passionate, and caring people hungry to make change in an untapped industry. We're not only solving complex technical problems at scale but also tackling key initiatives with significant environmental impacts. Our team is determined to disrupt a massive industry and leave behind a positive legacy for generations to come.

Shelf Engine is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Meta Platforms, Inc. (Meta), formerly known as Facebook Inc., builds technologies that help people connect, find communities, and grow businesses. When Facebook launched in 2004, it changed the way people connect. Apps and services like Messenger, Instagram, WhatsApp, and Novi further empowered billions around the world. Now, Meta is moving beyond 2D screens toward immersive experiences like augmented and virtual reality to help build the next evolution in social technology.Instructions on how to apply, click “Apply to Job” online on this web page.


Develop highly scalable classifiers and tools leveraging machine learning, data regression, and rules based models
Leverage expertise in machine learning, recommendation systems, pattern recognition, data mining and artificial intelligence to suggest, collect and synthesize requirements and create effective feature roadmap
Code deliverables in tandem with the engineering team
Adapt standard machine learning methods to best exploit modern parallel environments (eg distributed clusters, multicore SMP, and GPU)
Improve a range of classification and optimization problems, eg payment fraud, click-through rate prediction, click-fraud detection, search ranking, text/sentiment classification, collaborative filtering/recommendation, or spam detection


Employer will accept a PhD Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Sciences, Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, or related field and 6 months of work experience in job offered or in a data analyst or computer-related occupation. Experience must include 6 months of experience in each of the following:
Machine learning techniques
Programming languages C, C++ or Java
Developing in scripting language: PHP, Python, or Perl
Hadoop/HBase/Pig or Mapreduce/Sawzall/Bigtable
Large scale data processing infrastructures using distributed systems (Hadoop, Hive, MapReduce, or MPI).




Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.


Facebook is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. About TikTok
TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Mumbai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo.

Our team's mission is to empower content interaction and creation using speech & audio related technologies. We are focus on cutting-edge R&D in areas like speech & audio, music processing, natural language understanding and multimodal deep learning, we are looking for top talents to work on these exciting technologies, integrate them into various TikTok's products and ultimately bring the joy to our global user base!


Conduct cutting-edge research and development in speech & audio, multimodal processing (audio, vision and text), NLP and deep learning.
Transfer advanced technologies to TikTok's products.
Explore new products with AI technology at its core.
Masters or PhD in computer science, mathematics, engineering or related field;
Experience in one or more areas of speech & audio and deep learning, including but not limited to (prefer candidates with publications in top-tier venues such as ICASSP, INTERSPEECH, ASRU, NeurIPS, ICLR, etc.):
Speech recognition
Keyword spotting
Speaker recognition/diarization
Speech synthesis
Robust speech processing
Audio event detection
Natural language understanding & generation
Deep learning & representation learning
Multimodal ML in audio, vision and text.
Familiar with deep learning frameworks such as TensorFlow and Pytorch.
Highly competent in algorithms and programming; Strong coding skills in C/C++ and Python.
Ability to work collaboratively in a fast paced, multi-functional environment.

TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We believe individuals shouldn't be disadvantaged because of their background or identity, but instead should be considered based on their strengths and experience. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

TikTok is committed to providing reasonable accommodations during our recruitment process. If you need assistance or an accommodation, please reach out to us at Accommodations-AMS@tiktok.com.

Here at Meta, the Developer Advocacy team supports the relationship between Meta technologies software developers worldwide. Our Developer Advocates promote standards and good development practices by actively engaging with developer communities, raising awareness of the company's developer-centric activities, and guiding and educating those developers.Our team is highly technical and dedicated to open and honest communication, world-class software, and strong community citizenship.In this role, you will interact with the most innovative engineers inside and outside of Meta every day. You will write code samples, present demos, articles, and tutorials to promote and highlight a wide range of technology stacks, and relevant, contemporary software development techniques and trends.You will represent Meta at developer conferences, events, hackathons, and with the technical press and bloggers. You will work on open source software projects in a variety of programming languages. You will advocate internally for the developer community's needs, working with Facebook product and engineering teams to influence features and technology strategy.


Create code samples, demos, prototypes, articles, and tutorials to engage technical audiences at scale
Establish credibility with developers and developer communities as a thought leader
Own and drive community engagement for a range of technologies
Present technical sessions at conferences, running workshops, and hands-on hackathons
Liaise with the Facebook product and engineering teams to communicate third-party feedback
Collaborate with internal teams to understand and vocalize open source and developer community building strategies
Execute new strategies to increase and maximize engagement with the right audiences on the proper channels
Grow, manage, and maintain a positive public profile with the community at large


BA/BS in Computer Science, or an equivalent degree and experience
2+ years experience presenting to technical audiences
5+ years coding experience in contemporary languages and environments - such as JavaScript, PHP, Objective-C, Java, .NET, Python, Ruby - and in the open-source community, as candidates will complete Facebook's 6-week engineering bootcamp


Experience as a Developer Advocate
Advanced Degrees in Computer Science or some other Technical Field
Experience creating high-quality coding tutorials, videos, presentations and demos
Recognized as a thought leader in either AI/ML or React in the developer community
Experience contributing to and using open source technologies


Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.
