Facebook AI’s mission is to advance the state-of-the-art in artificial intelligence through fundamental and applied research in open collaboration with the community. Our work covers the full spectrum of topics related to AI, including deriving knowledge from data: theory, algorithms, applications, software infrastructure and hardware infrastructure. We actively engage with the community through publications, open-source software, participation in technical conferences and workshops, and collaborations with academia. Facebook AI researchers and engineers work from our offices around the globe. We're looking for an accomplished marketing leader to lead our AI marketing team. This person will be responsible for developing distinctive, effective and integrated marketing that builds our AI brand and accelerates the growth of our business. This role will drive our marketing strategy working closely with executive leadership and lead a high-performing team of brand, product, digital and experiential marketers. Our ideal candidate possesses sharp strategic instincts, experience demonstrating the short and long-term return of marketing investments, an understanding of innovation marketing and experience with technology influencer and research audiences. They will have the proven ability to build, support, and inspire a multi-disciplinary marketing team to do the best work of their careers. To be successful in the role, this person also will need to be a highly effective cross-functional leader, working in partnership with product, engineering, PR/Communications and creative/design teams, among others, and inspiring their teams to do the same.


Develop and drive the vision and strategy for our AI marketing team and adoption of our products
Lead and grow a multidisciplinary marketing team
Partner with product leadership to influence product and business strategy with a view of customer needs and market opportunities
Demonstrate the return of marketing investment for the business through both short and long-term measurement, across brand & performance metrics
Work across business functions to lead a global go-to-market strategy for our AI portfolio


15+ years experience in marketing
8+ years of people management experience
Experience developing integrated marketing strategies across paid, owned, earned and digital marketing channels
Experience demonstrating the return of marketing investment in the short and long-term
Experience partnering closely and driving alignment with Engineering, Product, and PR/Communications teams
Experience working on technology brands/products


Experience with innovation marketing
Experience marketing to technology influencer and research audiences


Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.


Facebook is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.Facebook is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations-ext@fb.com.

What we offer
Our company culture is focused on helping our employees enable innovation by building breakthroughs together. How? We focus every day on building the foundation for tomorrow and creating a workplace that embraces differences, values flexibility, and is aligned to our purpose-driven and future-focused work. We offer a highly collaborative, caring team environment with a strong focus on learning and development, recognition for your individual contributions, and a variety of benefit options for you to choose from. Apply now!
POSITION SUMMARY
We are seeking a Data Scientist to join us in reshaping the face of global commerce! SAP is uniquely positioned to achieve this task, as hundreds of billions of events, representing more than 75% of the world’s transaction revenue, touch an SAP system. Come join SAP's Intelligent Spend Management team (ISM). We are leveraging large amounts of heterogeneous “big data,” artificial intelligence, machine learning, and cutting-edge technologies to drive innovation and create insights for our customers.
As a Data Scientist on our team, you’ll join an agile, fun, and productive team of data scientists that are working to connect the world’s data and unlock new insights that will drive SAP innovations. To achieve this, you’ll partner closely with engineers in the Data & AI Platform team, who are working to build tools, services, and technologies to support large-scale data exploration.
The ideal candidate for this role will have a big-picture vision, a love of technology, and a can-do attitude with a passion to redefine norms and drive innovation. This is a high-impact role on a rapidly growing team, where you’ll have the opportunity to directly contribute to the success of the ISM team. This position will help define goals, create, and test models, and drive innovation in close collaboration and partnership with other researchers and engineers.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Work with data science team members, product managers, and external stakeholders to identify opportunities for new and innovative data analytics insights, metrics, and features.
Collaborate with other data scientists, product owners, and business/engineering teams to turn data into valuable and actionable insights for our customers.
Drive excellence in data science work, performing experiments, documenting results, analyzing data, delivering new models, analysis, and insights.
Develop and monitor metrics to evaluate the importance and success of data analytics, working to ensure their adoption and health.

REQUIRED SKILLS
BA/BS required, preferably in a quantitative field (e.g. Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Finance, Economics)
2+ years’ experience in data modeling and using data analytical tools and techniques (e.g., Python, SQL, Hadoop, R)
Proficient with data analysis and modeling software such as R and/or scripting languages such as Python
Experience with Cloud-based data processing and machine learning technologies such as Tensorflow, SageMaker, and ML Pipelines
Proficient at implementing both supervised and unsupervised machine learning models
Familiarity with statistical models and data mining algorithms
Familiarity with Data Science techniques such as clustering, anomaly detection, etc.
Ability to effectively communicate complex analysis to internal and external stakeholders at all levels
We are SAP
SAP innovations help more than 400,000 customers worldwide work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively. Originally known for leadership in enterprise resource planning (ERP) software, SAP has evolved to become a market leader in end-to-end business application software and related services for database, analytics, intelligent technologies, and experience management. As a cloud company with 200 million users and more than 100,000 employees worldwide, we are purpose-driven and future-focused, with a highly collaborative team ethic and commitment to personal development. Whether connecting global industries, people, or platforms, we help ensure every challenge gets the solution it deserves. At SAP, we build breakthroughs, together.
Our inclusion promise
SAP’s culture of inclusion, focus on health and well-being, and flexible working models help ensure that everyone – regardless of background – feels included and can run at their best. At SAP, we believe we are made stronger by the unique capabilities and qualities that each person brings to our company, and we invest in our employees to inspire confidence and help everyone realize their full potential. We ultimately believe in unleashing all talent and creating a better and more equitable world.
SAP is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to the values of Equal Employment Opportunity and provide accessibility accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team: Americas: Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA: Careers@sap.com.
EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability:

Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their age, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, age, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, et al), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, or disability.
Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.
 Requisition ID:301554 | Work Area: Software-Design and Development | Expected Travel: 0 - 10% | Career Status: Professional | Employment Type: Regular Full Time | Additional Locations: Virtual - USA

JobTitle: Principal, AWS Sports Marketing and Communications
Content_text:
10+ years of experience in technology communications, product , or sports technology
Ability to work autonomously with minimal direction
Exceptional writer and storyteller, understanding what needs to be communicated and to which audience
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, as well as the ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations
Experience with AWS or cloud computing technology, and communicating that to a target audience
Proven analytical skills to make data-driven decisions to drive recommendations and actions
Strong written and verbal skills to engage senior leaders across a number of functions
Experience creating go-to-market strategies, product strategies, and foundational messaging for top-name brands, regardless of industry
Bachelor’s Degree, or equivalent
Ability to work autonomously, develop ideas independently, and thrive in a fast-paced environment
Ability to travel regularly (25% - 50% travel)

We are seeking a passionate storyteller to build narratives about Amazon Web Services’ cutting-edge technology, and the sports organizations, teams, and media companies who use that technology to transform how sports are played, viewed, experienced, and understood.

As Principal, AWS Sports and Communications, you will be the primary architect for global campaigns that tell the story of how some of the world’s best sports organizations are using AWS innovative technologies to change the game—both internally and externally. You will work with engineers, data scientists, sports leagues, teams, and athletes to create multi-channel campaigns working across multiple teams and stakeholders to deliver high impact, best-in-class communications that result in a steady cadence of coverage, conversations, engagement, and awareness of cloud computing’s transformational impact.

The ideal candidate will have strong background in technology storytelling and knowledge of AWS innovations, understanding why these technologies are important, and communicating how AWS Sports partners use them to innovate for their respective sports. The Principal, AWS Sports and Communications will provide strategic counsel to influence executive decision-makers. In addition, this role will be tasked with coordination between multiple departments, including , social and digital to bring true, 360-degree campaigns to life. Ideal candidates will have previous experience with third-party event activations, partnerships, and dynamic content creation. This role will lead complex initiatives from vision to launch with significant autonomy. Ideal candidates are able to thrive in a fast-paced, high-pressure environment, with global brands and won’t be hindered by ambiguity. The communicator best positioned for this role understands the technology trends impacting sports and business (e.g., AI, ML, DL, OTT, IoT, and mobile) and will be able to create a cohesive vision of how AWS is helping to drive these trends in sports. You will need to be a leader in terms of high-quality judgment and decision-making, able to represent the business’s best interests while being customer obsessed and largely working independently. This position has high visibility across the org, all the way up to the AWS CEO.


5+ years working for a cloud computing technology provider, or similar
Deep understanding of innovative technologies such as machine learning, artificial intelligence, analytics, database, IoT, and more
Demonstrated ability to understand and discuss technical concepts, evaluate new ideas, and boil down deeply technical information to a broader audience
Understanding of Sports / Media business models
Live the Amazon Leadership Principles, particularly: Customer Obsession, Deliver Results, Bias for Action, Think Big, Disagree and Commit, Frugality, Dive Deep, Insist on the Highest Standards, and Learn and Be Curious.
A personal passion for sports and/or media technology

JobTitle: Global Training Delivery Mgr , AWS T&C Workforce Enablement...
Content_text:
5+ years of experience in training delivery role, developing internal mechanisms and metrics to enable demand planning for training across GEO's.
7+ years of experience leading small to medium sized training teams
Proven record of developing and retaining top technical trainer talent
Experience leading global roll outs of IT systems, programs and/or projects
Experience conducting classroom training for related technical/sales/PM/Learning products and services to enable employees.
College degree in IT/Computer Science, Organizational Effectiveness or equivalent

Job summary
As cloud technologies continue to transform businesses, skilled talent both internally and in the market is in high demand. At AWS Training and Certification (T&C), we are passionate about revolutionizing the way people advance their cloud skills and careers. We equip diverse builders of today and tomorrow with the knowledge they need to leverage the power of the AWS Cloud. Join our dynamic, fast-growing Workforce Enablement and Culture team and help us empower our internal employees through training, learning and career to make T&C a destination for talent.

To meet the growing demand for AWS Services around the globe, we need exceptionally talented, bright, and dedicated people that can thrive and grow in their career at AWS. If you have previous experience leading training delivery, global work experience working with high tech organizations and are interested have a builder mindset this role is for you! We are looking for a dynamic, organized self-starter to join our Workforce Enablement and Culture team.

Here's your chance to work as a Training Delivery Manager on a newly formed team, with high visibility and significant impact. You will execute on training programs that include delivering training both internal and external T&C employees. We are in the early stages of building new services, products and programs to transform teams, upskill employees and create a learning mindset. Our courses cover various domains both non-technical and technical, and serve a broad range of critical job functions across the business.

In this role, you and your team will deliver training content to a wide variety of internal teams in T&C. You will have an opportunity to combine a passion for teaching, with enthusiasm for technology, to drive learning and establish positive relationships that inform our business and create high performing teams.

The successful candidate is an experienced L&D trainer, preferably with hands-on experience using AWS products and services, leadership development, soft skills, in-depth knowledge of training systems, excellent communication skills, with a proven record of developing and retaining top talent.

Here are some other qualities we are looking for:
The ability to engage deeply with leaders, individuals and engagement specialists across the field to plan for scale. Solving problems at scale is what makes our teams unique. You will dive deep with our product engineering teams to define our Learning Platform program plans and listen to customers to enable rapid innovation. Enjoy working with internal 'customers' of all shapes and sizes. You will have a passion for managing a complex set of priorities for a diverse and challenging set of customers whether they are large or small. You will showcase your experience communicating and gaining business agreements across internal and external organizations.

***This position is approved to be in Seattle, or HQ2***

Responsibilities:

Build and manage a small team of trainers, monitor their performance and work to develop them to the next level.
Observe each of your trainers at least 3x per year; increase the number of observations with less tenured trainers.
Play an effective role in the onboarding and ramping of new trainers to your team and in the organization.
Lead hiring efforts by conducting phone screens and in-person interviews to identify top talent.
Deliver instructor-led classroom training to end-user customers and partners at least quarterly, to stay sharp on content, delivery skills and know what customers are asking for.
Assist in developing and maintaining training content, lab exercises, presentations, and accompanying materials.
Engage with a virtual, diverse team, Lead projects to drive process efficiency, and exceed customer expectations.

Please note this role will require ~20% travel.

About Us
As cloud technologies continue to transform businesses, skilled individuals are in high demand. At AWS Training and Certification (T&C), we are passionate about revolutionizing the way people advance their cloud skills and careers. We equip diverse builders of today and tomorrow with the knowledge they need to leverage the power of the AWS Cloud. Join our dynamic, fast-growing team and help us empower our customers to build cloud skills.
Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have twelve employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.
Work/Life Balance
Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.

Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded employee and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.


Dedicated self-starter with proven success taking ownership of training projects
Excellent oral presentation skills, interpersonal communication, and writing skills
Knowledge and/or hands-on experience with AWS infrastructure services highly desired
A strong “stage presence” and ability to manage a classroom of adult learners
Experience designing and developing instructor-led content with technical subject matter content
Subject matter experience and experience in at least two of the following:
Artificial Intelligence (AI)
Big Data
DevOps
Internet of Things (IoT)
Large scale application or data center migration
Machine Learning (ML)
Serverless computing
Software Engineering or Application Development
Solutions Architecture
System Operations

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us

Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

JobTitle: Senior Strategy Officer, Foundation Strategy Office
Content_text:
The Foundation Strategy Office (FSO) is the primary function supporting the creation and evolution of our program level strategies, as well as exploring new paths to impact that align with our mission. This includes supporting the CEO, CFO and Chief Strategy Officer in key accountabilities including strategy development, strategy revision, strategy performance measurement, portfolio management, and special initiatives to accelerate the impact of the foundation.
Leadership & Culture
Our culture shapes our choices about what we do and how we do it. We believe that energized people, working well together, fueled by great leadership in an inclusive environment can do extraordinary things. We expect foundation employees to intentionally and consistently embody our four agreements; show respect, offer trust, be transparent, and create energy.
Position Summary
The Senior Strategy Officer (SSO)will lead critical strategy projects within the foundation (see past examples below), while managing 1-2 associates on the central strategy team. The SSO will help design high quality qualitative and quantitative analyses, elevate key insights, communicate those insights with senior foundation partners, and engage in ongoing project and client management. In addition to these project-based responsibilities, you will support and advise senior foundation leaders on an ongoing basis and act as a leader within the FSO strategy team.
The Senior Strategy Officer will report to the Deputy Director, Strategy. On a project-by-project basis, the SSO may also report to Directors and other Deputy Directors within the FSO team.
Core Responsibilities
Lead strategy development (including multiple complex projects at a time):
Lead scoping and design of overall strategy development and act as day-to-day manager or senior manager of strategy development
Liaise closely with internal clients to co-develop and test strategy concepts, and facilitate change management
Bring a customer-focused skillset of effective communication and relationship management to partner engagement
Support the implementation of creative solutions to guide group processes (e.g., managing conflict and encouraging alignment).
Identify and oversee implementation of research and analytical work to support decision-making, including quantitative analyses
Manage high levels of ambiguity within and across strategy projects:
Provide recommendations to improve overall foundation strategic planning and management process based upon experience supporting teams.
Contribute to and participate in ongoing improvement of the Strategy team including overall vision, brand, staffing composition, operational processes, performance management, etc.
Provide project management, problem-solving support, and initiative leadership on cross-foundational strategy projects
Develop thought leadership in select areas and maintain an executive-level point of view on the foundation’s work
Regularly contribute to team development by contributing in one or more of the following: team vision and goal refinement, professional development, training, recruiting, onboarding, team social events and retreats, etc.
Participate in foundation-wide activities (e.g., learning sessions, all staff meetings, performance reviews)
Representative Project Examples
End-to-end support in scoping, developing, and launching new foundation strategies. Past examples include Global Education and Gender Equality.
End-to-end support to programmatic Directors and their leadership teams as they revise foundation strategies (“strategy refreshes”). Past examples include Malaria, Family Planning, MNCH, Nutrition, Philanthropic Partnerships, K-12 Education, and others.
Spearheading cross-cutting foundation strategy initiatives sponsored by the foundation’s Executive Leadership Team. Examples include:
Developing a strategy taxonomy to enable consistent development and articulation of strategy across program teams
Facilitating cross-team exploration of new technologies (Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning) on development topics
Core Knowledge & Skills
We are looking for team members who enjoy working on complex problems and collaboratively crafting strategies that have the potential to transform the lives of people around the world. We seek team players who are excited to work across a diverse set of disciplines and issue areas.
Deep knowledge of strategy development and end-to-end complex project management (including process design, team structure, critical thinking requirements, development of novel communication resources and external/senior partner engagement).
Ability to learn new content quickly, identify connections and second-order implications and demonstrate proficiency with internal/external teams. Strong pattern recognition grounded in relevant domain knowledge.
Demonstrated strength in structured problem solving and strategic business planning, with the ability to easily identify and communicate frameworks to facilitate strategy creation and analyze core issues.
Excellent interpersonal skills and demonstrated ability to rapidly build trusted advisor relationships with senior leaders.
Strong management experience and demonstrated ability to help accelerate growth of direct reports.
Ability to work in a self-guided manner, manage multiple priorities and work towards demanding timelines.
Ability to question and challenge colleagues including managers and partners in constructive manner.
Accustomed to highly unstructured and ambiguous situations; ability to actively resolve.
Excellent organizational, facilitation, oral, and written communication skills. Ability to work effectively and with sensitivity across barriers such as language, culture, and distance. Excellent listening skills and compassion.
Excellent software skills with Microsoft Office applications, including a demonstrated ability to convey complex information using supporting tables, graphs, and other visual representations.
Ability to travel up to 20% domestically and internationally.
A sense of humor.
Commitment to the foundation’s core values, mission, and programs with an approach that is consistent with the foundation’s guiding principles and holding self to the highest ethical standards.
Education & Experience
A minimum of 7+ years of progressive accountability, ideally with dual experience in leading projects both at a top tier strategy consulting firm and in private sector corporate strategy or product management.
MBA or other advanced degree in a relevant field such as Business, Economics or Sciences preferred but not required.The foundation requires a COVID-19 vaccination for in-person business in the United States. Therefore, all U.S. employees are required to present proof of vaccination status upon hire unless they qualify for a medical or religious exemption.Must be able to legally work in the country where this position is located without visa sponsorship.
As part of our standard hiring process for new employees, employment with the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation will be contingent upon successful completion of a background check.
The Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation is dedicated to the belief that all lives have equal value. We’re committed to creating a workplace where employees thrive both personally and professionally. We also believe our employees should reflect the rich diversity of the global populations we aim to serve—in race, gender, age, cultures and beliefs—and we support this diversity through all of our employment practices.
All applicants and employees who are drawn to serve the mission of the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation will enjoy equality of opportunity and fair treatment without regard to:RaceColorAgeReligionPregnancySexSexual OrientationDisabilityGender IdentityGender ExpressionNational OriginGenetic InformationVeteran StatusMarital StatusPrior Protected Activity

As a UW employee, you have a unique opportunity to change lives on our campuses, in our state and around the world. UW employees offer their boundless energy, creative problem solving skills and dedication to build stronger minds and a healthier world.


UW faculty and staff also enjoy outstanding benefits, professional growth opportunities and unique resources in an environment noted for diversity, intellectual excitement, artistic pursuits and natural beauty.


The Global Innovation Exchange (GIX) is a partnership founded by the University of Washington, Tsinghua University, and Microsoft that brings together leading universities and cross-sector partners committed to experiential learning and technological innovation in a global context. Together we provide project-based graduate degree programs and a growing array of innovation experiences for students, executives and professionals, in a variety of flexible formats.


Our model of experiential education values inclusivity, social awareness, and responsibility, and prioritizes the ability to collaborate across the traditional boundaries and borders of disciplines, cultures, sectors, and organizations. We aim to respond nimbly to developing technology and evolving market demands, to provide the most relevant and valuable education to our learners.


GIX and its UW programs are headquartered in a 100,000-square-foot, state-of-the-art facility in Bellevue’s Spring District, a growing center of business and retail activity located just 10 miles from the UW campus. We have an exceptional opportunity for an experienced professional interested in leading the development of new, self-sustaining professional learning programs. The individual in this position reports directly to the GIX Executive Director and will develop and manage programs geared towards executives, managers, and leaders across various sectors who are interested in emerging technologies, principles of innovation, and practices informed by scholarship and a global approach.


We have an outstanding opportunity for a Director, Professional Learning Programs.


Under the supervision of the Executive Director, the Director will oversee the Global Innovation Exchange (GIX) Professional Learning Program (PLP) leading the development and execution of strategies and goals; plan, direct and control program budget and other related resources. As staff leader of GIX PLP, the Director is responsible for all aspects of the learning experience for students, faculty, and industry partners, including scaling up the PLP.


The Director leads the PLP and acts as liaison between GIX leadership and staff, Tsinghua University staff, and other relevant campus offices. The Director must have the ability to act independently and responsibly, given general direction from GIX leadership and the constraints of University policies and procedures. The Director has a comprehensive range of responsibilities, including general administration, project management, customer relations, event coordination, contract negotiation and execution, and other administrative functions, participation in and support overall GIX programs. The Director may serve in a variety of administrative roles and must demonstrate effective business acumen, administrative judgment, strong communication and innovative ability.


Build and sustain key relationships with industry, faculty and staff to ensure successful outcomes of programs. Scale program to meet and support the long-term GIX goal. Contribute to the UW-GIX goals of breaking down silos between academic disciplines, between academia and private/public sectors, and between global locations.


DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES


The Director will develop a business strategy for PLP and is responsible for setting and meeting short-term program goals in support of GIX’s strategic plan, working with the GIX Director of Operations to ensure necessary infrastructure and coordinate resources and opportunities with other GIX programs. The PLP Director must be aware of other executive education and innovation training programs, as well as the relevant policies and practices related to the allocation of resources and effort at the University of Washington, in order to anticipate and mitigate operational and strategic risks involved in establishing such programs.


The Director has complete programmatic responsibility and delegated decision making for GIX Professional Learning Programs, including budget development and monitoring, marketing and communications, program logistics, management of staff and subject matter leads, and all related initiatives, projects, activities, events, and information sessions. The Director leverages the operational support and infrastructure of GIX wherever possible to enable an efficient and cost-effective start-up, until programs are sustainable and dedicated resources are necessary.


OPERATIONS


Establish and direct all aspects of PLP operations at GIX:


Establish and maintain PLP business processes. Maintain effective operations that contribute to achieving organizational goals; regularly evaluate and update for continuous improvement. Create annual PLP budget, oversee development of individual program budgets, and contribute to short- and long-term expense and revenue projections. Contribute to organizational budgeting, accounting, and MOU development processes, working collaboratively with GIX fiscal and operations support staff as needed. Oversee timely processing of revenue and payments for associated faculty and vendors. Contribute to the selection, management, and use of shared tools including payment processor, accounting tool, forms, CMS, and CRM.

Oversee customer relations and communications. Create plans, programs, and tools that build and support strong relationships as well as exceptional customer service and user experience. Implement policies and procedures to manage issues and promote PLP activities. Respond to constituent inquiries and requests. Develop and maintain promotional materials and products, and PLP section of the GIX web site.

Lead hiring, management, and evaluation of PLP staff, including current staff (PLP program manager and data science subject matter/vertical lead) and future subject matter leads, technical experts, and staff hired to support operations and program offerings. Work with Director of Operations to coordinate effort of GIX staff and contribute to evaluations as appropriate.

Implement a data-based approach. Compile statistics, reports, and provide analysis for program demand, profile of clients, trends, etc. Assess individual program effectiveness, and recommends changes to program's content, policies and procedures accordingly. Analyze, summarize, and/or review data; report findings, interpret results and/or make recommendations to the Executive Director as to curriculum, faculty, instruction, space, fee structure, etc.

Serve on the GIX leadership team. Participate in biweekly meetings and quarterly retreats. Help develop and achieve GIX goals and objectives. Coordinate strategies for recruiting, fundraising, and outreach.

Represent PLP, GIX, and the UW, at professional meetings, seminars, and conferences. Collaborate with internal and external partners, and represent the program to outside organizations, constituencies and the general public.

Other duties as assigned, including evening and weekend work as required by programmatic and business need.


PLANNING & DEVELOPMENT


Direct the development of a business, marketing and outreach plans:


Direct the development of a scale-up plan and path to sustainability for GIX Professional Learning Programs. Working with the Executive Director and PLP pilot team, assess initial program offerings and vertical plan. Identify key areas of growth, demand, opportunity, and integration with other GIX programs. Identify resource and support needs. Use findings to inform the financial model and full-scale implementation. Identify new revenue streams or sources of funding; apply for grants or external support for the program.

Manage program identity and marketing strategies, leveraging knowledge of GIX faculty, staff, and subject matter experts. Identify competitors, customer targets, and market segments to create effective value propositions and inform marketing strategies. Manage program communications and implementation of marketing plan in coordination with GIX marketing manager, leveraging existing GIX channels as appropriate. Coordinate branding, identity, and messaging with GIX marketing manager, working with external contractors as necessary to develop marketing materials and collateral.

Cultivate, build, and sustain relationships with clients, partners and prospects and coordinate with advancement and Industry relations. Build pipeline of prospects for programs, working closely with subject matter experts and the Director of Industry Relations. Coordinate on Consortium benefits and strategic engagement of Consortium members with the Director of Industry Relations.


EDUCATIONAL INFRASTRUCTURE & PROGRAMS


Oversee individual programs in key verticals:


Direct scale-up of individual programs. In consultation with the Executive Director, develop a model for expanding programs in key verticals where GIX has unique value propositions (data science, design thinking, busines strategy, etc.). Establish a framework for measuring outcomes/effectiveness of offerings and evaluating instructors. Find subject experts to collaboratively design courses and educational experiences, teach, and lead development of programs. Seek untapped faculty, research programs, or other resources that could contribute to educational offerings.

Oversee development of individual programs. For each subject matter area work with leads to:

o research and develop flexible curriculum format appropriate to program audience.

o ensure curriculum is relevant and timely.

o get input from partners and relevant experts.

o plan, promote, and deliver workshops, course sessions and information sessions.

o oversee development of custom programs and consulting opportunities for US and international clients, writing proposals as needed.

o develop course budgets and pricing structures.

o offer course credit where possible.

Manage internal relationships. Ensure productive collaboration and relationships with partner departments, faculty, lecturers and other university units. Identify, address, and mitigate unforeseen events that may negatively impact relationships between the campus and various constituencies, keeping leadership team appropriately advised and notified.


Requirements include:


Bachelor’s degree in business, communications, engineering, or a related field.

At least 6 years of experience working in an academic or industry setting, preferably managing programs and leading teams.

Ability and willingness to work in both a leadership role and an implementation role as part of a high- functioning team.

Demonstrated organizational and analytical skills sufficient to prioritize, form strategic plans, and build a program from inception to operation.

Knowledge of administrative, budgetary, human resources and financial principles and practices, and experience applying and interpreting a broad range of policies and procedures.

Advanced oral and written communication skills, used in situations requiring political acumen, conflict management, and an awareness of cultural differences; demonstrated experience and ability to communicate effectively, including empathetic listening, presentations and public speaking. Ability to persuade and influence people over whom you have no formal authority.

Professional demeanor and ability to effectively interact with a broad community of faculty, researchers, scientists, industrial partners, program managers, staff, students, and funding agencies, and to work collaboratively with internal and external peers and managers. Demonstrated commitment to diversity and experience working with individuals from different cultural, ethnic, geographic, and experiential backgrounds.

Attention to detail, ability to think strategically and creatively, gather appropriate input, and act decisively.

Equivalent education/experience will substitute for all minimum qualifications except when there are legal requirements, such as a license/certification/registration.


Desired:


Graduate degree in business, administration, or a related field.
Demonstrated experience developing and marketing academic programs on new topics or managing executive education programs.
Knowledge of or experience working in academia.
Understanding of the market for higher ed programs, credentialing options, and industry training programs and education benefits.
Experience hiring trainers, instructors, or technical experts.
Technical background, knowledge, and/or interest in emerging technologies including data science, AI, quantum computing, digital transformation in a global context.
Demonstrated ability to cost customized programs for a net financial gain. Experience with budgeting, budget development, and appropriate overhead and costing mechanisms in a university setting.


Working Environmental Conditions


Ability to work evening and weekend hours, as necessary, on short or limited notice.
Must have regular and reliable transportation for local travel and willing to travel when necessary. Frequent local travel expected


As a UW employee, you will enjoy generous benefits and work/life programs. For a complete description of our benefits for this position, please visit our website, click here.


Application Process:


The application process for UW positions may include completion of a variety of online assessments to obtain additional information that will be used in the evaluation process. These may include Work Authorization, Cover Letter and/or others. Any assessments that you need to complete will appear on your screen as soon as you select “Apply to this position”. Once you begin an assessment, it must be completed at that time; if you do not complete the assessment, you will be prompted to do so the next time you access your “My Jobs” page. If you select to take it later, it will appear on your "My Jobs" page to take when you are ready. Please note that your application will not be reviewed, and you will not be considered for this position until all required assessments have been completed.


Applicants considered for this position will be required to disclose if they are the subject of any substantiated findings or current investigations related to sexual misconduct at their current employment and past employment. Disclosure is required under Washington state law.

Committed to attracting and retaining a diverse staff, the University of Washington will honor your experiences, perspectives and unique identity. Together, our community strives to create and maintain working and learning environments that are inclusive, equitable and welcoming.
The University of Washington is a leader in environmental stewardship & sustainability, and committed to becoming climate neutral.
The University of Washington is an affirmative action and equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, age, protected veteran or disabled status, or genetic information.
To request disability accommodation in the application process, contact the Disability Services Office at 206-543-6450 or dso@uw.edu.
COVID-19 VACCINATION REQUIREMENT
Governor Inslee's Proclamation 21-14.2 requires employees of higher education and healthcare institutions to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 unless a medical or religious exemption is approved. Being fully vaccinated means that an individual is at least two weeks past their final dose of an authorized COVID-19 vaccine regimen. As a condition of employment, newly hired employees will be required to provide proof of their COVID-19 vaccination. View the Final candidate guide to COVID-19 vaccination requirement webpage for information about the medical or religious exemption process for final candidates.

The Project Assistant provides general support for overall office activities and programs.
Note: This position is not eligible for remote work.
The Urban Indian Health Institute is a division of the Seattle Indian Health Board, a community clinic providing COVID-19 testing and other healthcare services targeting the urban American Indian and Alaska Native population in King County. All SIHB employees are considered essential critical infrastructure workers under Washington’s Stay Home, Stay Healthy executive order.
DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:
Provide effective telephone and email communications both internally and externally, including effective and timely meeting scheduling for UIHI staff and collaborators.
Answer, screen, and forward any incoming inquiries regarding trainings while providing basic information, including, but not limited to, company information, application processes, and other UIHI-related information.
Draft and update announcements, letters, tables, charts, maps, data tables, graphs, and other visual aids for dissemination on websites, on social media channels, at conferences, and during in-person presentations.
Assist Communications Associate in maintaining and updating UIHI social media outlets including, but not limited to, Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, and YouTube,
Collect training announcements, funding opportunities, and news for inclusion in the UIHI Bi-Weekly Resource Email (BWRE). Responsible for timely release of BWRE.
Post announcements on UIHI website.
Plan, staff, and support outreach events under direction of BRANCH Project Associate, AMR/MSPI Project Associate, and UIHI Executive Assistant. Responsibilities include, but are not limited to, scheduling staff and volunteers, arranging payments, purchasing supplies, transporting promotional materials, and in-person tabling.
Process travel reimbursements for UIHI staff.
Process all outgoing UIHI mail using postage meter printing. This includes assistance with ordering and printing letters, reports, posters, and other outgoing mail materials.
Attend all SIHB Research Review Committee meetings, draft meeting agenda, and disseminate minutes and follow-up action items to all attendees.
Perform and assist with clerical duties, including, but not limited to, filing, photocopying, faxing, configuring video and web conferencing accounts, and scheduling conference calls.
Under direction of UIHI Executive Assistant, maintain adequate office supplies by checking stock to manage inventory levels and anticipating supply requirements. Place and expedite orders, verify receipt, and stock items. Complete Materials Requisition forms for UIHI and Communications staff.
Actively participate in internal quality-improvement teams. Work with UIHI staff members to proactively drive quality improvement initiatives in accordance with the mission and strategic goals of the organization; federal, state, and local laws and regulations; and accreditation standards, as applicable.
Other job-related duties as assigned.
QUALIFICATIONS:
Maintains confidentiality for sensitive materials.
Works well under pressure, meeting multiple and often competing deadlines.
Consistently demonstrates cooperative behavior with supervisors, subordinates, colleagues, clients, patients, and the community.
Has experience working with the unique healthcare needs and social issues of American Indians and Alaska Natives (AI/AN) and the desire to promote delivery of appropriate research and epidemiology services for AI/AN communities.
Successful completion of professional reference and background check.
EDUCATION:
High school diploma or GED equivalence. Some college preferred.
SKILLS:
One year of office experience preferred.
Proficiency in computer applications. Experience with Microsoft Office Suite, Adobe Creative Cloud, and general database management skills required.
Excellent attention to detail and organizational skills.
Demonstrates strong written and verbal communication skills.
Experience with public-facing community outreach.
Some knowledge of content creation and publication on social media channels and websites.
Working knowledge of office equipment and filing systems.
Dependable, well organized, and service-oriented with demonstrated ability to work independently with minimal supervision.
Flexibility to work occasional varied shifts, which may include weekends.

Are you passionate about technology? Are you looking to build a sales career at an established and evolving company? As an Account Manager at Cisco you’ll play a pivotal role in the sales process and work with a large portfolio of technology products and services. You’ll help advance the Commercial Sales team to make our customers’ lives better and easier.
Who You’ll Work With
The US Commercial vision is transforming business through the power of people and technology. Our Organization is focused on the US Mid Market, the 5th largest economy in the world, with a broad portfolio of small, medium and large customers across all vertical markets with the exception of public sector. US Commercial has a diverse set of partners and ecosystem. US Commercial has an incredible culture built upon Focused Execution, Technical Excellence, Collaboration and Fun!
Who You Are
You have in-depth knowledge of selling processes. (i.e., strategic account planning, extended resource engagement, sales cycle, etc) as well as a focus on driving Cisco opportunities in all sites and subsidiaries.
You are strategic with your accounts and planning and have an understanding of the technical aspects of data center, Enterprise software sales & cloud services/solutions.
You will also be responsible for weekly, monthly and quarterly forecast accuracy, pipeline development and customer satisfaction. Team selling required
Skills and Experience
You bring 5+ years of technology sales experience
You can demonstrate strong knowledge of leading a large account, including forecasting, quota attainment, sales presentations skills, and short/mid/long term opportunity management is needed.
Requires validated knowledge of the market and strong technical knowledge preferred. You have the ability to deliver business value to the account and build on customer relationships.
You bring proven knowledge of working with complex strategic accounts including calls on key decision makers and all other levels of the account.
You are a self-starter; little supervision required.
You are able to demonstrate skills of negotiation with peers, partners and customers using a Win/Win philosophy. You position end-to-end solutions and articulate Cisco strategies to senior customer executives with ease.
We Are Cisco
#WeAreCisco, where each person is unique, but we bring our talents to work as a team and make a difference. Here’s how we do it.
We embrace digital, and help our customers implement change in their digital businesses. Some may think we’re “old” (30 years strong!) and only about hardware, but we’re also a software company. And a security company. A blockchain company. An AI/Machine Learning company. We even invented an intuitive network that adapts, predicts, learns and protects. No other company can do what we do – you can’t put us in a box!
But “Digital Transformation” is an empty buzz phrase without a culture that allows for innovation, creativity, and yes, even failure (if you learn from it.)
Day to day, we focus on the give and take. We give our best, we give our egos a break and we give of ourselves (because giving back is built into our DNA.) We take accountability, we take bold steps, and we take difference to heart. Because without diversity of thought and a commitment to equality for all, there is no moving forward.
So, you have colorful hair? Don’t care. Tattoos? Show off your ink. Like polka dots? That’s cool.
We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

Microsoft Speech team is looking for talented scientists or software design engineers. This is a great opportunity to join a strong team to work on the forefront of artificial intelligence! You will be able to work closely with world class scientists and engineering leaders to define the future. In this position, you will experience a wide range of technology spectrum and solve challenging problems that really matter.
Responsibilities
Preferred Qualifications:

JobTitle: Content and Communications Leader - AWS Public Sector Partne...
Content_text:
15+ years of demonstrated experience in executive marketing and/or communications, inclusive of global experience and technology focused
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent

Job summary
Amazon Web Services, a leader in cloud computing, is seeking an experienced, analytical, strategic and creative leader to develop and drive high-impact content and communications strategies for a diverse and rapidly growing global sales organization. This role is both highly strategic and hands-on, requiring an entrepreneurial big thinker who is also willing to roll up their sleeves and get things done.

You will be responsible for building a content strategy to be used as the driving force for external points of view. This will enable sales leaders and teams to communicate information consistently and effectively throughout the organization. The ideal candidate will have demonstrated success in operationalizing content and communications workflows and building mechanisms that enable communication at scale within large, fast-moving, global organizations and building out. The ideal candidate is also required to have had content creation and communications experience in key technologies including Cloud, AI/ML, IoT and Security. The candidate is required to have strong attention to detail, along with exceptional writing skills for both original content as well as rewriting and optimizing content from subject matter experts are essential. Deep knowledge of creating technical presentations is required as well as experience in developing blogs. This role will work with stakeholders across AWS Sales, Business Development, Professional Services, Solutions Architecture, Partners, and Marketing. The successful candidate must be able to communicate effectively across multiple technical and non-technical business units, as well as across other geographies.

Core Roles and Responsibilities:

Develop and drive an external technology focused content and communications framework that enables cross-functional stakeholders and partners to achieve their business goals
Create high-impact technical content for usage across a range of channels that educate, engage, and inspire our partners and customers
Work closely and communicate effectively with partners, AWS sales and partner teams, and AWS HQ teams around the world using different communications mediums and platforms.
Operationalize content and communication workflows, including a 2021 plan, to build repeatable mechanisms to facilitate communication at scale
Implement reporting and define and manage to success measurements for all communications related materials
Own and build deliverables such as presentations, blogs and scripted content
Monitor and measure the effectiveness of communications through digital analytics, surveys, and other key performance indicators.

Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and we host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance
Our team also puts a high value on work-life balance. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here, which is why we aren’t focused on how many hours you spend at work or online. Instead, we’re happy to offer a flexible schedule so you can have a more productive and well-balanced life—both in and outside of work.

Mentorship and Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

This role can be based anywhere in the U.S. which is located near an AWS Corporate Office.


Demonstrated experience in public sector
Demonstrated experience in cloud computing technology
Demonstrated ability to navigate highly ambiguous scenarios with competing priorities and multiple stakeholders
Demonstrated ability to thrive in a high pressure environment
Demonstrated organizational skills and attention-to-detail with the ability to multi-task and prioritize well in a fast paced, dynamic work environment
Demonstrated experience providing creative practical solutions to problems
Demonstrated experience of partner/channel relationships and sales strategies
Meets/exceeds Amazon’s functional/technical depth and complexity
Meets/exceeds Amazon’s leadership principles requirements for this role
Demonstrated writing and presentation skills, and the ability to articulate complex, technical concepts to cross functional audiences and develop written material for external stakeholders

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

Our team in Microsoft Azure AI is working on cutting-edge NLP and Deep Learning models to power Microsoft AI products and build it as a service to serve many external applications. The team is focused on applying deep learning techniques to solve AI problems such as Natural Language to Code, adaptation of large-scale language models, Question Answering on structured data, including the No-code low-code AI models in Power Platform, the copilot project in the collaboration with Github, question answering on structure/unstructured data, GPT-3 fine-tuning, and various customer-facing products. In addition, we work on customization and pretraining of large-scale language models for AI services.
We are a hybrid team at the intersection of research and product, with positions ranging from researchers and applied scientists to software engineers. Our team has the flexibility to tackle challenging and exciting research problems that are highly related to product requirements. For this position, we are hiring for the NL to Code project to work on no-code AI model for Power Platform and other exciting NL2Code and Safety projects to improve its model quality.
Publication in top conferences as a byproduct is encouraged with lots of opportunities to collaborate with professors and students at top universities, as well as mentoring summer interns. We track and work on state-of-the-art natural language understanding (NLU) models targeting high-visibility and world-class AI leaderboards. We have previously held the top positions in a few of them, such #1 in WikiSQL, SciTail, SWAG, SNLI, SQuAD, and the significant human parity achievements in both GLUE and SuperGLUE. You may also see some of our recent papers such as LoRA, DeBERTa and R-Adam.
We are looking for a passionate, creative, analytical individual who loves NLP, deep learning, machine learning, and wants to ship products quickly at a massive scale.
Responsibilities
As a Principal ML Engineer, you will work with other researchers, data scientists, and engineers in the team to design and build the end-to-end pipeline covering model training, data analysis, model serving and user interaction log analysis, especially in the NL2Code scenarios, such as copilot.
You will own an area that is highly relying on the feedback data and generate new insights for the end-to-end NL2Code applications. You shall be capable to fine-tune the existing large language model to showcase the values from the data or any change on the model structure.
You will also need to clearly communicate and demonstrate your work to the stakeholders to amplify the values from your work or your collaborations with the team members.
There are also opportunities for a Lead position if you are both great in engineering, machine learning and leadership skills.
Qualifications
Required Qualifications:
5+ years’ experience in machine learning, natural language processing or deep learning.
Preferred Qualifications:
PhD degree is a plus but not a must, with big passion in deep learning models, and willing to collaborate with AI experts and engineers in the team.
Experienced in semantic parsing and NL2Code, Programming language, Safety is a big plus.
Passion and experience to build large-scale AI models as general AI services to empower many organizations and people.
Strong ML and numeric optimization experience are a plus
Rich experienced in Python and deep learning library, such as Pytorch
Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances.
Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

Our Company

Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.

We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!
The Opportunity
Adobe is seeking an Engineering Manager to help us build the next generation of Adobe Spark. We're building web apps and supporting services to democratize the visual design process. We use AI techniques and Adobe technologies to enable anyone to author bespoke designs with mixed media, motion and typography. We're looking for someone with a strong technical background in the areas of Motion, Rendering, and Layout who knows how to:
Work collaboratively with peers across fields
Guide a diverse team of engineers to deliver high quality releases on a continuous cycle using standard methodologies for agile development
Develop a balanced and flexible team through both diversity and providing opportunities to learn and innovate
Build modern, well architected web front-ends that can be delivered as a web app or TWA mobile app, using powerful back-end technologies and Artificial Intelligence to build Adobe magic
What You'll Do
To ensure the continued success of a dynamic and engaged technical team, your core responsibilities will be to:
Lead a team of software engineers through technical design, implementation, delivery, and maintenance of software
Maintain effective communication and collaboration with partner teams, both local and remote, in completing interdependent work items
Influence design decisions and technical direction for engineers, QE, product managers, user experience designers, and senior leaders
Ensure transparency of project status to leaders & partners
Employ ongoing performance feedback and mentorship
Work with each team member in identifying and making progress toward career development goals
Incentivize quality code and effective communication
Partner with designers and business leaders to provide an outstanding customer experience
Engage with customers to identify problems, test ideas, and refine workflows
Promote modern technical standards
Desired Competencies and Experience
Experience with Imaging, 2D and 3D Rendering Engines, Graphics, Animation, Video, Typography or Layout are highly desirable
BS or MS in Computer Science or equivalent
Demonstrated experience managing or leading development teams through full product delivery cycles
7+ years of engineering experience, 3+ as a manager
Experience using common software development methodologies and software design patterns and have experience leading significant software projects/products.
Strong skills in JavaScript/HTML/CSS, experience with Web
Components, Vue, React, Angular or equivalent frameworks
Experience and desire for data driven development
